content: Great app and it helps me a lot when I'm looking for a to rest
replyContent: Hello Davi, Thank you for your feedback and the great review! We are happy to hear that you find your trivago app great :) Best, Amber @trivago

content: I've tried using the app with a shared list for grocery shopping with my partner. When one of us adds a new item to the list, it rarely populates on the other person's list. We've had this issue both using Apple devices and Android devices. We have restarted devices, uninstalled and reinstalled the app, and checked to make sure our devices are updated, but nothing seems to make a difference.

This App Was Great, Until It Wasn't. This app did what it was meant to do in syncing to do lists that I shared with others. It synced to all my devices and multi account was great to also have the to do list from my work. This recently the app started demanding me to sign into it repeatingly every 30 seconds. I tried every troubleshooting step including clearing cache and storage, reinstalling, different login methods. This issue won't go away and has made it unusable. Moving to a new platform.

Updated: This app is an epic fail. Not only can you not drag and drop the order of the list but editing inside a note barely functions. Limited scheduling options for reminders. It does one thing very well that it's previous code couldn't is sync with Miicrosoft alerts. The shame is the pigs ear that gets synced. We barely use it for a household list not. Professionally switched to another app.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback and we are sorry for the inconvenience caused to you. To help us fixing the exact issue, can you share more details about the issue at todofeedback@microsoft.com or from the app (Settings -> Customer Support). Thanks!

content: This was a fine app until more integrations and "smart" features were added. STOP re-enabling "auto suggestions." I'll make my own to do lists, thanks. It wouldn't be so bad if it stayed off once I turn it off, but it is inexplicably turned back on every time I close and reopen the app. BRING BACK WUNDERLIST
replyContent: Hi Alexander, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & feature settings is selected, it should fix the issue. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: I like the idea of this hat but it has some major issues that need to be resolved: 1. Clicking onOneNote links will automatically download that section of OneNote from the internet, instead of opening it on the locally installed program. 2. Flagged email Categories do not appear here as they do in the PWA. 3. If there is a flagged email automatically added to my day because of its due date, when I mark it as complete, it does not show as completed at the bottom. This needs to change.

Never really had any issues with this app until last few months. The app has become very glitchy and does not operate smoothly like it has. Been using it flawlessly for the last couple of years since it switched over from WOUNDERLIST. The WOUNDERLIST APP Was Awesome! Well Microsoft I use this app to operate a business and I'm now moving on to a different app. This glitch is so bad that they are wanting me to contact customer support by going through the settings in the app and it won't even open
replyContent: Hi Mike, To help you better can you please share details with us by filing a support ticket with us?TSteps to file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,To Do Team

content: Cons: Suggestions still continually turn themselves back on, now every time I open a list, despite being manually turned off *individually*! I have around 30 lists! This problem gets worse each update. No way to turn off Suggestions all at once in settings. Also, syncing between users isnt working and my spouse often can't see items I added until a day later even when manually synced. Also, a microsoft account is required for support or feedback. Pros: At least it has dark mode now.

This app WAS AMAZING & it once replaced all others that I used for productivity until the "notes" section began a horrible glitch. While typing, it scrolls so you cannot effectively continue to to read, or edit anything that is written. As an event planner, I literally use digital notes to keep track of EVERYTHING. This is extremely disappointing, but looks like I was correct in considering transferring all of my data to another app over the past few months!
replyContent: Hi Trese, we are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. There is a compatibility bug with our notes editor on select Samsung devices and we are working on fixing it. In the meantime, it would be really lovely if you could switch to the Google keyboard so you can continue to use To Do without any glitches. Warm regards, To Do team

content: Please help fix this issue because I need this app for work and it used to work perfect. on mobile device when trying to edit the notes field of a task, there is a glitch that makes it impossible to use.  It is automatically moving the cursor to the bottom of the note and there is an automatic carriage return that will not stop.  It just keeps scrolling down and expanding the note with blank lines and not allowing editing of the lines above.
replyContent: Hi Eric, We are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. There is a compatibility bug with our notes editor on select Samsung devices and we are working on fixing it. In the meantime, it would be really lovely if you could switch to the Google keyboard so you can continue to use To Do without any glitches. Warm regards, To Do team

content: A Horrible upgrade! Its predecessor, Wunderlist, was a very useful tool. I could easily add new tasks and speak them by pressing one button. Now you have to go through a variety of clicks to do the same. Wunderlist easily and seamlessly integrated into my different operating platforms. Unfortunately, to do list requires that you use Windows 10 which I do not have and refuse to upgrade from Windows 8.1 Pro. There are other lists out there that you may want to consider.
replyContent:
Dear Jaye,
Could you please contact us via todofeedback@microsoft.com? We'd love to hear more about this issue in order to assist you. Thanks!

content: If you share a list with someone, it hardly ever syncs between users. My wife and I tried to use this for a grocery list after Microsoft killed Wunderlist. The horrible syncing means if someone adds an item to the list, the other person won't see it when they are at the store. Also, Wunderlist was so easy to add a person and share a list. It's a total PITA to share a list now. You basically have to send an invite through text or emai, then you need to log in using a Microsoft account.

Sbasically does what you want it to. However you will get notifications everyday. Even after you go into settings and turn them off. the next day you still get notifications and you see in the settings that the notification setting that you turned off is turned back on. Have been doing this every day and nothing changes. so you will be stuck getting notifications you don't want everyday. They are hell-bent on making sure this app gives you notifications no matter what your choice. That is wrong.
replyContent:
Hey Ted,
Sorry for the inconvenience caused. We have resolved the issue with Daily planning reminder, you can now turn it OFF from settings. Do let us know if you need any help at todohelp@microsoft.com. Thanks!

content: This was my favorite app for many months, center of my home screen, used it every single day multiple times a day. Loved it. Put so many tasks, reminders, notes, subtasks, etc. in it. And then, a few days ago, I opened it up and everything was gone. Everything. Thought, OK maybe it will get restored in a couple days, but nope. Thinking about starting to enter things again, but the prospect of finding it all deleted again someday has taken the fun right out of that. Sooooo disappointed.

I want to like this app, but I regularly run into a problem where it does not notify me of a task even when I set a specific date/time for it to provide a reminder. This happens at random and for no apparent reason. A task app that cannot reliably remind you of the tasks is pretty much useless. Microsoft needs to fix this. Update 2/10/21: Still not giving reminders at random. Unbelievable.

I've loved using Wunderlist. Now I'm being forced to use a different app that takes longer to load my lists, it takes an extra click to move an item from one list to another, and you can't change the look of it like we could in Wunderlist. It's little things, but the speed and simplicity are what make a to-do list app useful in the first place. I might have used this app if it could load my tasks as quick as Wunderlist already does.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback and we are sorry for the inconvenience caused to you. To help us understand the exact issue, can you share more details about the issue at todofeedback@microsoft.com. Thank you!

content: I used to love this app, but for the past month or two, the "Add Note" feature has an annoying glitch, which makes it impossible to use. There is some type of automatic carriage return going on that just keeps scrolling down, no matter what you do. If you finger swipe to go to the top, you can barely click the screen where you want to edit before it glitches down to wherever the cursor has progressed. I've uninstalled, restarted, logged back in with the same result. I'm using notepad now, sadly.
replyContent: Hi John, we are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. There is a compatibility bug with our notes editor on select Samsung devices and we are working on fixing it. In the meantime, it would be really lovely if you could switch to the Google keyboard so you can continue to use To Do without any glitches. Warm regards, To Do team

content: Be very careful. This syncs with your tasks in Outlook. At first that sounds great, until you find out that if you use any feature of Outlook that isn't in this app (regenerating tasks after completion for example), your tasks are OVERWRITTEN in Outlook with ones compatible with this app, resulting in loss of things like due dates. I lost all my regenerating tasks, replaced by occurring tasks instead, causing so many items to be late. If you use any kind of advanced Outlook tasks, don't use.

Terrible. When you sign in using the app on a laptop it resets all other apps...like your user info on office 365, which screws up every thing you do outside of the app. I don't want it all connected to one email. I like my apps separate. There is also no week view, and so far I've gotten no reminders despite them being set. Very disappointed that wonderful Wunderlist is being replaced by this unuseable nightmare of an app. I'm not going to be using this.

It keeps getting worse. This was a great tool when it was wunderlist. Ever since MS bought them, it has gone down hill. I use it from the browser and my phone, and have many shared lists. It takes and average of THREE TIMES to get items to actually be marked completed. They just KEEP COMING BACK. It's only getting worse too. That, and the CONSTANT LOGOUTS silently disconnecting my browser, causing me to lose work, and then refresh, and then re-log in, with no way to FIX IT. I mean, what a facepalm. I hate this app now. I have 20 different lists, 200 or so items in it, and I'm now angry enough to dump the product. I guess it must be I just use it too much, access it from too many different apps/browsers. I don't know, but I no longer recommend this tool.

This app is terrible compared to wunderlist especially if you like the functionality to share a list with another. We cannot seem to get the shareable feature to work. Additionally, even though I'm logged in with the same account on my laptop and phone., it doesn't sync lists. New items are added to the bottom of a list instead of the top. Microsoft has a lot of work to do to get this where it needs to be.

I've been using Wunderlist, finally downloaded this to switch. I went to use my info from there, it says it's linked to a Microsoft account, so I go to sign in using that. I sign in just fine but it takes me to my Microsoft account page, no way to actually use the app. Closing it just means I have to sign in again, and back to the account page. I absolutely can't find a way to get to the app/it's features from this page. Beyond frustrating.

Someone thought it was a good idea to add a "feature" that asks me "what i plan to do today?" EVERY. DAY. You can turn it off if you can find the option buried somewhere. I dont need a reminder app to suddenly start reminding me to set up reminders. Seriously who though this was a good idea to add? UPDATE: You can turn off the daily reminder BUT IT WILL TURN ITSELF BACK ON. Also, WHY do I need a Microsoft account? What if I dont want to sync reminders to anything outside my phone? So bad!

It's trash. Was forced to switch from Wunderlist only to have this app repeatedly fail as it reported there was a problem with my Microsoft account. I had a nicely working solution that I didn't have to think about. Now that's now gone thanks to this company's need to get it's branding on my phone. At this point I'm going to cut my losses and find some non-proprietary way of keeping/sharing to-do data. No more startups that get bought up and disappear.

I like what its trying to do and want to use it, but it's missing a few things. To-Do doesn't support formatting AT ALL (mobile or PC), and any formatting you do in Outlook is erased and spacing is messed up. To-Do has the ability to create subtasks but doesn't translate over to Outlook. The To-Do app on PC doesn't allow you to enlarge the task/note window so your forced to type in this little box on the side of the window. PLEASE FIX THESE!!

OMG!! They BROKE what was a very good app! Completed "tasks" can no longer be sorted which makes this app USELESS. We mostly use this app for shopping lists with hundreds of items on the list, mostly in the completed section. When we again need the item, we just uncheck it. When these items were listed alphabetically they were easy to find. Now they are in random order and impossible to find. WOW

UPDATE 1/31/2021 - it gets "worse' Not the end of the world... but my wife just bought all the groceries I bought the previous day. You'd guess it was a synching issue, but it wasn't, I could see what she had added, but she didn't see that I had checked off a bunch of things. Great. Good thing we have a large freezer. Might need to find a new app... Original review: Like many others before me, I'm reviewing this app because of the annoying "Plan your day reminders" that you can't turn off. Well, you can turn it off, but then it somehow gets switched back on. Every day.

Final edit: for anyone coming from Wunderlist, just switch to "Todoist". It's got a different workflow / terminology, but it fills the gap. Edit: This app doesn't even work. My girlfriend and I edit a shared list and we don't see any of each other's updates. This is junk. Original Review: Being forced into this app from Wunderlist (major cheese movage, not cool!). And they hid data migration in a menu instead of just offering to do it up front. Wow.

I have to give it a low rating because location based reminders have been "on the list" for two years and counting. This wouldn't be so bad except if you use Cortana, it uses this app for reminders, so you lose location based ability. Add location based reminders and this is a five star app.

I forget what the original app was called, but after Microsoft replaced it with this, it has been nothing but a nightmare of having to login 50 different ways in order to look at a list... A list! Just let this be local data on my phone, instead of on the cloud (make that an option instead of the default, if anything). There should be no reason that something as simple as a list for personal use should require all this authentication or be stored on anything other than mine and invited devices.

DANGEROUS - DON'T USE FOR THINGS YOU VALUE. I have seen items and entire lists disappear. Quick search online shows I'm not the only one. A task management app should be Auto saving after every character you type into a draft task. Working on your to-do list while disconnected from the internet should not cause problems. Until Microsoft can commit to the correct priorities I think I'm going to have to find an alternative.

It's supposed to replace Wunderlist but is missing several key features Wunderlist did. One feature I miss is the email notification if a team member completed a task or adds a task. Another silly thing is you have no option but to connect this to your Outlook calendar which I did not want. I don't see why these are features that couldn't be turned on or off.

Edit: originally 3/5 because it is a nice app with one major flaw. Microsoft commented on my original review saying to contact customer service via email I did and they told me to look at one setting but my phone doesn't have that setting. They responded back basically "o well. That's all we got" and said it's my phone's fault. Like really? Piss poor support. Especially considering the app works fine for an extended period but then will stop. Can't be the setting they recommended.
replyContent:
Hey Kevin,
Sorry for the inconvenience!
Please be assure that we are aware of the reminder issue you are facing. At first it appears that it can be because of OS limitations, however support engineers will analyze it further.
You will soon receive a reply from support team on next working day. Thanks for your patience!

content: It helps me stay organized, I can color code things, share lists and it syncs lightning fast. Update: Well that was short lived. For the last month syncing has been slow and broken. I just spent 20 minutes prepping a list only to come back and find it all reverted to what it was, trying to sync and failing. Also push notifications are broken on Android and windows 10 now. Just great. The app is essentially useless now

Any Microsoft product should have zero stars available. I cannot say strongly enough, if you love crashes, frustration and impossibly awful software. . . then get this app. Imports from Wunderlist do not stay put, they disappeared. Shared lists are now two different lists with the same name. One version shows only completed tasks, my fone shows incomplete. Thanks Bill for your 100% record of ruining everything you buy. Oh and 4.5 stars out of five?? I call BS. Look at the reviews.

Update: decreased from 2 to 1 star. The reminder functionality is terrible. If I set a reminder on a recurring task, I want the reminder to recur as well. I miss Wunderlist. The functionality is so different now, and the transition was really bad. And I definitely didn't want a Microsoft account.

Wunderlist user, looking for replacement after two days of frustration. Sync doesn't work, I have now two phones and two PCs with four different ToDo lists although all of them show the same account. My shared lists with other people don't update after the first 6-7 hours, while task update was still working there was no notification sound/message on updates (on phones), online version is either - giving me "Something went wrong" message or shows empty lists. The new installations (on 3rd and 4th device) are also giving me "Something went wrong" when trying to import Wunderlist ... I am skrewed. Need to find replacement before Wunderlist is gone, have hundreds of tasks on 19 projects, can't afford something so unreliable as MS ToDo turned out to be. The experience of my teammate is very similar (same issues, but she has only two devices). Not enough data points to judge this app, but I have no more time to waste.

I do not want my entries deleted when they are marked complete. I have "confirm before deleting" toggled on in Settings. I want the item marked complete and to stay on the list shaded out or with a line through it so I can see what has been done. Otherwise I don't know if it even was ever on the list! That is a huge plus for Color Note. Sharing isn't helpful if I can't track what's been done.

Not user friendly... Wunderlist was much better. I have several different lists and liked the "All" view from Wunderlist where I could see all the different tasks from all of my lists on one screen and I could easily move tasks between different lists. Now there is no "All" view and I have to open each individual list separately and go back and forth to see everything... I also can't move a task to another list. I'd have to open one list and copy the text then open the other list and paste...

Wunderlist was a wonderful piece of software that initially continued to work well after being acquired by Microsoft. The conversion to ToDo was ok (some lost features, but initially seemed ok). The Android and desktop app no longer consistently sync. And lately, the app consistently loses my repeating tasks (they simply disappear upon completion), completed recurring tasks still display on My Day, and recurring tasks also lately weirdly create duplicate tasks when repeating. ToDo isn't even close to Wunderlist, unfortunately, so time to move on.
replyContent:
Hey David,
Sorry to hear that! Could you please contact To Do support through To Do app (Go to settings and select contact support) or write to us at todohelp@microsoft.com with more details of your issue? We'd love to help you troubleshoot.¬†

content: This app is CONSTANTLY dropping added data. I use it to remember all of my 'to-dos' and it drops 1/2 of them. Stuff I have deleted reappears. The app is NEVER in synch with the co-user of my lists. Terrible. I miss Wunderlist. I am in the process of finding a different app to manually transfer all of my data to. That process will be much less frustrating than trying to use this one.

Really frustrating experience. The list sharing is incredibly frustrating. My wife and I were on several lists together on wunderlist and when we transfered to this new app, we had to text message the lists we shared. She shared some of the same lists with me and now we have duplicate lists. It's completely FUBAR. We are abandoning the platform now to find something better.

When I first switched over that only the sub lists could be shared, and only one by one, as opposed being able to share a group of list. Other users have also flagged this issue, unfortunately no update on this feature as of yet. I continue to use the app and adding multiple items to multiple list. I signed in today and found that all of a sudden only 4 headings left. All the lists (hundreds of items), gone. Had to email developer because I couldn't find how to contact support via the app.

WARNING!!! 1.)Microsoft TODO Syncs typos or errors you make in your notes. UNACCEPTABLE! Does NOT allow you to discard unwanted changes to your notes like WUNDERLIST does. Accidentally delete or change something important in your notes? Cut and paste go wrong? YOURE OUT OF LUCK! 2.)You have to wait up to 4 days sometimes for a backup. Wunderlist did exports in seconds. 3.)New tasks are put at the bottom. the longer your list gets, the more you have to scroll to the bottom. Unlike Wundelist

I was kicked off of Todo. Your system did not recognize my password on my Chromebook and my phone. I finally gained access using my tablet. I am terrified of continuing with this app. I have a lot of data that would hurt if I lose it. My attempts to contact you on line just sent me around in circles. I need reliability and will have to find another app as much as I like Todo. Your customer service needs enhancing.

Horrible! So many steps!...Set a due date, set a reminder, set it to display in My Day. The reminder set screen is 2 different screens for date/time. The My Day section is the only way you can organize by reminder time for scheduling purposes. Once it's in My Day you must manually move the items in time sequence. Takes up way too much time to organize your day! Importing did not work after several attempts. The setting reset themselves to default after I set them.

Why did you have to ruin a good thing Microsoft. Wunderlist was perfect until you came along. The primary reason why I enjoyed Wunderlist was for it's flawless widget. When you checked off a task from the widget it would simply disappear. But you guys can't seem to do the same thing. Worse part is that your widget glitches out after completing a task (it's more like a 'twitch') like it's trying to get rid of it but can't. Didn't you guys buy the program? Why did you have to change it?

Had to uninstall because I kept getting annoying reminders each day that it's time to plan my day. I turned these off in notification settings, only for it to turn itself back on EVERY DAY. Tried turning it off multiple days, but it keeps turning itself back on. Get lost with this and fix your bugs, or just get lost if this is intentional to increase app usage üëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèª

As an experienced Office 365 subscriber, Android has enough standalone To Do/List apps. What it lacks is a cohesive all-in-one Personal Information Manager. For Windows, that has, for years been Microsoft Outlook. Instead of developing a standalone To Do app, Microsoft development time would be better served adding Tasks and Contacts to it's Outlook app. Extending functionality to the Microsoft Outlook Android app to mirror Microsoft Outlook for Windows would make so much more sense.

The reminder feature and due date features don't work - so what is the point of using this app? They often fail to appear on my notification tray. Overdue tasks disappear from it. I can set reoccurring due dates for tasks, but why can't I set reoccurring reminders for this task. There is a lot of potential here, but this app is still too unpolished.

Not nearly as good as wunderlist was and I don't like that I had to switch...constant issues that I didn't have (or not nearly as much if I did). It often doesn't sync with my partner who I share multiple lists with and lately it has an issue even creating a shared list. When I create a list and try to share it with him it says "we ran into a problem creating a link to share" but offers no solution on how to try to fix the issue. Bring back wunderlist!!!!!

Migrated from Wunderlist, used this app for a few months with no issue, then it deleted all of my sub-lists and their content. The grocery list sucked, since I was at the store when I found they were deleted, but I can recreate those. However, I had movie and TV show recommendations from friends, family, and strangers going back almost ten years that I was slowly working through. They seem to be gone forever. Completely unacceptable. I will find an alternative and recommend everyone do the same.

The recent update has changed everything I liked about this app. In my "task" view I manually have to select overdue/today/tomorrow/this week in order to see the corresponding tasks. In the previous version I had the ability to see all of them and hide the tasks which weren't relevant. I should be able to see multiple lists at the same time, and this filter just doesn't let me. I want to see my "overdue" and "today's" planned task in one view. That's the most important for me.

They took away Wunderlist for this? Wunderlist was literally the most perfect To Do list program ever. I told so many people about it. They recently replaced it with ToDo, and it is nowhere near as good. Old features don't work any longer and even the view/layout is much less pleasing. Just give us back Wunderlist and call it ToDo, I don't care, but I want my Wunderlist back!

Mar 2020: Very, very disappointing. Looking elsewhere. Before:A move forward from Wunderlist? Not! MS made sure the UI looked different (with useless themes) and DROPPED Wunderlist functionality like 1) email delivery (marked stuff in Outlook is USELESS to people that don't use it), 2) no way to add tasks by widget/notifications, 3) marking a task with a star doesn't move it to the top, 4) "My Day" shows up rather than a task list. 5) ... (out of review space) I detest "progress" that isn't.

Was forced to switch to this from wunderlist. The only thing better about it is dark mode that extends to widgets. Everything else sucks. I now don't even get about 30% of my reminders anymore and have to constantly reset things. Microsoft is one of the richest companies on Earth and this is the best they can do? Edit: changing to one star and giving up. I don't even get 75% of my reminders from this app anymore it's so poorly designed. I hate that they took over wunderlist.

The desktop app works well enough but I haven't hated an android app this much in a long time. I keep it installed only for reminders I set on my desktop to be displayed on my phone. I'm tired of trying to add things via the phone over and over again. This is one of the very few Microsoft apps I use because Microsofts goal in life seems to be making the simplest tasks very difficult. On that subject I may be a Linux user before much longer.

Granted, I just downloaded the app, but I have yet to find anything useful about it. Copy/pasting in and then reorganizing a basic task list took me about a half hour (seriously? No drag and drop?) and I haven't been able to figure out how to share a task list with someone else. If I can't share the task list, why is there an "assigned to me" toggle? Instructions on the MS website seem to be referencing a completely different version than the one I have. Utterly useless and frustrating.

I made the switch after the Wunderlist got taken down. My biggest gripe with this (and it is big) is the widget is very very slow to update lists or when switching lists. There is a 5-10 second delay when adding things or switching, and Wunderlist never had this problem. This has been an issue since day 1. I exclusively use the widget since it's very easy to navigate to and see my lists. If this problem was mitigated it would be a good app.

To Do list cant be shown on widget. Only the myday can be, which i dont want to use. There are better options. microsoft refuses to use common sense agsin with this app. Your to do item needs to be less than about 15 words in order to view it. while editing the item you can write 50 words or more, but after saving you cant view it completely because the scroll doesnt function well enough. 75% of the screen real estate (like most microsoft sw) is wasted.

Lacking basic features It doesn't appear to have location based alerts which puts it behind both Apple and Google for usability on their most basic productivity apps. If you dont want me to use the built in app you are going to have to be 10% better than all the rest and you aren't even equal to the rest and now you are shutting down Wunderlist without having implemented this most requested feature since 2011. Pass.

Disappointed that Wunderlist is gone because it took me years to find a task app that met my needs. The feature I miss most is being able to select Sort By Date, then manually reordering items within each date afterward. Right now I can only do one or the other. If I select sort by date, I cannot manually reorder items. If I turn off the sort by date option, I have to manually move each item.

Ruined a great app üò≠ with poor & insanely annoying password management. Forced to transfer to this after they bought Wunderlist. Not compatible with Android's security manager, so I need to remember my password. Lame. So I reset it, but it says I'm reusing the previous password, so I'm obviously typing it correctly. Still doesn't work. Now I have to go to some lame Microsoft site, so they can harvest my cell#. And then I can finally make a shopping list. Because security? Stupid.

'For Today' screen is deleting tasks instead of adding them to 'My Day' when I click on the '+' icon. This is getting worse. Every time I use the app, items get deleted instead of added to my day. And at least one is lost because I missed that it deleted instead of added it. It is ridiculous that tapping on the '+' registers as a delete at all. Pixel 2 XL

Why don't daily tasks just work? It can't be that hard. It will push some daily tasks properly and one or two just will not show up. I'll confirm they're set for daily repeat but they'll show as due the day before... Despite being a daily task that's also due today? Super glitchy. Once fixed though, it's an otherwise great app. Daily tasks need to be fixed.

Good app but it needs corrections. Snooze function doesn't work. The reminder don't come back to the screen. When I create a note and save it there's no way to close the area to create another one. It feels like the app is always waiting for me to create a reminder after another. To exit the option I need to click in one reminder in the list or leave the list and go back to the beginning. There should be a way to exit the "new reminder" screen without going back to the home screen.

Worthless update information earns 1-star review. "We fixed some bugs to improve the app experience." That's like saying, "we did some stuff". Gee, thanks for telling me. Oh, and the app still lacks basic functionality and ties in poorly with other Microsoft apps.

Hello please, brainstorm a more convenient interface for tablets, for Microsoft To Do. Can it be made so that it opens on the whole, or at least, the whole screen? I can send SS via e-mail. P.S I have a tablet and a Galaxy Note10+, enabled in tablet mode too, via dev options setting it at 750 dp width. Thank you and honestly, best wishes. Tony

Very good app to keep track of daily goals. One cool thing about this app is that you can add your accountability partner and then keep track of each other's goals. The only drawback is that Microsoft has restricted it to outlook/Microsoft users. I think everyone should be allowed to use this app. Feature Request - A Pin Option should be added to Lock the app. Update - Changed Rating from 5 to 1 as now syncing takes too long. If this does not improve then I will have to delete this app.

Bug: can't write to a shared list. This has worked for years, but latest app puts me into a 2FA loop when I add an item to the list. Uninstalling and reinstalling gives me read-only view, but as soon as I add an item: 2FA challenge, I respond in authenticator, and get a challenge within 10sec of returning to app.

Absolutely does not work at all. None of my tasks show up on Microsoft ToDo. It is such a deep and emblematic failure that outlook tasks cannot be seen from the outlook app. Waste of time trying to get this to work.

When you create tasks, you just want to jot them down and then organize them into main or sub-tasks. To Do forces to do the hierachical organization first, and if you missed putting a task as a sub-task, too bad for you. You cannot move a task to become a sub-task or step of another task. Google Notes does this simply. Until then, bye Microsoft To Do.

Complicated as compared to other to-do apps. Plus doesn't work several times if DNS is enabled on device. Sync also fails when checked on other devices. Very heavy in terms of usage and storage. Dark theme is pitch black theme. Great Not worth it.

replyContent: Hi, Thanks for taking the time to leave this review! We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience with notifications. Our team has noted the issue and has rolled out a fix. Please wait 24 hours and then update your app to the latest version to fix the issue. Regards, To Do team

replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We hear you and will try to add your feature asks to our backlog. If you have any other feedback or suggestions, please write to us at todofeedback@microsoft.com. We would love to hear from you!

replyContent: Hi Maciej, To help better can you please file a ticket with us. Steps to file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,To Do Team

replyContent: Hi Jon, There is compatibility bug with our notes editor and samsung keyboard on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.This issue fixes if you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings or use a different keyboard like gboard. Regards,To Do Team

replyContent: Hi JW, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-off, relaunch should not turn settings back ON. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: Still use the app and rely on it. But still can't stand the my day. Need to be able to get rid of it or shut it off. No need to have it when you have today, tomorrow separated. Also, still have tasks that are postponed show up on dates postponed from. Really annoying. But still potential for a great app. Update 1/23. Still similar issues. Bugs are back with alarms showing up when not even due. Infuriating. The solution shouldn't be i hands to start over.

So I'll say this is a start. The pluses, the syncing between outlook tasks, todo web, and the UI is clean and generally nice to look at.  CONS:  Why is there no "Planned" list on the todo app. It's super annoying. There is no easy way to see my tasks for today and the upcoming week. "Planned" is implemented on web. The todo app really should have basic parity.  It's super painful in both the app and the web app to add dates. I add dates to every todo. It is very cumbersome compared to todoist.  I'm sure other people use it but I don't love the My Day feature. I don't like manually adding it. It should just show all the tasks due today. Maybe we could add that as a setting?  There is another bug. The date seems to be off. It works on mobile but it's off on the web app so it's not consistent. MS really needs to get their act together on this product.

I switched over to Microsoft to do after being notified that Wunderlist would not be available. With the most recent update to the app, the 'planned' list now only shows a filtered view. And I have to group it by date to even see it for each day. Previously I could see everything at once -by due date even overdue items. I can appreciate that everyone might not want to see everything. There should be an 'all' option if you are going to limit this. Looks like I get to find a new app.

I loved Wunderlist. To Do not so much. I cannot get my phone app or web app to sync. Very frustrating when you are sharing a list and cannot see what other people have added or completed. They in turn cannot see anything you have added or completed. My husband send I have the same exact phone and he has no problems with his app. I don't get it.

I've used this app for quite some time with very few issues. When everything is working as it should be, it's a great app! However, since 02/06/2021 I've been unable to sync any of my shared lists. I cleared the app cache, signed out and back in again, and uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Despite these attempts to rectify the problem, I still cannot sync shared lists.

A new "feature" of Microsoft To Do compared to Wunderlist is notifications being cleared at the start of every new day. This is incredibly annoying because if I don't have time to get to it, I want it to be a constant annoying reminder so I know to get around to it. I would rather continue to use Wunderlist, if the recurring tasks was implemented offline, instead of requiring the server to give you a recursive task.

Bring back Wunderlist! This app has failed to link lists over and over. We find ourselves trying to relink lists, but it still doesn't work. Since this has changed from Wunderlist, it's a huge disappointment. Find a better app. Also, you can't silence it when someone is checking off a linked list (when it does work). Super annoying. I expected more from Microsoft.

Just not far enough along to be really useful. It did pull tasks from different accounts (personal, work, school) but there is no way to come up with a consolidated list to work from for the day. Subtasks (steps) don't have the ability to show up separately on a day so you can't use it to plan out complicated tasks. Tasks don't have a due time assignable so useless as a homework tracker. No geo-fencing. Ever since they gutted Outlook I been relying more and more on paper day-timer.

I like using this app to organize my to-do items for my company which subscribes to office 365. However, since the latest update my app constantly says "unable to sync" even though it appears to be working when I check in the browser on my desktop. Even uninstalling and reinstalling the app doesn't fix it. I can't trust the app with my vital work if I'm getting sync errors like this because I cannot lose anything. Please fix this and I will update to 4 or 5 stars.

I don't know if anyone else is experiencing this, but the app glitches CONSTANTLY with Chrome OS. Whenever I flip to "My Day," the suggested tasks flicker on the screen and make using the app impossible. I used it on my Android phone and previously on my Macbook with no problem. I loved the "My Day" function and am loathe to switch to a different app, but I don't think I have a choice.

It's confusing. to-do apps are supposed to make things easier but i find that this doesn't do that. it says it will remind but doesn't.. at least for me. it doesn't sync with cortana; she seems to have her own list. I think it syncs with Microsoft launcher? the ui/ux is confusing with the whole my day thing, and then there's planned, custom lists... there's no bi-weekly schedule. There should be ONE list tied to your account and all apps should sync with it.

Microsoft bought the previous app I was using and the Microsoft experience has been ok. The biggest annoyance (and reason for the 2 star rating) is that the app keeps turning on the "Plan Your Day Reminders" notification regardless of how many times I turn it off. It's literally a useless notification that pops up saying "What will you do today?" and I don't want it to notify me.

[Updated Review] This app is very great and I love many things about it, but the unforgivable missing feature is some sort of "trash bin". It's unbelievable that if I delete a list by mistake, it's completely gone forever! This missing feature makes To Do very unreliable. Even a temporal trash bin that self-cleans in intervals would be very useful. I also have MANY UX feedbacks, and I'm very willing to share over a session (not possible to cover by text review) .
replyContent:
Hi Siavash,

Thanks for your feedback!

We are currently working on list folders, it will be available pretty soon. Notes, attachments and subtasks are all available in To-Do since a few months, give them a try and let us know what you think. And we will consider adding list duplication to To-Do, thanks for the suggestion!

Best regards.

content: It does what it says, but not easily or well. Its frustratin . I downloaded because they bought Wunderlist, and this is the replacement. It does not offer the same experience and is NOT a good replacement. From sorting, to reordering lists, to automatically seeing up tasks for the day, it misses the boat. And using the"suggest a feature" button is a nightmare! You have to login for every new page, and the attitude is "here's our way of doing it" and no changes get made. I will be changing apps.
replyContent: Hi, thank you for reaching out. Our apologies for the inconvenience, I've passed your feedback on to the team so that we can keep it in mind as we continue to improve Microsoft To Do.

content: Love the concept, enjoy To Do on PC, love that it syncs immediately. What I do NOT love is that scheduled tasks do not sync with my Outlook calendar. This is very inconvenient as I have to have two programs open and if I want to schedule anything, I have to check my to do list. Also, noticed today that I can no longer check off tasks as completed in the app. When I do the task disappears for a second then pops right back onto my list as incomplete. Is currently useless.

I give it an extra star for how it looks. For one time tasks it might be OK but for recurring, it just plain does not work. I set up two recurring daily tasks and I'd say it worked about 50% of the time. Luckily they were tasks that had some flexibility but after years of them NOT fixing this I give up. Simple Google Reminders just works. Doesn't have all the bells and whistles but it at least works. Sorry MS....you fail.

Since adding multiple account support I have been forced to log in repeatedly each day and resync the account. This is quite frustrating as a good bit of my day is away from cell or wifi coverage, which means I'm unable to access the app or add new tasks. This is quite frustrating and eliminates most of the benefit of the app. -- The app needs to be able to function offline with constantly needing to sync.

Too hard to group stuff to Today or Tomorrow. Annoying notifications stating why aren't you doing more? Accusing clients of laziness. There are better task organizers out there. There are more critical things in life to do than a random list of house chores. The app is totally rude! It lacks dark mode. It hurts the eyes. It doesn't wipe out completed tasks. It doesn't graph completion. It doesn't have a habit tracker or calendar view. It doesn't have notes for tasks or logging.

dag, I JUST left a review expressing my love for the app less than 10 mins ago, only to have it start crashing on me moments later.. I thought it was a hiccup so to speak, but it crashed four more times, each time while trying to add a new task; I was editing the reminder date and time the last time but not sure about the first instances. I really liked the look/feel & ease of use but forced to give a poor rating because of it continuously failing during the usage of the most frequented portions

This does not work the same as wunderlist. When I sort, I cannot manually move items to in effect do a sort alphabetically within priority. Also when I prioritize items, they don't automatically move to the top of the list. With wunderlist going away, I am going to have to search for a new app. So disappointed.

1) No way to share a list within the app: you have to do it via email every single time. 2) When you join a list, it happens multiple times "there's something wrong, please try again". For one list I tried five times before I got it to work. If you have many shared lists from Wunderlist, good luck resharing them. Hey dumb Microsoft team, if you are not ready, don't discontinue Wunderlist.

The overall function is good. problems are, not all repeat options are compatible so therefore you can't use them. Also I was surprised there is not a way to search my tasks. also the widget doesn't color code anything so I have no idea what is before or after the due date I have set. I would expect better from Microsoft.

I am a user of the previous Wunderlist but Microsoft acquired the app so here I am. There's some differences which is fine but this app has a tendency of being horribly unreliable. I was hoping by now this would be more reliable but it isn't. Repeating reminders seem to work for a couple days and then it stops pushing reminders to my phone. It's very disappointing. I use this for grocery and other lists. I wish I could use the reminders too.

I just want an app that duplicates what I see on my desktop. I cannot use features like to whom the task is assigned, start date, end date, progress, Etc. I do not like to so-called smart lists. I want to see the entire list of my items, and not have them broken down automatically into tasks or anything else. At least give me a manual option. I like to look through my entire list and set priorities, without having to go through multiple lists. Outlook needs a task function on its app. Not this

Anyone have a better replacement for Wunderlist? I really am Just looking for list app and one where I can have shared lists. I don't need another half assed todo list. I have tried this in the past and it is not list app and it is not a functional task manage. I did go ahead a switch because the port was easy and I didn't want to loose my stuff, but I need a more functional replacement.

Interface similar to Wunderlist, functionally not the same unfortunately. As an example, Wunderlist allows manual sorting after sorting by one of the sort options (alphabetical, etc), which can fine tune things beautifully. Microsoft To Do does not allow manual sorting unless you deactivate the selected sort (like deactivating alphabetical sort as an example). This then reverts everything back to the same unsorted mess prior to the selected sort option. Very frustrating.

This app is inferior to Wunderlist as of now. It needs to be an option to duplicate a list exactly and rename it. You should also be able to attach pictures and instructions to long lists that you've made. It's just not nearly as intuitive as Wunderlist. I have 50 locations that often need all the same services performed and it is a major waste of time to type can01 can02 can03 can04 etc every time i have a sweeping maintenance issue.

Pros: Free to use with no premium tier. You can set tasks, set them to repeat and get reminders. You can check them off when done. Cons: 1. Tasks that repeat every week are going to be listed under "My Day" with no indication whatsoever of whether this is this week's or next week's task. 2. Sub-tasks aren't visible in the main view. 3. Other minor inconveniences. I hate Todoist's premium tier, but sadly it's the better app.

Definitely disappointed. This app crashes frequently (usually when moving several tasks to a new list at the same time). Also, I moved lots of tasks and they disappeared - lost forever. Very frustrating since I use to do lists so I don't have to remember everything. Will be looking for a new app.

This app changed recently in an annoying way. Now, completed tasks are no longer sorted or even sort-able. We use this app for shopping lists and have previously appreciated the ability to sort a list we use repeatedly in alphabetical order. Now it's impossible to sort the completed taske for reuse. That's just lame.

Stay away. I loved Wunderlist. However, none of the changes the devs made moving from Wunderlist to ToDo enhanced the experience and they have broken countless other features. My most current gripe is that reminders don't consistently remind you on time. My recurring 9:00am alert finally kicked off at 3:59 today. My 7:00 nightly reminders only work about half the time. I'm defecting to something else as soon as i can find something suitable.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback and we are sorry for the inconvenience caused to you. To help us understand the exact issue, can you share more details about the issue at todofeedback@microsoft.com. Thanks!

content: Wish they kept the wunderlist app instead it was perfect üò≠!!! Some issues I had with this app compared to Wunderlist to fix: -have new items added to the top instead of adding to the bottom (or have option to change) -more quick choice options for the reminder times -quick add bar (to just type in a search bar box instead of clicking the + button) -have settings apply to all lists so don't have to individually change each list -option to add to list on main screen without clicking in list

Actually wasn't a terrible replacement for Wunderlist until the last update. The one feature I used all the time was the ability to show completed items with un-completed and sort the whole list and then hide completed items again, leaving everything sorted. Now you can no longer merge the lists and sort. Why take something out that was actually useful? Now this app is virtually useless for me.
replyContent: We are sorry for the inconvenience and are working on this issue. Do let us know if you have any other feedback or suggestions, by writing to us at todofeedback@microsoft.com. We would love to hear from you!

content: My wife and I used Wonderlist for years to share grocery lists, to-do's, packing lists, etc. The transition into Microsoft To Do could not have been more painful. Duplicate imports and no sharing between work/personal accounts made the move harder than it should be. But the most frustrating thing? I can no longer click and drag to order items in a list!! I be in the grocery store runnin around like a psycho cuz my list be all scrambled. And that's before I even look for toilet paper.

Super annoying that you can't find your expired, but incomplete tasks, or you have to dig through the screens to find them. Super annoying that the tasks are added in reverse order, i.e. the last two shows up first on the list and you have to constantly rearrange the list.

I have enjoyed using this app for several years now since Wunderlist kicked the bucket, but lately it has been getting rather slow and you literally have to wait half a second or so each time you open it if you had a task opened before navigating to another app then coming back. If they can focus on performance it would be a 5 star app. Oh, and the calendar still can't choose Monday as the first day of the week ‚òπÔ∏è

The app is good. But the widgets do not sync the tasks at random times. For example if I add or complete a new/old task, the task will not be cleared or shown up in the widget. I had to remove the widget and add it again. PS: I faced the same issue when I was using Moto G6, now I'm using Vivo IQOO Neo 6 mobile. (It's not about the mobile).

Notification options need a ton of work. I need notifications for one list, but not my others. So I have to get obnoxious notifications for multiple lists all the time because I can't turn them on for just the one I need.

There is no overdue section. Repeating tasks get stuck in that day if I don't complete in that day and don't show up in the MyDay(today's task) section. It needs to be manually skipped to the next set date. Which is annoying and tiresome. Interface is good but missing basic functionalities.

Not reliable. Periodically this app will check off reminders not done. It glitched a while back and I reset everything and it was working correctly. It is now glitching again. I was using this for bill pay reminders and can't afford a glitch.

Sorting tasks by due date does not work, it uses the reminder date which is not what you'd want. Reminder should be hidden and only viewed during editing. Due date needs to be seen and sorted so I know what to expect on that day and not have to search down the list for similar days. Am I crazy? About to leave this app behind me.

The new "auto-complete suggestions enabled" feature is loathsome. I have to turn off this nuisance in the list options for EACH list EVERY time I reopen the list. You should be able to turn it off in the app settings, and it should stay off when you turn it off. Worst, the list option to "turn off auto suggestions" is where a fat finger can do the most damage: right below "delete list"! I accidentally deleted a list with dozens of repeating items.

I love the concept of this app, with sharing capability, but when I have to turn off auto-suggestion literally every time I open the app, I want to throw my phone across the room... Seriously how hard is it to respect my wishes with settings. Incredibly frustrating. Would be an easy 5-star otherwise.
replyContent: Hi Dennis, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-off, relaunch should not turn settings back ON. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: Log into the same account on another device with a newer app version: All of my lists disappeared! Not a tested scenario!? Pretty unreliable. :-/

I am really annoyed from this app... It does not shows the widget on home screen... Plz fix this.. Other features are amazing but the the widget problem annoyed me a lot... And for me widget is everything... Thats why only üåüüåü

Decent app, it was better as Wunderlist. Giving it 2 stars because the auto suggestion feature continues to turn itself back on every time you open the app. I don't want the feature and it should be a toggle in the settings app to turn off not on individual lists! Apps should defy users settings!
replyContent: Hi Ronnie, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-off, relaunch should not turn settings back ON. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: Although functionality is good, what is going on with the battery drain!!! Even after limiting background (and not even having it open) usage it still above apps.

The app will not stop adding blank lines when adding a note in any lists I create. I've uninstalled and reinstalled and the issue persists. My wife has the same issue and we can't get it to stop. Very frustrating.
replyContent: Hi Antonio, There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13. Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in samsung keyboard settings or try another keyboard like GBoard etc.? Regards,To Do Team

content: OK for Tabs and iPads, too buggy for Android phones. You can enter tasks, but the text disappears when you try to edit, etc. The 2023 update didn't fix it, you still can't edit.
replyContent: Hi Joe, There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support:1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID.Regards,To Do Team

content: Reliable for the most part, but goddamn I'm getting sick and tired of my task notifications randomly getting disabled. Also hope you're not relying on this for anything important (like daily meds) when without internet access cause nothing will renew.

Liked it simple and easy to use but the widget won't update after few minutes, to refresh you need to remove the widget and add it again, and when i add a new task I don't see it until i remove the widget and add it again. Except this the app work great.

It's good that you can import from wunderlist, but the planner is missing some really basic features. For instance it's impossible to set a repeating reminder, which makes it pretty useless... And why 'My Day' doesn't automatically populate with the things you have set for the day is beyond me. Poorly thought out, as I am finding a lot of Microsoft products are these days. I'm looking for a better app.

I am quite disappointed that the sorting no longer applies to completed tasks. After years of missing this feature in Wunderlist, it was a very positive surprise seeing that it had been implemented in To-Do. Now it's gone again. If this change is not reverted, I will be dropping the app. It's a nice app but it doesn't serve me without that feature.

I have been using this app for a long time, even before Microsoft took over. One of the best to-do apps out there. It's great to be able to access the to-do list across multiple devices. Unfortunately since a recent update it is not possible anymore to edit more than one item on my tablet. After editing one item the app has to be restarted before another item can be edited, everytime. Re-installing the app doesn't solve the problem. I need the app to work across all my devices.

The app is overall great, although I preferred Wunderlist, especially when adding new tasks, the bar was on top and I much preferred that. But the worst part is that after the last update notifications don't work on my phone unless the app is on. I checked all settings and there is nothing I can change. This happened before with Wunderlist, I had to uninstall it. Shame.

When you create a task and then set a reminder, you have to go back to the text and press enter otherwise it doesn't save it, or even warn you if you navigate away. Caught me out a few times, seriously annoying so looking at other options. Other than that it's ok but nothing special and the views are a bit odd. All for example doesnt actually show all tasks!

At first I liked that I could choose to see or hide the done tasks and even the done tasks were on alphabetic order. I use this app also as a grocery list. So every time I want to add the done tasks I have to go throw everything. Why can't you have the done tasks in alphabetic order as well. Or that we could choose between this interface and the previous one ourselves. The way it is now (chaotic) it is very user unfriendly and time consuming.

A fantastic and helpful app became useless with the last update. Grouping open and completed tasks may be helpful for some, but for some types of lists it would be really handy to have all tasks together. For example a picking list (or shopping list) with the items sorted in order of their position in the warehouse. You do not need everything every time, so you can just uncheck the items when needed during a round, possibly hiding the completed tasks to minimize screen cluttering. This was possible before, but with the recent update(s) all completed tasks have moved to a separate list. All custom sorting is lost. Dear Microsoft, please re enable these features. You could provide an option in settings to use one or the other. (Maybe even on a list level) 2 stars because it used to be a good app, otherwise I would have now given it only 1 star.

Trialling this as they ditched the wonderful Wunderlist. Main problem so far is that there is no option to autoshift completed tasks to the bottom of the list. Hidden or taking up space at the top is not user friendly. Visually - no point in having a lovely background if the tasks block it with solid white. Wunderlist looked SO much better, friendlier and more appealing with translucent backgrounds to tasks. These are the kind of style and practical tweaks that should be obvious, right?

There's many things to like about this app. The layout, the style of reminders, especially the snooze button. MS doesn't deserve the recognition for most of these - most came from the IP they bought. However, there's some incredibly frustrating issues with this app. I'm frustrated that they took over Wunderlist (a standalone, single purpose app) and integrated it into the office suite. I've searched high and low but there's just nothing out there like Wunderlist so now we're forced into the MS ecosystem. Sadly another example of great IP being gobbled up by the big guy so that they can force you into their ecosystem. - When my phone OS updates (Google Pixel lineup) it frequently breaks my recurring reminders. THIS IS A SUPER SERIOUS PROBLEM. When you use a reminder app to build routines, you expect that it's going to function 100% of the time. If not, why even bother with the app? - There are frequent issues with the way it synchronizes with Outlook. Besides, I don't want it to synchronize with Outlook and I'd like an option to disable this. I want it to be exclusive to my phone. If MS can get their act together and bring reliability to this app I will happily improve my rating. Until then, they lose nearly all stars. A reminder app MUST be reliable at all times, not a week after an OS update is released and they decide to finally fix the bugs in their app. If I'm constantly worried it's not working then I'm wasting time and energy, not to mention potentially missing something important. Figure it out Microsoft.

The widget list is always glitching and won't show the items on my list, won't allow me to add new items to the list. The only way I seem to be able to fix this issue is by removing the widget and then putting it back in. This was never an issue in the past before I upgraded to the Microsoft ToDo. I'm using a Note10+ and my wife on a Samsung galaxy S10 has the same issue. Hope this can be fixed? It's getting really annoying.

I really liked it when a list could have completed and uncompleted mixed alphabetically together. Now it is back like the much poorer Wunderlist method, with the two separated, uncompleted at top completed at bottom. Much harder to reuse lists. I have gone back to an earlier superior version. Sadly it won't sync with my wife's version of the app on iphone. Change it back!

Totally agree with the below reviews. This was a perfectly serviceable Todo app, which I enjoyed that synced with Alexa, until it started giving me daily "Plan your day" notifications. There's a toggle for these in the settings, but it turns itself back on the next day! Rubbish, Microsoft! Needs to be fixed - but I'm going back to Todoist.

The sorting option is not good. There's no option to manually arrange individual tasks. When you show completed tasks, it all over the place. Completed tasks should be grouped together and displayed at the bottom of the list after the incomplete tasks. It becomes very messy when completed and incomplete tasks are mixed together. Why tweak the app to make it worse than what it was before? Tweaking should making it better not worse.

Moved to Microsoft To Do from Wunderlist. After a month of trying to adjust, I can't. It's terrible and has extremely limited functionality. It's essentially an app which let's you make a list. Moving back to Wunderlist which Microsoft owns bizarrely, it's much smarter and easier and has a ton of more functionality and looks better.

Could be great... But no. I really want to love it. It integrated with my other work apps and is (technically) cross platform. But it's extremely inconsistent. I can have tags in outlook and the browser, but not on mobile. You can't sort by tag in browser but you can on outlook. Subtasks do not exist in outlook, but task status ONLY exists in outlook. It's a complete mess and I need multiple apps open to get all the relevant information I need.

Notification improvements would make all the difference. This app is sleek & has a simple, would be helpful layout. Unfortunately, the notifiction function is useless. The notice disappears quickly (there should be an option for it to stay until ticked). So if you walk away from your phone you may miss an important reminder! I really wanted to like this app, not least b/c i syncs flagged emails in outlook but what good is a to do app which is outperformed by pen and paper?

Migrated from Wunderlist and was happy to start until major issues with reminders not going off. At one point they were all going off retrospectively when I opened the app, now they fail to go off at all! I've re-installed but it worked temporarily, now stopped again. Completely useless if you want it to actually remind you! Such a shame as I like the general layout and sublists, and when they work it's really and logical to set and snooze reminders, which is why I've persisted for so long

Where is shortcut screen .. before some time I can directly add new task from widget screen now it has only one button after that we have to click that button and then add task.. i think the widget is no more. And also it shows beta version logo .
The widget does not sync with the app. I have to remove the widget and add it again for syncing.

It is unfortunate that Microsoft decided to make this look like a Wunderlist copy. The old design simulated a lined notebook, and it was subtle, clean and minimalist. It looked like an extension of the physical world. This Wunderlist-inspired redesign is gaudy and artificial, introducing all sorts of unnecessary graphics and coloured lines. I never liked that Wunderlist made my tasks look like bricks, and I don't like this either.

Being able to slide tasks up and down on the fly is a critical feature which needs to be brought over from Wunderlist. I plan and order my work day tasks with it and need to be able to adjust the order quickly and frequently. My wife and I also were using Wunderlist as a grocery list sharing tool. Same complaint as we like to order the list to match our path through the grocery store. I see a few people miss this option in the reviews - Without it, the app doesn't work for me.

Love the app, the synchronization with desktop and shared To Do lists...... BUT this app is almost useless because the reminders don't create notifications if you haven't opened the app for more than a day. More than a dozen times I've checked and rechecked the Android app optimization settings to ensure that Android is not putting this app to sleep. I've cleared cache, data and uninstalled and reinstalled. Still this app will not reliably generate notifications.

There's quite a lot of work to do with this app. While it seems to functionally work well on a basic level, a lot of core features from the Wunderlist app have been removed, or awkwardly placed/restricted. New features of the app are incredibly limited and feel poorly executed. Unfortunately there is nothing in this app that says "I want this", when migrating from Wunderlist, and makes other apps look more appealing. I hope further updates from Microsoft can deliver on user feedback.

First it's hard to plan next day, because I had no options that task due tomorrow will be added in "my day" automaticaly. Second I have option to add a background image, but only one of about 10 that the app suggest. So I can imagine how it would be nice with my own picture, but cant choose it. Better it would be without such option. Looks like you have done a half of the feature and don't going to finish. It's annoying approach that Microsoft love in their products :( But app is free, only plus
replyContent: Hi,‚ÄØthank you for getting in touch! User feedback and suggestions are really important to us as we work to improve the app. These are good ideas to have more flexible My Day and background image options and we'll consider adding them in a future update. Thank you for your patience as we‚ÄØwork on this and many other improvements to Microsoft To Do!

content: While this app is a fairly good list manager with decent functionality, there was multiple lacking features and bugs that make it inconvenient to use. Firstly, the lack of transparency options for the widget make it unappealing to use. This is the most useful way ive found to use these types of apps and having a giant opaque block on my homescreen is just plain ugly. Secondly, the widget constantly manages to disconnect from my accounts, requiring me to log in releatedly. Very annoying.

There is no option to add picture to tasks. For example when making groceries list and pickling banana or Apple I want to add and see the picture of the item also next to the name (not as an attachment). When you go shopping is very useful to see the pictures of the items instead of reading or needing to enter the task and see the attachments which is not practical and friendly user.
replyContent: Hi,‚ÄØthank you for getting in touch! This is a great idea to add a picture next to the task name, you may try to add emoji as a workaround, and we'll consider adding it in a future update. Thank you for your patience as we‚ÄØwork on this and many other improvements to Microsoft To Do!

content: Great when it works. However far too often it loses all my Tasks and goes blank. Happened today on my Android phone on Aug 14th at 7:39 AM BST. Can be fixed by uninstalling/reinstalling but given regularity (this is the 4th time in 6 months) I suspect due to release cadence. Please sort this bug, as I rely on this heavily. UPDATE: After a few months of glitch free use, its happening again over past 3-4 days & this morning whilst Synching. Support ticket raised with detailed steps.
replyContent:
Hi John,

Sorry for the inconvenience caused. Please update to our latest release and contact us at todohelp@microsoft.com if the issue persists.   

Thanks

content: This app only notifies me of one reminder at a time, so if I don't clear the notification, it stops notifying me of other reminders. It also doesn't allow scheduling more than 1 reminder for a task on a given day. "Repeat" doesn't help. You can't duplicate a task to make a 2nd reminder either, I have to make another task and manually copy and paste the name, notes, and date. Notification syncing is broken for me too, I have to clear every reminder on both my computer and phone every time.

I absolutely love this app & pc program. To be able to keep constant notes between work then mobile in my pocket is fantastic... Until I discovered, I'm not experiencing sync in real time. So down to 2 star and my suggestion to get the app to 5-stars would be if each input would automatically be visibly dated & if real time sync actually was real- time. Needed vital info and thought I could just check the note on my smart phone but, this has not been the case. Wasted a lot of my time & nothing.

I'm disappointed, having lost my data twice because there is a serious lacuna in its program. When I delete a 'daily' item after completing it, it should go into the 'completed' list and its next scheduled occurrence immediately appear in the current list. But at times it doesn't happen like that, and if I've deleted it from the completed list even after some hours, it just disappears for ever. Seems that this action is server-dependent rather than being localized, and on the mercy of internet.
Used to love this app but has been constantly glitching despite the recent fixes. Update, I am using Android. version 12 and my prediction setting is not on in keyboard settings
replyContent: Hi Patricia,There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support:1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID.Regards,To Do Team

two stars because in this latest update i cant quickly switch between my list.. i go to a whole seperate page that gives me a list and when i hit back it closes the app instead of going to the previous list. takes a lot of functionality out of the app and makes getting around much much slower. This is my favourite reminders app and because of that update i may be looking for a new app to keep track of my to dos.

Sadly Microsoft have a history of replacing perfectly efficient apps with less efficient ones. For some reason it has started to give regular unasked for push notifications such as "You completed 1 out of 2 last time". Otherwise the app is good, but nuisance notifications on an app that is supposed to be about notifications you require is a bad move.

This is ok for solo use, but don't count on it to update between two devices. My wife and I found out the hard way when I didn't get steaks at the store. :( Even manual refreshing doesn't help. I googled the problem and it looks like MS Todo has had similar problems for years on various platforms. Anyway, I suggest finding another list app.

Unfortunately the app somehow does not actually give you reminders on the time and date you set them. Very disappointing. I had hoped this would be fixed moving from Wunderlist to this replacement. content: Created a list in desktop version but it doesnt show in the app

Forces you to use or create a Microsoft account, even if you just want to make notes for yourself locally, with no cloud backup or online functionality wanted. After seeing how Microsoft has become a data collecting and user tracking company with Windows 10 + 11, there is no way that I'll create an account with a company that has become so anti-privacy. That's too bad, the app behind the account-gate looks just like what I was looking for.

I've loved this app for a long time, but support wouldn't get back to me for months with issues, then never again. Now, I haven't had the 1hr snooze option work since 2022, and the other ones barely work, and the ones that do change every update. I haven't even bothered to try again since I know they won't help, and even the backup option (for all of Outlook) has failed 4 times after 5 tries, sometimes lasting several days. The one time it "worked", it was "corrupted". Afraid to lose it all!

Overall great organization, but I hate that it can't sync with my email and calendar. It would be so much easier to work with! And yes, I know there is the Microsoft Planner app with 365. But by making it exclusive like that and not available to Microsoft Office Personal users, you are losing people who want to use it but are opting for other apps instead. Hope the Planner app becomes available to all Microsoft Office users at some point.

Good app for tracking your to do list. Here's where it needs help though: 1) Needs to be able to set or ignore time zones. I travel for work, and everything stays in the time zone I originally set, it's annoying to get a 11am reminder at 2am when I'm in a different city. 2) Needs capability for hourly reminders. If it had these two things, I think it'd be 5-stars.

Mostly positive, but in the last version & now this recent update, notes inexplicably start to move as if the space bar were to be pressed. It's hard to make edits. I have been using the app mostly for shopping lists & inventory. A feature I would like to see implemented is categories. ie. Instead of having multiple shopping lists, it would be convenient to have only one & be able to filter by categories I create. Other than this, the app has been great to use & helps me be more organized.
replyContent: Hi Lou, There is compatibility bug with our notes editor with Samsung Keyboard on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings or try a different keyboard like gboard? Regards To Do Team.

content: Love the mobile app, but need companion app for Samsung Galaxy smartwatch! Also need an "Undo" button at top in case we accidentally mark a task complete. When there are a lot of tasks in a list, and a lot of completed tasks on that list, it's a hassle to scroll and find the task accidentally marked as complete. Also, next to the "star" icon for each task, we need the "sun/day" icon to be able to quickly and easily add a task to "My Day". Thanks!

"New feature: tasks will show up on your 'My Day' on the day they are due." I'm not trying to find an app to reinforce my bad habits of waiting to the last moment. In the Outlook desktop app you can have tasks show up on the day you plan to start working on them. Why isn't this the default? This is planning. Waiting to see something automatically come up on your to-do list on the day it is due just doesn't make sense... Does it?

Great integration between phone and desktop but it has one very major flaw.. You have no ability to plan your day prior to that day starting which defeats the purpose of having a planning tool. This seems like a pretty easy fix. I'm starting to look elsewhere for the perfect "to do" app. Haven't found it yet but there are definitely ones better than this.
