Bought up Wonderlist, a free, beautifully simple app that could be shared with others, and turned it into this corporate nonsense. Friend and i installed this as the "upgrade" from wonderlist, used it for maybe a week, and then we both uninstalled it. That was more than a year ago and we're still mad that Microsoft took a good thing, murdered it, and tried to replace it with something twice as bulky and half as good.

Fine until recent update. It was a perfectly serviceable app for to do lists until it recently started popping up alerts every day saying, "What will you do today?" This interrupts work, music, podcasts, and actually takes away from productivity because I pick up my phone to see if it's an actual alert. I don't seem to be able to get rid of this without turning off all notifications, which would invalidate using a To do list app at all. Totally unnecessary.

I use for many reminders, some weekly, some monthly, even some yearly. I love the ability to organize tasks into folders and set recurring reminders. Lately, reminders have been hit or miss, often not going off. I hope this is fixed soon. I also just had a big scare where many of my recurring tasks disappeared, but they returned after I updated. I would still recommend this app... but don't rely on it too heavily.

I really loved Wunderlist, from the UI, to the functionality, all of it. Moving to To-Do has mostly been a disappointment and a minor frustration. I've encountered numerous bugs with the widget (which itself is very picky about where you aught to be tapping in a way I've found unintuitive) and the core menus feel clunky compared to Wunderlist. Since this is (supposedly) the same development team, I can only assume this will improve over time. It's not terrible, but it's not Wunderlist.

Excellent potential, but very slow to get up to speed on essentials (at least to me) for task managers. Main impediment: you cannot set up a recurring task to start again from the date completed (as opposed to always cycling off of the first due date). For example, I may want a reminder to clean my cat's litter box every month -- but if I don't complete it until week 5 (sorry, cat!), the next reminder pops up in 3 weeks, instead of in a month, when it's actually needed again.

Covers the basics of a todo app and hasn't crashed. Has a nice feature of the flagged email however for in box zero folks like me, not that big of deal. One glaring omission is the ability to send an email to your task list. Also, it is crazy to me that they have notes but it doesnt utilize onenote! They have a perfect integration advantage that they aren't leveraging.

Mostly works, but it's irritating when you have to log out and back in to force the lists to sync fully. Sometimes it doesn't even work so you have to do it multiple times. And there are times repeating tasks will randomly stop repeating. It's especially upsetting when you've removed over 100 tasks from one list and it isn't reflected on your other linked device, or if you share with another person and eat they see isn't synced.
replyContent:
Hey Phoenix,

Sorry for the inconvenience caused. We have made some Sync related bug fixes in recent releases. 
Can you please update to our latest release. Please contact us at todohelp@microsoft.com if the issue persists.  

Thanks.

content: I have been using this app on my samsung for last 2 years, i have found good in it. It's a good app for reminders and to do list. Now i have changed to oppo A9, the only issue i am facing, the reminders notifications which are not completed, disappear from my screen in the night same day. It's annoying for me because I have to find those incomplete reminders in the app one by one and set them again. It would be fine, if unfinished tasks should not disappear. Stars would be 5üòä. Thanks

For a little over a week, I've been experiencing a bug where every time I create a new to-do/item in a list, the little icon pops up indicating there's a note in the item, even though there never is. I've even tried adding and removing a note to see if it goes away, and it doesn't make any difference. Not a huge deal, but it takes up space on my screen and makes it harder to find list items that do actually have notes, so it's been fairly annoying.

I guess I got tuned into Wunderlist a little late. Knowing that Microsoft Todo is going to replace it is a let down. Todo is lacking when it comes to the wonderful UI of Wunderlist. I'm wondering why after 3 years this replacement still isn't where Wunderlist is today. There is no option to organize lists into folders. Also, there is no option to add a completed tasks section to the main screen. Even when show completed takes is turned on, they disappear in the important (task) section when completed.

I like the tasks with check boxes. It's awkward to schedule tasks into the calendar or move them around for a more daily checklist, but it keeps my to-do list accessible if not so well organized. Other features aren't easy to use or understand without putting in more effort than I care to for an app that's about convenience. I'll soon be using a new phone; this one is older and not compatible with many newer apps. I'll be looking for something that suits me better. One good thing-not many ads!‚≠ê

Came over from Wunderlist. Quite disappointing how many things don't work consistently or don't work at all. Shared lists are wildly inconsistent at syncing properly. I think using the website version of the app might throw things off. Overall, shared lists don't work consistently. You can set up recurring or custom tasks to repeat on certain days, but recurring reminders is again wildly inconsistent. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Also no folders for lists. Needs improvement

The best of what I've tried and that's a lot. No list or task app really handles recurring tasks well. This one is no different. Most things are great. I like having an app version in windows. Good for sharing. Sub groups would be nice. Moving and organizing can be difficult. Overall 3, that's still the best of the lot and this is the one I still just.

Been searching for a good list app for over a year now and this one has come the closest to capturing the qualities I'm looking for. It's very well organized and focused. Edit: Keeps popping up notifications for features I've already declined, and keeps resetting my settings. This is obnoxious. I'm going to switch to a different list app.
replyContent: Hi Timothy, we have made few fixes around these issues in our latest versions. Can you try the latest version? Regards To Do Team.

content: I switched to this app from Wunderlist and was pleased to find that you can sort a list (completed and incomplete) alphabetically. However, this feature just been downgraded so that now the completed tasks can no longer be sorted! I'm so disappointed! Why did they make this change!? I'm so frustrated. It takes forever to make my grocery list now.
replyContent: We are sorry for the inconvenience and are working on this issue. Do let us know if you have any other feedback or suggestions, by writing to us at todofeedback@microsoft.com. We would love to hear from you!

content: It takes too many click to add a task with a reminder. Also, if you mistakenly press back while adding a task, you lose everything you typed. The task should be saved immediately after being created, unless it was empty. I frequently use the reminders. I do not want to set a due date though, but I am forced to just to have the tasks sorted. An option to sort by reminder date/time would solve my problem.

There seems to be a large number of inconsistencies in the expected behaviours and results of this ToDo app, mostly in comparison to Wunderlist. For example, setting a reoccurring task with a reminder doesn't seem to recreate the reminder accordingly the same way it did in Wunderlist. The UI/UX seems nicer overall, though. But pedantic "power users" like myself may not like it as much as Wunderlist.

The app is easy to use, but lacks the ability to list a task into multiple groups/categorize, to move an existing task into a group/category, and to group by categories in daily to-do lists. The category issue is a big deficit. It's hard to plan without it. (The flexibility with categories is what makes Outlook so outstanding -- such a shame not to find it it's "sister app.")

Tried this out after the Wunderlist team was purchased by Microsoft and are pushing it on us in-app in Wunderlist. Unfortunately, it seems to have some bugs, particularly when list sharing with other people. Getting lots of errors and pop-up dialog boxes trying to share lists with others, possibly related to how long it takes when "getting a list ready" after sharing. Had to logout and clear storage a few times to get it setup. Going to compare with Remember The Milk (RTM) and report back.

Microsoft forces you to use your Microsoft account to use it, then never keeps you logged in long enough to get notifications. Sharing via text feels like I'm back on my Droid phone, and trying to get updates to shared lists suffers from the forced log outs as well. Also can't customize "smart lists" that are stuck at the top. My Day and Tasks? That's the same thing for me, either let me put it at the bottom or let me remove them. Microsoft took Wunderlist and ruined it.

I had no problems with it's predecessor, Wunderlist, but ever since it was purchased by Microsoft, I've been having some issues. The biggest problem is that checking off some of my recurring reminders will end them all together so I won't be reminded again. This is a big problem for my monthly reminders about subscription services and bills.

Great app, but obnoxiously turns notifications back on. I turn off daily tasks reminder notification and days later it turns itself back on. This has happened at least 3 times. Microsoft, please fix this pesky bug. Also, the wunderlist app let me assign a task during creation. To do app does not allow this and requires extra steps to create the task, open it back up, and then assign it.

Why don't you remove the task after it's completed? We have recurring weekly tasks and when we check it off, you have to manually remove the task from the list. Am I supposed to have like 80 completed tasks like a psychopath? üòÜ I like things uncluttered. I might be able to let it go if I didn't get a notification EVERY TIME my husband removes an item because he's equally neurotic? I can't change notification settings for that either. I want to be notified of task completion, not removal.

Meh, it integrates with everything else 365 and I'm kind of stuck in their web currently. It's a little too simplistic, I know a lot of people that have stuck with OneNote for their To Do items if staying within 365 realm. Google Tasks and Keep work much better. To Do does have a lot of potential but it's needs to be more robust without overcomplicating it. I'm still working on it but realizing that while their Automation seems cool, that it's just doing for me what Google has done for years.

I want to love this app as it's an easy to use scheduler and list maker that's synced across my phone and computer. Problem is the reminders just don't work 80% of the time on either platform. I set up a reoccurring task at a certain time and it successfully sends me a reminder for two days in a row and then nothing. I check the task and it has a crossed out bell next to the task. Why though? I didn't change anything and I definitely do want notifications. This happens everytime.

I like this application a lot. It is a very productive too. They only issue I have is with the notifications. They seem to quit working after a while. I don't know what necessarily makes them start working again... Either starting the app back up, restarting my phone, or both. Nothing else seems to have this issue.

It's good for organization, but you can't recover accidentally deleted tasks or lists unless you have a completely separate desktop app, and even then, you need a subscription to that app in order to fully use it. Giving three stars for overall list making quality, but I can't give it any more than that until there's a less convoluted way to restore deleted files.

I am a heavy wunderlist user. I have been waiting for ages for them to port ALL functionalities of the later in todo. Importing is still destroying the dates when you have a periodicity and the app still cannot add the sub tasks from wunderlist as sub task... instead it turns them into notes. You will also loose the calendar integration via the subscription functionality. I'll wipe again all records in todo and wait for it to be a better replacement to wunderlist before i fully switch. If you never used wunderlist, the app is good though. My Day is a good idea overall, but having to do it every day is a bit tiring. It should integrate automatically tasks due today and let you add what ever you want manually. I assume they want people to have a fresh start in todo...

Impressive UI, smooth function. My complaint is that it does not always warn me and when it does it is no pressing enough to get my attention. I'd rather have a louder and more pronounced reminder. There are many things Microsoft can do to learn from Wunderlist and other such applications.

While it's nice that there is a list tool in the MS ecosystem, this is highly inferior to other services. You cannot share with people outside your "organization" and not all features are available in the app and desktop versions, so you will need to switch. Reminders do not repeat. It is difficult to organize the lists.

Good app, I like it. I wish they would add priority filters to the tasks. And I don't understand why it's neccessary to have a wifi connection just to attach a photo from internal files. Kind of senseless. I like the interface, also wish there was option to do split screen (default), or full screen. Only trick around that is to change your device screen size in settings to force a full screen in Microsoft To Do.

Please change the app so that reminders that have fired and not been dealt with yet roll up into one entry in the notification shade at the top of the phone screen; other reminder apps (Easy Bills Reminder, for example), as well as apps like Messages, LinkedIn, etc. combine/roll up notifications into one entry there. As things are now, To Do takes up way too much space on the notification shade when there are multiple reminders to deal with.

Like the app. Been using it for a few weeks now. Syncing across devices is great. The fatal flaw seems to be that using it is tied to OneDrive's quota. At least I think that is the problem. If your OneDrive is full, ToDo nags you. But when I click on "Learn More" it just takes me to Bing, not to a real help page. Like Google, Microsoft wants you to purchase extra storage. So they make it cumbersome to manage your free storage space on MsToDo, OneDrive and Outlook. Pity.

A clean, polished, useful task manager. I was sad at first when hearing that Wunderlist is being replaced with this, but after using it for a little I've decided it is almost as good, maybe even better than Wunderlist. Both actually have very similar UIs and functions. Not something to get up in arms over in my opinion. Edit: it's been a while, and sadly I think my initial review was too positive. Nothing noticably useful has been added, still too barebones compared to many other apps out there.

Previously used Wunderlist and was really happy with the experience, but with the transition to Microsoft, I really do not like that my daily tasks don't automatically update. When I used the option to suggest features, I got a curt response from the development team that the feature was unnecessary. I understand the team has their own ideas on what helps people be productive, but that doesn't work for everyone. I will be replacing it with an app that does have this feature.

NOTE TO DEVELOPMENT TEAM: The app is great! I did however lose functionality when migrating to this new software format from Wunderlist. PLEASE CONSIDER: expanding print format capability, the capability to print the list is limited to a single format of an 8 1/2"x11" paper. I appreciated the capability in "Wunderlist" of customizing my format like any other document, for instance I used a watermark and brought the format sizing down so that I could print on an index card for my daily planner.

Works great but if you want to export and archive list, That's not supported, which makes it hard to use when some things can go on indefinite hold but still continue to overcrowd lists. I don't want to delete them because I will need it in future so If I can export and import items, it allows me to keep list clutter free.
replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback! We'll consider adding export and archive list options in a future update. Thank you for your patience as we work on this and many other improvements to the Microsoft To-Do app!

content: At first glance I really liked it, but I'm having a problem where if I have a recurring task that is past due, none of the new tasks get generated until I complete the old one. And the old task's notification disappears after a few hours if I don't get to it on time. This causes me to constantly miss things if I can't get to it right away

After 8 hours, the sync with Wunderlist mysteriously completed. It's still not the app I'm looking for. Does not support RFC2822 compliant email addresses with plus signs. "Unable to sync", imported about half of my Wunderlist data, now the Android app thinks it's no longer connected to the internet. Web app reports "Something went wrong" while trying to import from Wunderlist. Does not appear to be a useful "List" app, only focusing on ToDo items. Not a good replacement for Wunderlist.

I really like that this app is available across all platforms. I wish it had a better integration with Outlook. I'm a long time and power user of the Microsoft Outlook Tasks. The major features I'm missing: - recurrent option of "regenerate on completion" . e.g. repeat every 2 months after completion. - ability to just type dates (selecting a date through controls is too tedious and time consuming)

The mobile app is great, but the desktop version is awful. The desktop version does not sync well; steps from tasks go missing at random and other are randomly crossed out. I picked this app because it has a desktop version, but the dekstop version is pretty useless since it doesn't sync properly. Fortunately, even though the desktop version randomly deletes some task steps and crosses out others, this is not reflected in the mobile app. Would be five stars otherwise.

Hi. We migrated our lists from wunderlist. We use shared list but now even we shared the lists that were previously shared, they do not sync, so other people don't see the completed items. If they assign a task, they can't see it completed. There are duplicate lists with the same name, one is shared, the other one is not. When creating new shared lists, the people who received the invitation are unable to join. they see an error "list unavailable" I tried support, but unavailable.

It's okay, wish it synced with the rest of office better, the workflow is just kind of slow and clunky, maybe it's just me. I will say that the fact that there's no way to just have a app icon for how many things are left on your to do list is absurd, I've tried and tried to get that to work, because the app icon would draw my attention and I have adhd, so getting app icons would instantly take it to a 5 and I would deal with the clunkyness. But no app icons, very frustrating...

Almost everything I am looking for. When I build a routine task once a month, I don't want to see the task till that month is up and then I want reminders constantly until it gets done. Not one reminder yesterday. I would love for my tasks to be anchored to the notification bar until complete (anchored until rescheduled for another day or complete, not just silencing the reminder). Lastly you need a search function, especially for completed tasks.

Mediocre Replacement This app is supposed to be taking the place of other list and to do makers, but it does not. This app builds Check-off lists. Nothing more, no matter how they try to dress it up. In the immortal words of Sarah Palin, "Putting lipstick on a pig...." This only makes check-off lists. You can't make a list with numbers or dots or dashes. You can't alphabetize it other than having still be a check-off list. Looking for another app. This one truly Microsoft sucks.

It is good overall. However, the recent Plan Your Day auto turn on, settings and reminder notifications do not really increase productivity as they claim. It is rather distracting. In addition, 9am to start planning your day is a little too late, not to mention things that I need to do today was already planned and reminder set days ahead. Hope it is just a bug they will fix, not that their logics that everyone should start planning their day at 9am of the day.

It's good but I really hate that this is here instead of wunderlist. Wunderlist was much easier to use and somehow more organized. It was easier to add people to certain to do lists and accomplish things together. In this app I absolutely can't figure out how to add another person to a to do list. Adding another is so complicated

I love the idea of this app but it seems to have issues syncing. I have the app integrated with my Office 365 account and have it installed on my desktop as well. When I update tasks on my phone app, it doesn't consistantly sync to Office. Same thing for my desktop app. I end up having to adjust each platform separately. NOT SMART AT ALL.

I am a loyal user of the Microsoft To Do app and find it incredibly helpful for managing my tasks. However, one feature I would love to see added is the ability to customize reminder sounds. It would greatly enhance personalization and make the app even more user-friendly. I hope the developers can consider implementing this feature in a future update. Thank you!
replyContent: Hi Bemi, you can customize reminder sounds in settings. Go to, Settings > Reminder Settings > Reminder Customizations > Sound and change the notifications to desired sounds. Thanks To Do Team.

content: The app is great, would have used it as my free replacement to todoist, but there were two dealbreaker issues with it. 1. The widget didn't refresh at times, it remained stuck, the only way to fix it was to delete it and add it back again to the homescreen. 2. The notifications dint work.

This is an extremely good app with lots of features and even works as a task checklist manager in small offices. But, I'm sticking with 3 stars for just one reason. The lack of a Wear OS version for To Do really sucks. Even though I love this app, I'm gonna stick with "Tick tock" because that's literally the only app which gives me interoperability across all my devices aka Watch, Mobile and Laptop. I really wish they bring a Wear OS version which seamlessly syncs across all the devices.

The app doesn't save my tasks many times in real time, and when I add some step inside a task and come out of it, then when I open the task again, it doesn't add that step, as if some bug has not allowed to save the last changes I made to the task. It should work real time just like 'Keep Notes' of Google. Should have inbuilt app lock just like the Telegram app. It's difficult to move the blinking cursor to the starting of the line and when tried a lot it just swipes the task to delete it.

Love this except that it would be really helpful to be able to move/re-order the steps (within the task), and move completed steps to the bottom of the list. If you have a lot of steps and then complete some, it's hard to see what's still outstanding. The same goes for the desktop version which is part of my Office 365 package.

This is a great app for keeping track of things to do. How the app handles recurring tasks is lacking. When one has fallen behind on a recurring tasks, the function to catch up to current task overshoots and sets the next task a few tasks in the future. It's like it doesn't know what day it is, when clearly it knows the date. Would mark this 5 stars if the math to catch up is corrected and if a new function to set recurrence based on last completed recurrence is introduced. Sorely needs that!

In recent days the 'planned' smart list stopped showing today's tasks whose reminder went off earlier in the day. Now you have to select the 'today' filter in the 'planned' smart list to show today‚Äôs tasks as the ‚Äòall planned‚Äô filter doesn‚Äôt show them. This is obviously a bug in the latest version. It occurs on Android and Windows apps, while the Web To-Do still works as expected, meaning the 'all planned' filter also shows today's tasks whose reminder went off earlier today.

Before the update, it used to default to a due date of today. Now as soon as you start typing the task, it clears the due date and you have to select it again. Can this be put back the way it was? I have added tasks thinking they were getting assigned to today then forgot about them when they didn't show up in my daily list.

Reordering tasks is different now. I used to be able to just drag and drop tasks in the list. Now you have to click on the 3 dots icon and then click reorder. Then you have to click on the up or down arrows next to each task to reorder them. It's extremely tedious and I don't know why they changed it.

Update last year makes it more difficult to use, when managing list (adding, editing) I can no longer easily get back to non-editing view (focused on the list). I have to back out of list and go back in in order to use it

Option needed, remind me at time, is always set to 9am. Don't want all notifications coming at same time. By default it is set to 9am. Have to go to pick time to change. Can change start of week to different day, but not the time.

I'm not sure I understand this app and I'm not sure if that is because of me or because of the app. It seems the language of apps could be more clear-cut, more streamlined. Sometimes I just really want to sit with everyone and show how it all could be better! A better user experience for all. Not just for one person, but for all. I strive to be the Christian woman God Calls me to be, but sometimes I just get so frustrated with it all! (Sigh) I'm sorry‚ô•Ô∏è
Okay but not great. Really wish it included some of the features of Outlook's Task options like progress and status. I have no way to track progress to show something is in progress.

Great, however the should work on the word placing in the My Day tab, it clashes with go back icon. On the top left corner. Also they should allow for custom month reminders example I want a reminder to be set for the first Sunday of every month, the present reminder is quite basic.
The desktop version of this app, while not very functional, is easy to understand and works stable. The Android version is a UX mess and a bugfest.

Make the list searchable within the list. If you have a lot of tasks within a list, get ready to do a LOT of scrolling to find that task Edit: new version and there *still* isn't a useful search. My review still stays a 3 instead of a 5

The widget cannot be resized. I prefer the setup of Microsoft To Do widget side by side with the outlook calendar widget. It will be awesome to watch upcoming events and tasks at the same time, will help to boost my productivity.

I really love Microsoft To Do, since times when the app was called Wunderlist. Unfortunately, there is no gCal support as for now. So it became very inconvenient for me to use the app. Also the widget is broken most of the time
Each time an upcoming event or task notification appears, my phone freezes with the error of System UI Stopped working. I have a Note 20 Does anyone else have the same issue ? ü§î

It seems quite usual to me according to MS apps: they're ok, but they could do much better considering especially a company of that size and market position. The example here: it supports the very basic functions, but similar apps like "nine" have waaay more options to configure and functions that the app fits to personal needs. Like this it's just not a very useful app, once again..

Thisa very good app but, i need to set a time and date for certen tasks. Some tasks need to be done by 21 days then 90 days and go on. Some tasks are for my health need to be reminded at a clock. It could a lotbetter.

I have loved this app for a couple of years now since I transferred from wunderlist, however since upgrading to another Samsung s22, when I type in the note section it scrolls down and I have to try and delete while typing. Please please fix the glitch. I used this app for my farm, diary, plans, shopping and well everything. I can't even copy and past the notes on to another app with out it glitching
replyContent: Hi Annette, There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support:1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID.Regards,To Do Team

content: a small opinion please add lock the list feature like in color notes app ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüëçüî• thats really help us because sometimes we want our list to not seen by anyone in the home widget and when we tab to open it, it requires fingerprint or password to open it and see or edit it thanks.

Loved it, but something's broken now. It does a great job of organizing my tasks but now when I go in to edit the notes I have for a task, the app freezes and crashes after a few seconds. It happens on both my phone and tablet so it's not isolated to just one device.
replyContent: Hi Nolan, There is compatibility bug with notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,To Do Team

content: Firstly, the alarm duration needs to be longer. It is easy to miss a notification with the current alarm/notification duration. Secondly, there should be a place where all tags are stored for easy referencing. It gets confusing when there are many tags attached to different tasks in the app. Thirdly, the "completed" list should allow users to sort by date and export such sorted list by the date to make weekly/monthly task reporting easy and lastly there should be sorting by tags within a list.

Possible problem due to recent Samsung keyboard update. Opened the note field of an item and the app started inserting endless carriage returns and boldfacing text. As per developer response, turning off predictive text patches the problem. Cannot rename file attachments. Recurring events do not have unique commenting, so comments made on the first instance stay with the whole series. Sorting by importance is reversed for completed tasks against those that are still current.
replyContent: Hi Wobbly,There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,To Do Team

content: The latest version is terrible. Wrongly coded and a touch and hold simply selects the task. And to move it, it needs few attempts. Selecting the task should only happen when the option button is tapped. And press and hold should immediately make it ready to be moved. That is so basic and they broke it.
It's great. Next, add option to end recurring task and add black amoled background widget.

I have an issue regarding the widget resizing. I want it smaller but it has a limit. And the smallest size covere the 40% height of the screen. Needs more shrinking so it doesn't Covers unnecessary space on the screen.
Would be nice if it was possible to merge outlook calendar and to do list. And also it certainly needs to have sublist to be able to add steps in some work.

Since about August 2022, this app (and possibly the company portal app, teams app, SharePoint app and Outlook app) are causing my phone to heat up considerably. I have to uninstall the app to get a normal temperature phone.
Simple design, but optimization isn't that great. There is a lot of freezes on my phone.
App works okay but has a big. I have the app to set Monday as my first day of the week but when I attempt to change the date it continues to show Sunday.

Describing the latest bug here has become a biweekly occurrence. Some (but not all?) recurring task notifications are failing to account for Daylight Savings, so my 1pm reminders are showing up at 2pm, 9pm reminders showing up at 10pm, etc. We use these reminders to take our medications on time and this does not help.
The app serves the purpose, but not being able to sort by categories makes it nearly useless for me.

glitchy - when you type in the note area there are paragraphs added by themselves slow sync - sometimes my tasks show on Samsung calendar, other times they don't By now you would think that when you made a reminder that had the word "call", you'd get a popup with your contacts to select the person and then when the reminder went off all you had to do was tap the linked contact and voila, a phonecall.
replyContent: Hi Jupiter,There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: Like the integration with the outlook client. Unfortunately manual order between full client is different than the order done via the app and if you search tasks, you don't see the titles in the search results, with that overview gets lost.

What happened to the auto suggestions? Why would anyone not like that within a single list? Why do I have to scroll through hundreds of entries to find one I've used before or enter the same thing in the same list 10 times? What's the point of checking something off then if you will never find it again?

Using this from Wunderlist app, but now after installed replacing this quite some time failed to login using my previous email account backed up from Wunderlist. It keep says that my account is locked even tried twice changed my password twice but it never works to login and the code can only be received via email and never works via phone number regardless tried from my friend's number phone as suggested. Please help!

My go to planning app, would love to turn off My Day. Reasons for not rating 5 stars: (1) Turn Off Suggestions doesn't remember your choice, very annoying (2) Print Options suck/non-existent (3) no share to Word to format for printing so I can change font/size (I now share to email and cut/paste to Word -- dear lord can't you code to export to your own office suite?).

Such a nice app üòÑ , It helps me a lot to keep me up to date , but when I set a reminder it shows only notification it does not sound. so, I request Microsoft team that, when reminder display on screen at that time it must ring. Otherwise users will not be able to complete that IMPORTANT task at their seted time

STOP THE SUGGESTIONS!! No matter how many times I tell the app not to suggest items for my lists, it keeps turning that setting on for all of them. There's no way to turn the option off by default, either.

While the app is good, I am having an issue as the app is getting handed multiple times since few months. Can you please help me sort the issue. Even when i complete a task and tick it off. The movement from upcoming to pending task is slow and lagging can you please help me with this

Still needs some work, particularly in dealing with custom themes. Doesn't maintain across cache clears (even though it holds blank "placeholders") . Annoyingly won't reset default search path. Notifications are VERY unreliable.

Stop auto changing my remind times please!!!! What a week? after daylight savings all of my remind times got pushed forward by an hour..... There are things I like on this app but the remind times are always a little finicky and it drives me a little mad.
Great interface. Some repeating tasks don't work, intermittently. Edit (17 March): Reminders getting dismissed. Almost unusable now. Trying the Beta to see if problem is resolved.

This app used to be great. I mainly use it for shopping lists. The auto suggestion was great and made adding items super easy. Now most of the time the suggestions never appear. Then occasionally they do appear but bear no resemblance to what I am typing. Whats going on?
replyContent: Hi Dawn, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-ON, relaunch should not turn settings back OFF. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: I'd like it to click and drag and make as many(or at least 10 levels) of sub-tp-dos and link it to a goal or an estimated goal time

The basic functionality is there and it's free, so that's great, but man - it's such an UX mess. Why are there 3 almost identical groups? They all seem to show you same tasks, except that "All" shows you them all without completed ones (which is, you know, far from what "all" means), "Tasks" show you all your tasks except the ones added to custom groups, and "Planned" shows you all of them. WHY? It itches my brain as I am literally unable to comprehend what is this app about. Overengineered AF.
I wish I could add times to the due date and maybe a pomodoro timer. Needs more variety of features

When is this app going to be updated to: "ALLOW SORTING BY REMINDER DATE". I have been waiting for over a year now. Most all similar "To Do" apps have this USEFUL sorting by "Reminder" date. I said I would keep using this app until it is updated to allow for this sort. It's been over a year with no change. I have submitted in detail to your company regarding the disadvantages of only being able to sort on the due date. Time for change. The "Reminder" date helps meet due dates.
Just OK. This app often sends out very old reminders and is not really dependable for important tasks since its messages are not conspicuous and may be overlooked. No sounds are played to remind.
Despite regular bug reporting, I'm still getting intermittent suggestions. Also can't turn off suggestions to see if turning on again fixes it. Sometimes works after an update for a short while.

Since the last update, I can't reorder My Day tasks the way I want. The Reorder function only works with tasks created on the same date. And yes, I tried disabling the 'put the newest tasks on top' button, but it didn't work.
App is good, but they cut most useful feature - integration with Alexa. Instead if writing things down, I was able to dictate them to Alexa. This is no longer working.
would like to be able to change display order of list on left, i.e., Make "All" be at top of list, then tasks, then My Day.
I added a new account and now cant switch back. Please fix this, I can't even click the "settings, manage account nor add account"

Overall it's a nice design. Not even close to Wunderlist but it's fine. However, after the last 2 updates or so, the icon stays frozen for a few miliseconds before opening or normally I have to tap twice to get it open. The app itself is not bad, and I understand it's a work in progress, but you guys (Developers Team) should really listen to people's concerns or suggestions to make the app better every day.

Overall, the app does what it's supposed to do, but a few quality of life features would go a long way - for one, a list for "later this week" would be nice, as would the ability to nest lists more than one deep. However, the Achilles' heel of the system is definitely its sync. Syncing frequently fails or takes forever, and is often too slow between devices to make the most of the other capabilities of the app. Honestly if a better option came out I'd jump ship in a heartbeat.

This app is a tiny and easy to master planner and organizer. The interface is neat, and it has AMOLED dark theme. Everything is fine until I noticed that repeating tasks are not being repeated when there is no internet connection, which is for a traveller, is a hassle. I wish repeating tasks can be repeated again on the next day once checked even if the device is not connected to the internet.

On the surface, the app ticks all the features I require from a todo list, and there isn't a better one out there for me right now (yes, I come from Wunderlist). However, there are some problems that make MS To Do awkward to use. 1. You can share lists and assign tasks. This would work a million times better if I could select multiple tasks and assign them to someone, instead of tapping through 3 different views for each task, one by one, and if I could assign someone while I'm adding a new task. Web version is also missing "assign to" in the context menu. 2. When setting reminders, it's really not that convenient to click through a "shortcut" menu, when I can never use the times listed in the "shortcuts". Not everyone's day begins at 09:00 local time. Can you just let me always skip directly to the date & time picker on both due dates and reminders, so that I don't have to second guess every tap? 3. It's cool that we can have themed lists, but the feature is next to useless when I can't set a default theme for all lists at once. I have 20 lists, not counting the weird default "Tasks" list. I'm not gonna go through every single one of them every time I want to change my list background or something.

I've been using this for a couple of months now from wunderlist. Some things still don't feel not right. 1) I cannot find how to assign a task to someone in a shared list. If it is possible, then it's not intuitive to find like wunderlist was. 2) Once I am in a list and press back on my phone, the application exits. When I press back I want to be able to enter a screen where all my lists of lists are displayed instead of pressing the hamburger button with my non dominant hand (left)
replyContent:
Hi Vanessa.
Thanks for your feedback. It is currently not possible to assign tasks in Microsoft To-Do, but we are actively working on it and we hope to have it ready very soon. Regarding the navigation, we are also working on it (join our Beta program if you are interested in a preview).
Best regards.

content: I am a long time user and lover of Wunderlis, the predecessor of this app. And I like the new concept, I was using the old app as a to do list as well BUT there are a few things I take issue with: 1. you cannot reange the order of your tasks. 2. in every list you have to check the box: make finished tasks invisible/visible. The combination of the 2 make it impossible to stay organized. I hope they fix this stuff soon, I don't see any reason why this isn't already a feature.

Much prefer the look/layout of Wunderlist. Lots of little things in To Do that aren't as good as Wunderlist and it's a huge shame that it is being retired for this. As a minimum, everyone should have the option of making it look exactly the same so we don't notice the difference. As it is, the text is too big, extra items that can't be turned off such as 'My Day' clutter the screen and it just doesn't look/feel as good. Shame

Mostly works well, but I am rather disappointed with the syncing issues my wife and I are experiencing. I'm unsure as to what Microsoft has changed from the "Wunderlist" app that I've been forced to switch from, but this app does not work as quickly and nicely as wunderlist did, which I had been using for 2 to 3 years constantly because it worked so well. Please revise this app so that connectivity problems from servers can be solved. I am unable to sync some/all of my shared lists.

Overall good app to handle todo lists and the sharing feature is very useful. It would be good if ticking off multiple items were easier though (items below the one you just ticked off start moving right away, making it difficult to tick those off as well... I always need to remember to tick off items bottom to top) + why is there no shortcut to delete all items that are done?

I'm enjoying the app so far. The only pain point is when editing a list item. I'm using a mobile device and it's difficult to drop the cursor at the front without accidentally checking the item off. A little more space between the writing and the check circle might eliminate this problem. It also struggled to upload a photo to a list item. An error message came up instead. Otherwise, so far so good.

I love the look, it's definitely easy to look at. Also it's very user-friendly but I only gave 3 stars because I want the developers to prove on the notification. I hope there's a variety of option on how to notify when the task is due. Like an annoying alert, where it goes on for 3 minutes just to make sure I do it immediately. In conclusion, I hope you add a more dynamic reminder and notification the same with the other to-do list app, like TickTick.

New to this app but so far seems to be a good app. I have some short term memory loss, so this app allows user to get things done/scheduled on a daily basis. Disappointed when I checked a specific item as completed & it kept coming back on my list as an open task. After searching I found it was previously marked to be reminded "Daily." Suggesting some type of message to confirm completion so the user would not waste time trying to figure out what's what.

This is a great to do list app to use. Highly recommend it. The only issues I have is that on all platforms except iOS, the tasks(or to dos) listed in the Planned List of the app are sorted alphabetically. Adding the list option to the Planned list would be an awesome addition to the app. It'd also be great if you introduced location based reminders to the app. A bonus feature would be enabling the app to set both location and time based reminders. Either way, it's still a great app üëç
replyContent: Hi, thank you for getting in touch and sharing what you'd like to see in the app! and I'm delighted to let you know that our engineering team will have a discussion on this feature. Thank you for taking time to leave your comment and helping shape To Do!

content: reinstate the hamburger menu so that we can just swipe to get all heads under that... It will be convenient

Unfortunately, on Android, the Notification and My Day and many others never really worked properly. I used Wunderlist for a long time and moved away after Microsoft acquired it because of lack of features and tried again later. Now the second time, I move away to Todoist. The workflow, the details and just the whole feeling are 100x better. And it just works. I don't miss all my to-do's any longer.

Great app because i can keep all of my tasks synchronized to my laptop. Great for a student. But on mobile I can't create new tasks with a custom due date, because the keyboard doesn't go away in the calender to chose and I can't select any other dates than those in the first week, can't even reach the save/select button. Simple fixable error but it infuriates me every time it comes up.

Its ok. I've started using it when I found out wunderlist was going to end and be absorbed by Microsoft. I've used wunderlist for years so its a change. What I miss most is being able to manually adjust how my items were arranged I don't care much for alphabetical ordering and going from oldest to newest or newest to oldest as the only other available options are a bit annoying. I liked being able to sort my items as needed on the daily but maybe that's just me. I love'd my lists and now meh.

It's good, but there's an issue with swiping when writing in the Notes field - hitting backspace doesn't erase an incorrect swiped word, just a letter. It's completely different from all other texting applications & makes writing anything frustrating because you end up with partial words that don't make sense. Really not intuitive. I'm using GBoard which I get isn't the same company, but there's something in ToDo that is altering how it works. It also takes 3 clicks to open Notes to add to it.
OK app but haven't figured out how to move a task to a new day; so, it's not as intuitive as I'd like (and then again, it could just be me! )
Could be better but an overall decent app. There's much to learn from Todoist.

So as HUGE fan of Wunderlist I was devastated to hear that it was going to cease. Along comes To Do. So most of it works similar to Wunderlist which is good, but there's little things I just don't like. For example, when tapping on a list. Boxes are too BIG and in your face, text too big also. Main screen is ok. When ticking something off on a list how about something to divide to do and done from that list instead of everything together. Give us more customisation options for sizes, colours etc

Mostly really good, great for sharing tasks between people/phones/desktops, but the widgets on Android keep clearing themselves and have to be re-added to work again, and repeating tasks constantly change the day they alert you on, reminding me the day after or before I set them to. I keep having to edit them back again. Really frustrating. What's the point in a daily reminder if it keeps changing to try and alert you the day before it existed? Edit: and again, anytime there's a clock change!!!

Actually a great app, I'm migrating from Wunderlist, and I love the option to add tasks from other lists to "My Day" and focus on just those. The 3 stars are from glitches that I'm experiencing, that just make it troublesome for smooth working. First is the "from today" tray that keeps coming up endlessly, needing me to force quit the app, only to have it happen repeatedly. Secondly the widget that doesn't update either tasks I've added, or tasks I've marked as completed in the app.

Although ToDo has some similarities, it doesn't feel the same... I even tweaked the ToDo app icon to be the same of Wunderlist! I have been experiencing with My Day feature and I think it could be useful for me. Other options feel a little more "intrincate" and not as "natural flowing" as in Wunderlist, For example, having to delete a List from INSIDE IT!! I had to delete A LOT of them and it was really painful not having the option to multiple select and delete them all at once, the Add Task at the top of the list, and I also miss the "Completed" List... You just don¬¥t have to reinvent the wheel, and even less necessary is to make it square. Just make ToDo app EXACTLY as Wunderlist, and you`re done... why is that SO HARD!!!???? I'll miss you Wunderlist.... ToDo: you have BIG shoes to fill, my buddy, don't mess it up!!

Disappointing and unreliable. It's sad to see this app struggles to be as great as its predecessor: Wunderlist. If you set a daily reminder and one day forget to mark it as complete, the app will not remind you again about it. If the due date and reminder date are different you will not be reminded about the task. I don't care if I'm receiving a notification about a thing I had to do 3 weeks ago I just wanna be reminded. No one is this strict with dates. I hope this helps improve the app.

This app is a pale comparison to Wunderlist. When I import my tasks and lists from Wunderlist, I expected them to appear in the way I had them laid out previously.,band they did, for the most part. However, tasks set for today are not appearing in the My Day list. Why this is the case is beyond me however I'm hoping Microsoft will correct this in the next iteration.

It's ok. So this is what Wunderlist became, it's pretty similar, it's intuitive but it's lost features that made it not a suitable replacement. Specially the ability to export list which include hyperlinks in the notes (or anything in the notes) and no (official) add on for a browser like chrome. Deal breakers for me, moved to TickTick. Still miss Wunderlist :(
enjoying using the app just want to check If the reminders are more verbal.
If I were you, I'd update the posted trailer. Today's interface is much better.
Best for writing upcoming activities, though it needs a reminder.
not the best but serviceable and its the only choice due to microsoft

Switched from Wunderlist to To Do. One important feature that's missing is the lack of an equivalent Google Chrome extension that would allow me to add webpages as a task or item on my list. I hope this is something simple for the people at Microsoft to resolve and get right on it. I have always loved Wunderlist. I hope that To Do will be able to improve on, or at the very least, have all the features that I loved in Wunderlist. 3 stars for now.

Please at least put an option to use the previous theme. I like the previous one with flat design (minimalist). If you could also put a feature to have other place a comment on our list, that would be great. Kindly prioritize the option to use the minimalist/flat design theme... It is less distracting which makes me more productive. I recommended this to my friends because of its design... good thing my other device is not set to auto update.. i was able to retain the previous version...

Not as good as Wunderlist. Simple things make it less usable than its predecessor such as: 1. sharing internet page to a list and the list defaults to My Day instead of one of your choice or the last one you opened - makes adding lots of pages in a row slow. 2. Add new task from the widget puts it at the bottom of the list not the top. 3. Marking a task with a star doesn't move it to the top of the list. Other than that it looks smart and imported my old Wunderlist lists on 2nd attempt.

Wunderlist was much better with syncing performance. The migration process is quite painful; restoring shared lists for instance is not done for you and doing manually is not necessarily easy. Most annoying is that attachments are not migrated at all. Also, the layout and resolution is such that visibility of the app has decreased, so less items on your screen.

I'm liking it more as I continue to use it.  Microsoft To-Do is by no means a full-blown task manager. However, the longer I use it, the easier it fits into my routine.  My main likes:  - Syncs instantly with Microsoft To-Do on Windows 10.  - Provides a space to add notes.  - Can set a reminder.  - Has a sub-task feature called "Step".  - Has a "My Day" category which has potential.    Main issues:  - The Reminder/Snooze feature need mores work. The Snooze time seems to be broken. Can set 1 hour, but it still comes back in 5 min. Reminders create both To-Do app notifications and Windows 10 notifications. This gets annoying if you have more than one reminder set.    Wish list:  - I would like all unfinished tasks with the My Day flag to retain the May Day flag tomorrow. For me, this more closely matches how I used to roll-forward unfinished tasks on paper. It will save me extra steps each day.   - I would like to bulk-load Steps by cutting/pasting a list of steps from Excel or other external program - As an Office 365 user, I'd like to see more and better sharing/embedding integration between Office programs (e.g. Outlook 2016, OneNote, etc.) and the store apps like Microsoft To-Do.

Needs less clicks in UI. To delete a task you hold it until a drop down menu is available, but it would be competitive if a trash button displayed immediately to tap. Also it would be faster if small android widgets were available to pin each of your lists to the home screen. Other apps do this. Otherwise this app is a seamless way to stay synced when using outlook on a computer.

It was really good before the last update! I hate the new feature that copleted-list is separated and specially the sorting doesn't work on that part! (same as Wunderlist) I may understand some people prefer the old version of something but why you stepped back again when you have a good new function? Why you didn't just give us an option to choose between having the completed-list separated or merged? Or at least apply the sorting on this list as well! It's difficult to fine one to uncheck it

Update 02.04.20. I was using this for a while but I returned to my old task manager of 15 years (updated versions of course). I like this out because it syncs between android and my macbook pro. works a charm. only issue - doesn't handle recurring tasks such as "recurs on the second tuesday of the month. ..." etc. simple recurring tasks are fine (every second monday). overall very good. easy to use. Once recurring tasks are implemented completely this will be superior!
Recurring task reminder is asking for one time reminder? It's supposed to be reminded on every occurence
Looks OK, but cannot find any SOUND notification reminder possibility... Would you help me please?
Just check " Todoist app " in what improvements can be made App is good but lots of improvements needed wrt 2023 work life
it would be good if we get preview of image attached in note like in trello plz add it

i was expecting quite more from this. beautiful layout and colours and nice features, but it becomes incredibly annoying to move a task to my day when it's supposed to be there without any actions. what it lacks is also a calendar. i would love a calendar so i can just go into a date and view what tasks i have upcoming, but i understand this app isn't for everyone. one thing would also be so you can attach pictures to the task notes, it would REALLY help for me since i'd need reference pictures of the characters i need to draw since i mainly use these sorts of apps for art commissions from online. i uninstalled for now, but i may come back later.

It's mostly okay but I'm still looking for something better. I can't reorder my tasks on a given date - so I still need to make a to-do list in my calendar for a planned day (usually tomorrow). Also, it's not that flexible. For example, I can't move "steps" to a different task

This app is a clear downgrade from the app it replaced. Wunderlist was great. All that needed to be done would be to use the EXACT SAME FEATURES as Wunderlist. Instead of having the same features, it TOOK AWAY features...and did it add features? I don't think there's anything new in this app. But it's strange what was taken away: Copy and paste. Basically every program/app ever can copy and paste. The app this one replaced allowed copying and pasting tasks. But for some reason, if you want to copy and paste a task, you can't do it on your phone app. You can't do it on the desktop app. You can only just BARELY do it on the web browser app! And even then it's not even copy and paste! You need to clone the task to a separate list. Then you need to go to that list and then move the cloned task to the original list. And it doesn't sound too annoying, but keep in mind this is a MOBILE APP. Why do I have to not only go to my computer, NOT open the desktop app, but open the browser and navigate to a separate webpage for a functionality that almost every program has? Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V. Why is that missing? (and no, right clicking/long pressing doesn't work on the phone app or desktop app. Wunderlist was a 5-star app. But To Do loses points for removing such a basic feature that was easy to use in the original app that I can no longer use because To Do replaced it.
Lists won't update/sync between work and personal

Hi Team, The note taking app is simple enough to just make some quick lists. Regarding organizing of lists, it's a bit difficult, even impossible. I would suggest you make some tweaks to support basic GTD. As I understand, basically flexibility to move tasks easily across the list would do the trick. Looking forward to such a feature in the app.

"We‚Äôve moved your completed tasks to the bottom. Now you have easy access to the completed tasks without them getting in the way of your productivity." - I had just got used to the completed items staying where they are in the list, rather than moving to the bottom like the did in Wunderlist. I haven't decided which is better or worse for my workflow yet, but please give us the option to choose
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We hear you and will consider your request. If you have any other feedback or suggestions, please write to us at todofeedback@microsoft.com. We would love to hear from you!

content: Works fine as a list app (I was migrated from Wunderlist). Unfortunately I can't seem to turn off getting useless notifications about what I might want to do today. I need to turn off notifications at the app level, which means no notifications at all. If you're starting from scratch, start elsewhere.

Still frustratingly basic compared to Todoist. I'd love to move over and consolidate within the Microsoft ecosystem, but there's still so many quality of life areas that are lacking in To Do. Can I suggest starting with natural language support for setting up tasks though? It makes it so much quicker to use.

There are previous reviews of this app ranging from 1 star to 5 stars I have this app on three devices. One is not syncing properly. I have to sync it myself by turning my WiFi off, back on and then sync the app in the app's settings. I have had this app for at least six months and it synced properly between the three devices until a month ago. I am in touch with the developer.
replyContent:
Hi Newton,
Thank you for downloading our app! We will keep working on it! :)

content: It's OK. Hard to get a good overview because it's not good at hiding future tasks. It doesn't have a start date on tasks so I keep seeing my "send Christmas card" tasks even though it's only February...

Was great but now for some reason the auto suggestions doesn't work right. If I turn it off and then back on it will work for a little bit and then stop again. It used to work the way it was supposed too.
replyContent: Hi Ruby, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-off, relaunch should not turn settings back ON. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: The experience has been pretty good and I like the smart reminders feature. But I can't make a smart reminder like, "everyday 5 am go for a run"
It would have been perfect if it could remind the tasks based on your location. In the early days of Cortana you could do it. It's a big shame that you can not do it now.
It's a good app, however, I'd like it to have a calendar feature so I could see my to-do list and progress long-term.

I used to like Tasks (Google) but I was no able of doing certain things like seeing in a single place all tasks scheduled for "Today" from the different tasks lists I have. Well, I've found that feature and several others in this app that I'm liking a lot. Real happy with the change from previous app to this one. Edit: Daily reminders stopped working for some reason. I've tried all the debugging steps advised by Microsoft with no success.

I get a bit frustrated that it's not very versatile in how lists can be organised and I find I inadvertently delete items too easily. But I haven't tried many of the alternative apps to see if they are any better. I have used it for about 6 years, previously as wunderlist, and it's my most used app.

Getting there but missing two main Wunderlist features I use all the time: Automatically adding to-dos to your calendar if you want and folders. 3 stars until those features are added. I used the add to calendar feature ALL the time. It's the one I miss most. I've gone back to using Wunderlist for the time being because of this.

My experience with the app itself, I've changed from 4 to 3 stars. Great little app for what it does. What would bring it back up? Sync of all tasks not just those created by default Outlook Task templates (yes that's server side). A setting for Next Week to pick the day of my choice. Gesture configuration options. Feature parity across clients. Troubleshooting tools for Outlook tasks not syncing with To Do via Microsoft 365 would be nice!

Works fine except notifications. We have a common shopping list with my partner. When he puts several things to the list or completes several times, I have as many notifications as the items, instead of just one. It gets really annoying to get 10 notifications one after another. Phone just keep blipping!

The best task manager I've tried so far. The most important feature, recurring events, is implemented here. The only thing I'd add is custom/configurable snooze intervals. UPDATE Unfortunately, it's not the best one. It turned out that if there some overdue tasks, it won't notify you about the tasks that are to trigger at the moment. And this "feature" or bug is critical because the app is a reminder which doesn't remind. So I'm searching for alternative.

Overall the app is good, it has a simple and clean interface and meets the requirements of a individual person. But if you form a group, there are lot of loop holes. As anyone can create, edit, delete any and all tasks. Options to alter these are not available. This may prove troublesome. And report of the tasks can be downloaded only in pdf. Personnel to whom the task is assigned shall be a bit bigger and full name shall be displayed.

The 'planned' view was better before updates where we can see overdue, today and coming in one screen so that we'll have idea of past, current & future tasks for proper planning. Now we've to click tabs to see each and can't see all in 1 screen. Please change it back or at least give an option to choose between the 2 options. Don't spoil this like other Microsoft apps. This has been best so far.

So I'm using this app for getting into routine. I was very much fond of wunderlist and its amazing functionalities until you guys shut it down. The feature lacking in the app is the ability to sort the list by time in a day... plus the completed tasks needs to be hidden... I can still see them in the widget and app. Plus the 'My Day' list should enlist the day's assigned task by default (this was available in wunderlist). The widget lacks visuals and customizations.

It does everything that my old task app used to do (wunderlist) but has some additional functionality which annoys me. There's a "My day" page which, I like as a concept, but it doesn't link to the tasks I've planned for "today". If I want today's tasks to appear there, I have to open the task and add it to "my day" which seems like a waste of time. I'd ignore that functionality entirely but it's the very first item on the app menu and it just annoys me being there not reflecting my actual day.

I really like that I can set individual reminders for each task in the My Day screen. Whats annoying is when I set a quick task via the notification panel, I choose the date the task is for, say for 3 days time, but then when I choose reminder, it defaults to today instead of the date the task is set for. Edit: repeat weekday reminders are out of sync. Possibly by a day. Im getting them on a Saturday.and nothing on a Monday.
replyContent:
Hey Scott,

This behavior is there by design. Though we are working on improving it. Stay tuned for updates :)

content: Something reminder notifications are not appearing

App is beautiful and plus point is that it has a desktop client too. Needs some work with auto generation features, I don't want to add everything to my day manually from planned or other lists, whatever is set to repeat and is added to my day must get added automatically. Want to set it up once and forget repeating tasks The widget keeps crashing and goes unresponsive after some time. I need to manually open the app only then widget updates. Please look into these and keep up the good work.
replyContent:
Hi Sushrut,
Thank you for your kind feedback. We are aware of this problem with Widget and are currently working on solving it.  
Please update your app to the latest version when you see an option.
We are also working on adding auto-suggestions and other smart features to To Do. Stay tuned for updates :)

content: An updated review after using it for sometime. My day experience does not do the trick (compared to TickTick or Anydo), also the widget (only one) is frequently being blanck unresponsive (app is allowed to autostart and work in background). The missing of some collaborative features (shared reminders and notes in tasks) is felt. The design is very nice and it has potential but it seems some what behind other trending ToDo and task/time management apps.

Constantly having issues with syncing: 1. Importing my lists from wunderlist but not importing the items, had to delete and re-import many times just to get everything correctly synced 2. Had to re-invite the people with shared lists and turned out with duplicates of the same list 3. Finally sorted out 1. and 2. but now whenever I update my lists, people who share the same list don't get the updates due to slow syncing. Wunderlist worked perfectly fine! Why fix something that's not broken?
I have been able to manually sort, drag-n-drop but I can't find it again. A bit more polish please!

This app is very good, feature is also more, everything is correct, but I give it 2 stars, because I forget a lot, that's why I wanted a bell with a long sound. I have a suggest to you, add a option to choose a bell with long sound.

Everything was perfect except on recurring reminders. The moment I mark them as complete in the notification center, it gives an immediate notification for tomorrow's task. This was of course unwanted and I couldn't find a solution to that in the settings. Probably this seems to be a bug which needs to be resolved.

I loved this app! Before the update came though. It's not because of technical issues or whatever but the apps design before was so much cleaner! I loved the white colors with the large picture up top! The new design is not at all my taste. I wish you could give the option to change it back.

It was pretty ok, I was hoping the app could give me an option to set the time on the due date for each task, but it only lets me pick the date. Furthermore, it isn't the most organized interface, I would find(because of the due date being too general) tasks meant to be at a certain time wouldn't be organized properly
replyContent: Hi, thank you for getting in touch and sharing what you'd like to see in the app! and I'm delighted to let you know that our engineering team will have a discussion on this feature. Thank you for taking time to leave your comment and helping shape To Do!

content: Good but could be better. It works well and is very similar to Wunderlist, however it's very annoying that the reminders disappear from the notification bar if you haven't completed your task in a day. So you have to reschedule every day. Would be great if this could be fixed.

The app has a great UI and widget but has a serious bug where scheduled reoccurring tasks sometimes skip a day and there is no clear pattern as to why. Tasks that are not yet done by a date are simply reminded in a red color and should be more pronounced than that (warning icon perhaps). Should also have a wider scope as right now it focuses a lot on a daily basis. This is not good if you are working in a two week Sprint under the Scrum methodology.

Overall it's okay. I used Wunderlist for years and liked the simplicity. To Do definitely hasn't kept that. Sometimes you just want to jot a note down, not have to create a list. Would be nice to have that functionality. My biggest issue is not being able to set a daily task in the My Day section, as a daily reminder. Nope, if you skip a couple days of it, you're "late" for the due date you missed, instead of just focusing on the iteration due today. Lots of things in life don't have due dates!

This app is fantastic, but I think it's still lack of some features. 1. I need a daily reminder, not just once (or should set the reminder everyday, it's time consuming) 2. I wish the notes will be displayed along with the name of the task, so that we can add some details for each task. 3. I need a calendar or sth that could track my records, so that I know how far I've gone. Because I use this app as a habit tracker as well. PLEASE ADD THESE, then it'll be a perfect app. Thank you.

I've been using this app for more than a year now. It's simple, loads quick, and gets things done. The My Day and New List functions are great, but please add tags. I wanna be able to add tags on my tasks and they should appear on top of each little card. Also, please expand the background selection or just allow us to pick any color from a spectrum.
replyContent:
Hi, thank you very much for the kind words. Your review means a lot to us!
User feedback and suggestions are really important to us as we work to improve Microsoft To Do.
This is a great idea and we'll consider adding it in a future update.

content: I have used To Do/Wunderlist for years on Windows and Android (and loved it), but for a while now, the app says unable to sync. After reinstalling, it is just empty and unable to load anything. It felt like creating new tasks was still synced, but I did not get updates of changes from Windows any more. Fix this to get 5 stars again :)

Lovely design but bare minimum for a to do tool. Would like to see standard features like subtasks with their own due dates, configurable tags/labels, and more widget options. Nice to have too would be a kanban and timeline view. I only use this app because it integrates with work but coming from Microsoft I expect much better!

It's so comprehensive I can't comprehend how there's not a "copy" action for both lists and tasks. When I have a task with a huge list of subtasks/steps that's pertinent to planning and executing more than just one list, it would make all the difference if I could copy it to other lists or go back to an old list to copy to a current one. Likewise with lists. Every time I plan an event or trip or household project it would be nice to just copy a previous list and edit a couple things!

Porting ex Tasks & To-do Pro, I missed 2 key pieces of functionality, each wouldve added a star: - ability to filter within groups. Without it, the "important" filter list becomes a jumble of shopping, ideas, project imperatives, etc. - ability to add priority code to tasks & then filter on them too. Also missing~user defined lists by ticking parameter settings. Otherwise a nice clean Todo, easy to use and build.

I would really like to see the inbox feature in Wunderlist brought over. There is currently no efficient way to quickly add tasks so you can sort/organize them later. On the main page, there is only an add list button, and I don't want to add everything to My Day. This gets cluttered and messy. It would also be nice if tasks that you have assigned for a certain day are automatically added to My Day, instead of having to go through and look for tasks that are due and add them to My Day manually.

No longer works well as a widget. Try Google lists instead. Forget about keeping this widget on a home screen as a convenient list to check at a glance: widget locks up when Android sleeps/conserves battery/backgrounds the app, etc. MS support is useless as expected. Tried every battery, permission and background setting to no avail. Hasn't been fixed for months. Works otherwise, just not as convenient, no developer support.
I wish it actually worked other stuff instead of against the other apps.

It's mostly okay but I'm still looking for something better. I can't reorder my tasks on a given date - so I still need to make a to-do list in my calendar for a planned day (usually tomorrow). Also, it's not that flexible. For example, I can't move "steps" to a different task

The app is great, would have used it as my free replacement to todoist, but there were two dealbreaker issues with it. 1. The widget didn't refresh at times, it remained stuck, the only way to fix it was to delete it and add it back again to the homescreen. 2. The notifications dint work.
Each time an upcoming event or task notification appears, my phone freezes with the error of System UI Stopped working. I have a Note 20 Does anyone else have the same issue ? ü§î
The app serves the purpose, but not being able to sort by categories makes it nearly useless for me.
it's pretty good
Great layout and interface. But it needs to integrate with the calender app for setting up reminders, date markers etc..

I am a loyal user of the Microsoft To Do app and find it incredibly helpful for managing my tasks. However, one feature I would love to see added is the ability to customize reminder sounds. It would greatly enhance personalization and make the app even more user-friendly. I hope the developers can consider implementing this feature in a future update. Thank you!
replyContent: Hi Bemi, you can customize reminder sounds in settings. Go to, Settings > Reminder Settings > Reminder Customizations > Sound and change the notifications to desired sounds. Thanks To Do Team.

enjoying using the app just want to check If the reminders are more verbal.

Today should remain selected is shouldn't have to double tap

Option needed, remind me at time, is always set to 9am. Don't want all notifications coming at same time. By default it is set to 9am. Have to go to pick time to change. Can change start of week to different day, but not the time.
Just check " Todoist app " in what improvements can be made App is good but lots of improvements needed wrt 2023 work life
it would be good if we get preview of image attached in note like in trello plz add it

Overall great organization, but I hate that it can't sync with my email and calendar. It would be so much easier to work with! And yes, I know there is the Microsoft Planner app with 365. But by making it exclusive like that and not available to Microsoft Office Personal users, you are losing people who want to use it but are opting for other apps instead.
