should add some features
Recurring task reminder is asking for one time reminder? It's supposed to be reminded on every occurence
OK app but haven't figured out how to move a task to a new day; so, it's not as intuitive as I'd like (and then again, it could just be me! )

This is a great app for keeping track of things to do. How the app handles recurring tasks is lacking. When one has fallen behind on a recurring tasks, the function to catch up to current task overshoots and sets the next task a few tasks in the future. It's like it doesn't know what day it is, when clearly it knows the date. Would mark this 5 stars if the math to catch up is corrected and if a new function to set recurrence based on last completed recurrence is introduced. Sorely needs that!

The app doesn't save my tasks many times in real time, and when I add some step inside a task and come out of it, then when I open the task again, it doesn't add that step, as if some bug has not allowed to save the last changes I made to the task. It should work real time just like 'Keep Notes' of Google. Should have inbuilt app lock just like the Telegram app. It's difficult to move the blinking cursor to the starting of the line and when tried a lot it just swipes the task to delete it.

Good app for tracking your to do list. Here's where it needs help though: 1) Needs to be able to set or ignore time zones. I travel for work, and everything stays in the time zone I originally set, it's annoying to get a 11am reminder at 2am when I'm in a different city. 2) Needs capability for hourly reminders. If it had these two things, I think it'd be 5-stars.

replyContent: Hi Dawn, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-ON, relaunch should not turn settings back OFF. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,To Do Team

content: Like the integration with the outlook client. Unfortunately manual order between full client is different than the order done via the app and if you search tasks, you don't see the titles in the search results, with that overview gets lost.
List suggestions aren't working anymore, I start typing and nothing changes
Suggested tasks in the 'my day' section should only pop up once I'm done adding a new task, otherwise the 'new task' icon is obscured by the suggested tasks.

My go to planning app, would love to turn off My Day. Reasons for not rating 5 stars: (1) Turn Off Suggestions doesn't remember your choice, very annoying (2) Print Options suck/non-existent (3) no share to Word to format for printing so I can change font/size (I now share to email and cut/paste to Word -- dear lord can't you code to export to your own office suite?).

It's OK. Hard to get a good overview because it's not good at hiding future tasks. It doesn't have a start date on tasks so I keep seeing my "send Christmas card" tasks even though it's only February...

Since the last update, I can't reorder My Day tasks the way I want. The Reorder function only works with tasks created on the same date. And yes, I tried disabling the 'put the newest tasks on top' button, but it didn't work.
I like this app. But if we can plan events by weekdays, it would be better. For example: if my planned event is on saturday, it should pass to monday.

I have loved this app for a couple of years now since I transferred from wunderlist, however since upgrading to another Samsung s22, when I type in the note section it scrolls down and I have to try and delete while typing. Please please fix the glitch. I used this app for my farm, diary, plans, shopping and well everything. I can't even copy and past the notes on to another app with out it glitching
replyContent: Hi Annette, There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support:1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID.Regards,To Do Team

content: Wish I could import my Google / aCalender+ info.
It would have been perfect if it could remind the tasks based on your location. In the early days of Cortana you could do it. It's a big shame that you can not do it now.
I like this app. But Reminder option not working.

"New feature: tasks will show up on your 'My Day' on the day they are due." I'm not trying to find an app to reinforce my bad habits of waiting to the last moment. In the Outlook desktop app you can have tasks show up on the day you plan to start working on them. Why isn't this the default? This is planning. Waiting to see something automatically come up on your to-do list on the day it is due just doesn't make sense... Does it?
üçÇü§çüå∫

Still needs some work, particularly in dealing with custom themes. Doesn't maintain across cache clears (even though it holds blank "placeholders") . Annoyingly won't reset default search path. Notifications are VERY unreliable.
It is good but it doesn't give you a report from your tasks and goals

I love this app. I use it for everything. Except sometimes the widget is glitchy. Now when you're adding new items to your list, it grey's out the list and you can't get the list to be *un-greyed out unless you go BACK to the list of lists ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è it is not great.

This app is ok, but there are some characteristics of this app that are extremely annoying. For example, my tasks are repeated daily under "my day", and I like my daily tasks to always display in the same order. Each day I need to reorganize My Day list because it's always out of order. I want MY DAY to always display in the same order as MY TASKS

Needs less clicks in UI. To delete a task you hold it until a drop down menu is available, but it would be competitive if a trash button displayed immediately to tap. Also it would be faster if small android widgets were available to pin each of your lists to the home screen. Other apps do this. Otherwise this app is a seamless way to stay synced when using outlook on a computer.
Reminders are unreliable. And features and functionality are inferior to competing software.
There is a bug. If you write more than 13 rows in the notes section, the app starts auto scrolling and making new rows while I'm trying to type
replyContent: Hi Ishan, There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings or changing the keyboard to gboard etc? Regards,To Do Team

content: 'Today' has changed to 'My day' and it's invisible as grey... because it's grey.
Ive started today.
Not very user friendly. Took me a while to figure it out.
a feature to move tasks across lists (default and custom) would be helpful
Nice
I like it because i have in all my 3 devices. But in due date i hope to chose a time limit. Like from 1 to 7 January

In general it does everything it says it does, however it fails to synchronize between phone and PC from time to time, and most annoyning thing is that at such occasions you cannot modify your tasks from Android device at all. "This list cant be modfied..." üò§
This would be perfect if I could make it a widget. Is that possible already and I'm just missing it?
Please add focus timer to do task so we will be focused while doing task and we can calculate how much time we spent on that task . As we can do in windows 11 . It should be available in phone also

My experience with the app itself, I've changed from 4 to 3 stars. Great little app for what it does. What would bring it back up? Sync of all tasks not just those created by default Outlook Task templates (yes that's server side). A setting for Next Week to pick the day of my choice. Gesture configuration options. Feature parity across clients. Troubleshooting tools for Outlook tasks not syncing with To Do via Microsoft 365 would be nice!
When is To-Do going to be integrated into my Outlook Calendar? So I can see due dates there also.
Good but can add a feature to move a task from one list to another. Currently I'm cut pasting from one to another. Please consider this change.

I have turned off all notifications on this app and I still get about 30 notifications popping up, in a row, asking me what I 'want to achieve today'. Everytime I close one off another one pops up. At this point all I want to choose to uninstall this damn app!!!!
replyContent:
Hello,

Thank you for bringing this to our notice. Our apologies for the inconvenience caused. Our support team will be able to assist you better. You can contact them by tapping the account icon at the top left corner, then tap "settings", scroll down to the bottom, and tap "Get Support".

content: It saves a manüíØ
Synchronization bugs - tasks added in app missing on website, subtasks added on website disappeared in app. Huge corporation can't make a simple To Do list app.
replyContent: Hi Oleg, To help you better please raise a ticket with us. Steps given below: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with the copied UserID and SessionID. Regards, To Do Team

content: Can't download photos from tasks. Where do they go? Need a page showing all tasks. Don't want to click around in a million lists. Need Eisenhower matrix labels.

Great integration between phone and desktop but it has one very major flaw.. You have no ability to plan your day prior to that day starting which defeats the purpose of having a planning tool. This seems like a pretty easy fix. I'm starting to look elsewhere for the perfect "to do" app. Haven't found it yet but there are definitely ones better than this.

Lovely design but bare minimum for a to do tool. Would like to see standard features like subtasks with their own due dates, configurable tags/labels, and more widget options. Nice to have too would be a kanban and timeline view. I only use this app because it integrates with work but coming from Microsoft I expect much better!
Good app to help keep organized. I've only used it to set up daily tasks and reminders and it's been great for that.
Decent enough but lately I've had problems syncing between devices. No obvious reason and no obvious resolution, all of a sudden, it'll start working again.
replyContent: Hi Nich, To help you better please raise a ticket with us. Steps given below: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with the copied UserID and SessionID. Regards, To Do Team

content: Useful but functionality seems incomplete. I can't figure out how to delete my old work account (which I can't get into anymore) and/or sign into my personal account. The option literally just does not exist. Same problem with Outlook, I can't delete my old work account even though I deleted it on my device. Microsoft, please fix this problem to allow accounts used with this and other mobile Microsoft apps to be deleted or added within the apps!
replyContent: Hi Rebeccah , To help you better please raise a ticket with us. Steps given below: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with the copied UserID and SessionID. Regards, To Do Team

content: The app is good overall. It's simple and has some good features like "my day". What I find cumbersome is setting reminders. The suggestions for reminders cannot be changed and somehow rarely fit what I need. Would be great to have better options here.

I need to see exactly when the repeated tasks will be repeated without opening their details (in a day/daily, in a week/weekly, etc) if I mark them as completed on the specific date. And also when I mark my tasks as completed the daily tasks are moved to the past dates (not to the future dates), why and for what? Reminders app for iOS is ok with it. That is why I can not use To do app for Android and have to use Reminders app for iOS.
replyContent: Hi Valeriy , To help you better please raise a ticket with us. Steps given below: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with the copied UserID and SessionID. Regards, To Do Team

content: Only solution I could find that actually brings down my to do list from exchange. Unfortunately it is an overall weak implementation with no appearance customization options. And recent lock downs on Office 365 severely limit ability to use better alternatives.

App refuses to synch on my phone. Have tried signing out and back in multiple times and uninstalling and reinstalling. Its useless. Updated to 3 stars since it is now usable. Not sure if the update by the app developer was responsible but by unistalling, clearing out all files related to apps on my phone and reinstalling it now synchs.
replyContent: Hi Chris, Apologies for the issue you faced. To help you better please raise a ticket with us to help better. Steps given below: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with the copied UserID and SessionID. Regards, To Do Team

content: The custom date is not as robust as I would like but the app meets most of my needs
Just started. So far so good.

There is no single home screen where all the current, future and overdue tasks are present. One has to go to the tasks seperately to see whether some tasks are over due or not. The home screen should atleast have an option to let us know which tasks are overdue. Rest the UI is simple and easy to use. And there is no priority setting option. Please add this too.

Comprehensive but a bit cumbersome. Switched to "to do" from google keep. Kinda miss the color coding for individual notes that keep had, but enjoy some things about "to do". On some notes its a bit of an overkill, the menu for individual note items like remond me, set dates etc.. Takes getting used to.

This app used to be the best: direct, focused, simple to use. Then Microsoft addiction to complexification surfaced, such as Flagged Email tab, which does not work, is an overkill, and cannot be deleted. Not to mention other marginal of use features and options that clutter the Menu or Help, when most users really just want simplicity, intuitivess and no need for explanation. Overall, a very good app.
Dependable but lack advanced features. Support for tags is haphazard. Only one level of priority. Integration with Outlook and OneNote is haphazard.
No me gusta
Working as described
Add calender
I use it for a while. Then a day it say my license for this app is over and I need contact admin to continue. I use it free why????

Promising app if they would listen to users suggestions. No way to plan MY DAY for the next day at the end of my work day, the evening or night before. Why am I forced to do it on the same day. I know and learn at the end of my day what I need to do the next day. I only make additions to the MY DAY in the morning the next day, but most of the planning for my next day happens at the end of the day before. This is how I understand many people do it.
I had this app at work but it's kinda slow. I'm partial to Samsung Notes
Just fine todo app nothing special

I am trying to synchronise with mobile app and desktop app. but it's not happening. If i entered in mobile then it should be automatically refreshed and added in desktop or if i added in desktop then it should be automatically refreshed and added in mobile. but not happening the same. please have a look and provide solution...

Like the app in general but I don't get any notifications and tasks maked with a due date for today arent automatically put into My Day? I checked and the notifications are on and allowed? Please fix this ASAP!
To-do list items should show in windows calendar
Two less stars for not letting me swap between accounts in the widget. And for not sending reminders lately.
give option to switch off suggestion on day list sometimes it keep flickering not letting you add a new task

this app is minimalistic, easy to understand, and organized. it has been my go-to for when i have multiple tasks to go through. the only real issue i've encountered with the app is sometimes my lists and tasks will stop being visible, which is inconvenient and results in me having to either use the desktop version or my ipad.

Great todo app. The only thing I dislike is how recurring tasks are handled. When a recurring task is completed, it gets copied to a new task. This adds clutter and is annoying to undo when you accidentally complete a task. I'd rather it didn't create new a task, but instead just "uncompleted" the original task when it was time for it to recur (ie. each day/week/month). Currently I work around this by having separate lists for recurring tasks, and manually "uncompleting" them as needed.

Perfect for 5 min quickies list. Not so good for projects and whole life organizer like the my effectiveness app. Frustrations list: Can't delete long, long list of completed items as a batch. It is one by one. Ouch! Tasks under an item can not be moved to arrange by priority or logical sequence of events. Delete the whole task list and remake it in the order you need it to be. Ouch! No text colors or font options or highlighting.

I liked Wunderlist much better. It was easier to use, and more streamlined. Microsoft bought it and turned it into this To Do app, and dropped some features, and changed others, and it's not the help to me that it once was. The only reason that they would do that, in my opinion, is that they didn't like having competition, especially when it was better than what they offered. So, IMHO, they bought it and changed it into this mediocre app that has their name on it. Disappointing.

Update 02/08/2022: Still use the app every day and love it. There seems to be a bug that crept in during one of the updates. If I go back into a note that I previously created within a task, it becomes almost impossible to edit that note. The screen starts adding blank lines. As this happens, I can no longer see the text from my note (it has moved up...the app is automatically adding returns). A wonderful, uncluttered app to remind me of things I want to get done; today, tomorrow or next month.
replyContent: Hi Gary , There is compatibility bug with our notes editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,To Do Team

content: Update: auto suggestions feature is out of control. This app used to be Wunderlist and I loved it. After some initial wonkiness, Microsoft finally worked out the bugs. But now a new one continues to rear its head: every time you do an update, the auto suggestions turn back on even though you turned them off. This may only be an Android issue but it's super annoying because I hate the feature. I don't know of anyone who likes having their settings reset upon every update.
replyContent: Hi Bill, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & feature settings is selected, it should fix the issue. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: I really like the "skip to current task" option in the app and some of the more recent updates like customizable background images. So far, this app is the one that works the best for me overall because I don't necessarily want detailed tracking stats. I just usually want to know what's next and have somewhere to store undated to-do items too, and it's convenient because I use Microsoft Office products on PC. I also like using just one app for to-do errands AND household chores.

So, this is generally a great app, however there is room for improvement. Within app, you cant search any one specific list or list grouping. You have to back out to the main dashboard to be able to search, which searches within all lists. Unlike other similar apps, you can only have a bulleted list. I would love the addition of the option to also create notes vs. only lists. Also has great reminder features for one time and recurring reminders.

Never thought the day would come where I would say Microsoft To Do is the best task app. PROS: PINNED REMINDERS, shared links work flawlessly, my day, excellent email integration if you use Outlook, less glitches compared to Todoist and Any Do. CONS: no secondary label management, no way to move an open task to another list, Smart dates do not work on Android, reminders do not have a reschedule option. BOTTOM LINE: If reminders are the most important feature for you than look no further.

Great app but one small thing annoys me. Everytime the app is updated the settings default to 'Play completion sound' on. I don't want a sound when I check that a task has been completed. Therefore every time there is an update I have to go into settings and switch 'Play completion sound' to off. A small thing but annoying and it would presumably be very easy to leave this setting as whatever the user has chosen.

Some new features soon would be much-appreciated, like maybe some kind of reward system or statistics to see how far you've come, or more nuianced priority levels (versus important/not important), or natural language processing ("water plants tomorrow" adds the task for tomorrow). Just because the app is free doesn't mean it has to be barebones.

Getting better! The UI is becoming more modern, and I've always enjoyed the My Day feature. Some things I would like to see change include: removing or making optional the background image on lists; would like to see the title of the list at the top of the UI instead of mandating that space to an image. Also, there needs to be more integrations with other apps and services, instead of wunderlist.

If you like Wunderlist, you should try this instead. Seems more logically organized, and I don't need to confirm every deletion in this app! I'd like to have the option for location based reminders like I can do in Cortana. So, it can remind me to stop for groceries when I leave the office, for example. Then maybe allow using both spatial and temporal reminders together!

I've been using this app for at least 4 or 5 years now (when it was Wunderlist and now as Microsoft To Do). I use it constantly for weekly lists, groceries, and it has been wonderful for keeping track of odds and ends over time like books I want to read, music to listen to, etc. I like that you can attach documents. Only downside is I wish I could customize it more with different color schemes. Overall, very user-friendly.

Overall this is a great app for keeping track of what I need to do. Easy to use interface and clean layout. However, there is one big thing I wish they'd change. Pros: Clean layout Easy to use Good organization with different lists Cons: Can't change default alert options-- when you want an alert that's not one of the three default options, you have to change it manually every time you add a new task Would also like the ability to customize snooze durations

I love the app so far. I really like how user friendly it is. But this app has a very limited selection of themes. Please offer more themes to choose from. Also, offering the ability to choose our own images from our computer or the internet for our task background would be great. Even though I chose not to use the Trello Task app, they have the above features I mentioned, and I loved having those options.

Not much to say here. It's good. Pros ‚Ä¢ Syncs with your PC via the cloud. A must have nowadays. ‚Ä¢ Interfaces with OneNote via links in the "Add File" section. I use both - that's good. ‚Ä¢ Displays schedule on mobile home screen. I find Task display best for mobile and Planner display best for PC. ‚Ä¢ Subtopics are nice if you have a list of things that need too get done under a main topic. ‚Ä¢ Alarm set separately from due date ‚Ä¢ Color change or separate listing for overdue items. [I love deadlines. I love the whooshing sound they make as they go by.] Cons ‚Ä¢ No snooze on mobile. Mobile - alarm rings once (softly) and does not repeat for that notification. It would be nice if you could set it to go off every 10 minutes or so until you tell it to shut up. It does leave notifications in the notification bar. ‚Ä¢ I don‚Äôt see any way to set alarm sound or duration or volume on mobile.

A good app for managing to-do items and simple lists. It needs a few enhancements to be a full GTD organizer, but is still the best free one I've found that gets pretty close. The online integration so that the same lists/tasks are accessible from various platforms/ locations is a valuable and necessary feature some miss. I use it for managing my home and business to-do lists as well as a grocery list, lists of books I want to read, movies I want to see, etc. and it works very well for these.

The app is getting better all the time. It would be ideal if the Add To-Do pop-up was just a tad larger (taller) so that all option buttons could be displayed, rather than having to swipe left or right to access them. Swiping causes you to sometimes close the pop-up, losing the data that you just entered - particularly with larger fingers. üòÅ

The app is working very nicely. Like the way it picks up flagged emails from outlook. One functionality I would like to see is an in progress status. Helping me organize my work. Would also be nice to have category priorities. A,B,C etc. Also it would be nice to be able to assign tasks to a specific day. Setting priorities for tomorrow arranging my list.

The app itself is good for computer. For the phone is too much space and too much battery waisted. I wish, that this app will have phone compatible app, that can connect to the computer, without making battery crazy. I uninstalled it from my phone because it takes too much battery, and continue to use it in computer standard. Thank you.

This could be the perfect Android app if it had just two more features. It would be nice to be able to either delete or uncheck all checked items. For example, with a long shopping list it would be nice to be able to delete everything at once that has been checked. And for a long packing list it would be nice to be able to uncheck everything once you have packed. Add these two features and it's the perfect notes app.

Would love to be able to sync to the calendar and pre-configure my day ahead of time. Other than that, I love the app and how it connects/syncs to the computer. It has helped me immensely in keeping track of my life, making sure I don't leave anything behind. I really appreciate being able to add quick tasks and being able to set reminders for myself.

This app works great. Very helpful for listmakers! Easy to add things, check off, make multiple lists and sublists. Only improvement I would make is in how you can organize the items on a list. You can do it by due date, alphabetically, etc, or all manually. I would like to sort some by due date, etc, and then have the option to order the others manually. Not an all or none option only. But that is a small thing. It is really quite helpful.

I converted from Wunderlist to the Microsoft To Do and the transition has been quite easy. I really loved Wunderlist, but this app mirrors many of the functions, and particularly the ones I use most, for lists and list sharing. The performance has been consistent and easy to use. I'm very glad the Wunderlist/ now Microsoft team was able to model To Do as closely as possible to the excellent Wunderlist app, plus add some new features. I definitely recommend it. Thanks for all your hard work. PG

I really like this app. It's great for helping me to stay organized. My only complaint is that quite frequently, the alarm doesn't remind me when it's supposed to (my 6:45 task reminder sometimes doesn't alert me until 6:50 or 7 or sometimes not at all). Hopefully this will get fixed soon. Otherwise, it is a great app.

I love this app, so far. I use it for my shopping lists, to do lists, scheduling, and other organizational needs. I am pleased that I can sync with my email, other devices, and calendar. I would love to be able to give it a full five üåü, but I can't. There's no way to delete a list that's been copied to another heading without deleting that list as well. List also sync up, apparently. Also, once a list is deleted, there's no way to bring it back; it's gone forever. Otherwise, great app!

I like using this app. It helps me keep track of longer term goals. BUT... I HATE this new look. No need for it. I liked it the way it was. Stick to keeping it bug free, don't mess with the interface. Want the plain white background back and the colored band just at the top.

When I heard Wunderlist was being replaced by this I was dismayed at first. It doesn't have all the same features as Wunderlist yet (Week View please!), but what it does have works really well, and sometimes MUCH better (synching for example). Now it's my most-used app each day. EDIT: Only problems I have right now is when using the website it causes some sub-tasks in recurring tasks to multiply or it might remove an item from your daily list after you mark it as complete!

Fantastic task list. They took the best of Wunderlist and improved on it. The only thing I'd like to see is a change in the default reschedule options. It always provided the same options that I really use. I'd love it to earn from my previous rescheduling. It would save a lot of clicks.

This app is great but is missing some user experience features that I feel would make it a lot better. I love this app because it integrates so well with the Microsoft launcher. I really liked the old Google now and Microsoft launcher has something that I feel is fairly close to that with its at a glance screen. This app powers the tasks list that goes on that screen and it would be nice if it was just a little more user-friendly, such as automatically adding new tasks for my day.

Good basic list maker. There were many updates made since its inception and I look forward to what lies ahead. It is missing the ability to organize your lists and folders alphabetically. Also it's odd that when I'm moving a list, it gives me all the other lists instead of the folder. I'm sure this will be corrected soon.

After using the now defunct wunderlist for quite some time, I was curious to see if another app could work as well. "To Do" has pleasantly surprised me. If I could change anything it would be to have more options when comes to arranging items within a list. I'd love to be able to arrange completed items one way, and the uncompleted items another way.

The app does not have the same features like Microsoft Outlook tasks does. Setting due dates and reminders takes a few extra steps, like selecting 'Add to today' for the task to show on the day's agenda. Also, the app does not sort by due date past 'tomorrow'. On the plus side, it does include flagged emails which is very useful.

It's very user friendly. My only complaint with the app is that the information can't be sent or downloaded to your calendar. The app would be so much better if the information were sent straight to your calendar, or if it were an option. Just like a day planner, remember Franklin Covey? I couldn't survive without mine? Well actually I still can't, just in a digital world now! Thanks for the app. Maybe make it calendar compatible, just think about it, please?

I tried out several to do apps to replace my sun-setting Wunderlist and liked this one the best. The only feature I'm missing at this point (and it is a big one, thus the 4 instead of 5 stars) is a list of all tasks/to dos. One master list of everything from all other lists is a crucial feature and very much needed! For now I am marking all tasks as important so they are all captured there as a workaround. P.s. I am loving the tags feature, and the audio when you check a task off. So fulfilling!

I came from Wunderlist and was skeptical, but I have really enjoyed this app so far, the only improvement that I would like to see is that when you show completed that the items be in order of how you completed them with the most recent on top. There doesn't seem to be any order to it at this point. Also, there doesn't seem to be any settings to adjust this.

UPDATE: Yesterday I finally got an email with instructions to fix the problem and everything is working again! APP DELEATED ALL OF MY LISTS AND I CAN'T GET HELP RESTORING THEM I've been using Microsoft's app for a few years and it was working well until suddenly all of my lists disappeared and I can't create new ones because I get an odd message that says "initializing please wait" then nothing happens. I opened a help request but haven't heard a thing!
replyContent: Hi Laura , Can you please try force sync by long pressing Sync button in Application Settings (Setting > Sync)? If it doesn't help please raise a ticket with us to help better. Steps given below: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with the copied UserID and SessionID. Regards, To Do Team

content: This is a useful app. My wife and I use this to track things we do both individually and together. One shared use is a grocery list. Whenever I find myself making an unplanned stop at a store, I text her and say, "At grocery store. Need anything? Update grocery list." She adds things using the app on her phone and, because that list is shared, they show up on mine. One thing I don't like is that search only works from the top level. I want to be able to search within a list as well.

So far, I really like the app and how fast everything updates between my different devices. I would really like it if the widget would show the scheduled due date next to the task. Also, it would be nice if scheduled tasks would show in the My Day screen for that day automatically instead of manually placing them there. The custom repeat option for monthly should also give you the option of either date or day of week. Other than that, it's pretty good.

So far it has been everything that I have been wanting in a to-do list. I have had a few issues with it saying there have been some activities that have breached the user agreement (I barely used it two days) and it blocked my account for about 24 hours. But other than that, it has been wonderful so far. Very easy to use and add whatever you want and what I really like is reminders! It actually works when you ask to be reminded of a task or bunch of tasks. Very happy with app, for now.

One critcism: To-Do doesn't inherently have a recycling bin. Once you delete a task or list, the only way to restore it is apparently through Outlook, but I couldn't get that to work. Pretty big flaw imo. Otherwise, a very tidy and useful app with most features that I need, including sub-tasks, tags, and a widget.

I use it for my grocery list. Now the completed items are moved to the bottom. I kind of like that except for the order the completed items are in. I need them to stay in alphabetical order so I can easily find items. It's so aggrevating to skim back and forth looking for something that I need to uncheck. Please fix! Update: They fixed the sort for completed tasks. Very nice now. Thank you!

Excellent to-do list application. Syncs reliably and allows me to add and check off tasks from my phone or my computer easily. The only feature lacking is the ability to assign a time of day, not just a due date, to a task. Sometimes I have tasks that need to be done by a certain time (e.g. online assignments) and it would help if they could be organized automatically in order of time of day they are due on a particular day. Other than that, no complaints at all! 10/10 would recommend.

i have been using microsoft to-do list for some months now. The app is really useful and intuitive. phone and desktop access to a clean UI. It is part of my daily routine and helps me organize business and personal projects. Ideally the export feature would be easier to use.

I have only had this app for a few days. The more I search for solutions the more I find. This is a great app, but it needs a way to give each task a sortable priority number. I love the My Day page which gives me the most important subset of all my tasks. I never put more than 5 things there. If I complete them before the end of the day, I add more. One of my favorite features is the ability to hide completed tasks. The biggest fault is I haven't found a tutorial for all the features.

Update: from 1 star to 4 stars. One more thing in my book that needs to be fixed, it's gotta play nice with Google calendar. I would like to see things due on my calendar. üëçüèº Thank you for updating. Doing good. Original post : ARG!!!! I'm sooooo annoyed with this app! Clicking the star should throw the item to the top of the list! Adding items should be added to the TOP of the list! FIX THIS APP PLEASE!!! üôèüèº
replyContent: Thanks for reporting the issue, it is fixed on latest update . Please give it a try and let us know.

content: Pretty good for quick reminders and to do lists. Some of the features aren't very intuitive especially the my day feature. Also better integration with outlook would be nice. Like if I made a task with a due date it would be cool to have the option for it to appear on my outlook calendar. Otherwise solid app and my go to

I love it, i use it to help me remember small tasks I need for school and grabing stuff at the store. My only downside is I wish there where more complex customization. Like putting a downloaded pic into the background instead of the small selection they have. Or a way for it to refresh the tasks in the entire list, instead of going through all of them and setting times to remind you.
replyContent:
Hi Mikrobeme,
Thank you for your feedback! We hear you and will add your feature asks to our backlog.¬†If you have any¬†other¬†feedback or suggestions, please write to us at¬†todofeedback@microsoft.com. :)

content: Best ToDoList app I've seen, in fact, this is the only Microsoft app I enjoy using (for the most part.) However, the reminders portion could use some work. The main problem with reminders is: it doesn't give you any indication of whether you set it at 8AM or 8PM! AM/PM is non-existent, only "8:00." So, if you set a reminder for "8:00," you won't know if it'll remind you at 8AM or 8PM! Please fix this, as it's very confusing.

It is great, unlike others: items in list can be checked off or deleted. google app "TASKS" only allows list items to deleted. A feature to group a list of items does NOT WORK. The group can be created but no list can be assigned by "tap or drag" list. no list are presented, the android Galaxy note 20 screen just flashes!! I like the interface and will contine to use it tilll MS fixes this bug.

With the latest version, the app has become more like Wunderlist (given that Microsoft bought Winderlist it's no surprise). I love the new features like themes and synching across devices. I would like the ability to view all my tasks in all my folders at once tho without having them under My Day. Still the app has come a long way!

This app is so helpful in managing my business and home responsibilities in one spot. I love that I no longer need multiple apps to manage tasks, and it's synced with my laptop so I'm not glued to my computer just to access my to-do list! There reminder feature is nice too for those really important tasks. I would like the option to create My List for the next day before midnight but that's something I can work around.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback :)
We are working on such a feature!

content: There is a problem with setting recurring reminders. Even if I add them to my day. A setting that would allow repeating reminders without having to set a due date would be great and the very likely make the feature work (as it currently doesn't). The other problem is notifications. I've set appointments and other events and I don't get prompted with anything. Other than that the app works as intended.

Very nice app. Almost as good as Apple üòÅ. Would be nice if I could schedule task on calendar. But great that I can have on phone and laptop. Dumped other apps that do more for this simple straight forward app that allows me to capture stream of consciousness things I need to do like reschedule doctor apt. Got rid of paper tablet on my desk in favor of this.

Overall, I like the app. You can set daily medication reminders or reminders for things every other day, etc. I have some minor quibbles like it defaults to My Day but it doesn't show what I already planned. So I'd want it to do that or give me the ability to make "Planned" my default view.

Near identical usability to the outgoing Wunderlist app. I do wish that there was an option to save as a draft or prompt to ask if I really want to exit the quick add of a task. If I'm not careful, I can lose a lot of text description of a task by dismissing a keyboard. That would draw a 5 star rating from me.
replyContent:
Hey Darrell,
Thanks for your feedback!
You can actually use To Do Quick Add on your Android device, it even save the text entered if you exist the quick Add in a hurry. Do give it a try :)

content: I use it for personal lists and organizing my thoughts; things like grocery lists and reminders that I really don't need cluttering my calendar. I have used it on my phone for years, but now that it syncs with my email, it drives me crazy, because every stupid little thing pops up on my computer as a notification. (Also, recurring tasks will show up on my computer with the previous due date for some reason?) I wish I could turn off sync - that would make it far less aggravating.

üí°Feature suggestion : Please add calendar view to each list. I've been using this app for less than a month as a habit tracker, so having a calendar view to each task I did would be immensely helpful to get a bigger picture (and better motivation ‚úä!) Overall, a 4 star from me for the simplicity of UI and easeness. Thanks for the hardwork, Microsoft team ü§ì

Clean interface, with subcategories that help to group like tasks. Unless I am missing a key technique that is available, re-organizing a list of any length is tedious: you must play leap-frog with every element, passing over other tasks one-at-a-time, up or down the length of the list. it's like shaking hands in a receiving line - "Will this ever be over?". It seems to keep data well and offers suggestions for new tasks from old ones if you choose that. I will re-rate after a month or so.

Works well, nicely designed. Shared lists very helpful. It would be 5 stars if due time could be specified doing with due date and setting a reminder automatic. As it is now, I have to set the due date then the reminder date plus time. At least make that an option. Thank you

It's good, though more for the workplace than for as an OAP with lots of different things to remember. I swapped from a simpler app because this allows prioritisation in Today's task list and also is backed up in case I lose my phone. The only really annoying thing is not easily being able to delete Completed tasks. I like to do it at end of month or project/phase and Completed smart list is a good view, but a faff to go through and delete each one.

This app works pretty well for what I need it for... but I find it very frustrating to have to manually turn off the "auto complete suggestions" option for each category I use EVERY TIME the app is updated (which is pretty frequently, for better or for worse). Auto complete should be OPTIONAL, not the default .
replyContent: Hi Andy, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-off, relaunch should not turn settings back ON. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: Repeat reminder needs improvement. I would love to repeat reminders but schedule when the reminder ends. I love how the completed tasks sync to my calendar so that is why the solution of turning off repeat doesn't work for me, because I don't want everyday to have the same reminder when I know the repeats are supposed to be finite.

Generally a useful app! Please add ability to change default time for reminders, especially next day reminder. 9am is very impractical for me, it's either too early or too late for all the tasks on my todo list. Having to change it manually on every reminder is painful. This should have a default in profile settings.

This app is all good have very good features. Thank you for making such a productive and useful app. It help me to stay productive it will be very good if you include the boosted time tracker app features in it. And also the report feature which shows the weekly productivity stats. Over all it is a very useful app as it help me lot to maintain my busy schedules.

Available on all platforms and systems. Simple and Intuitive. I use it many times a day, often many times an hour. I use ToDo to enter and reorder tasks that do not need dates. I am disappointed the current android release clutters the new task name with a date field. This spoils To Do, making it like a project management app. The date field should be a setting option.

2023-03-20: see my latest edit. Way better than using OneNote for a task list. It takes a little getting used to it, but once it is set up, it's fine. The dev team also seems to be actively working on improving the app as well. Edit: knocking this down one star. There's no way to permanently turn off auto-suggestions. I have to repeatedly turn the auto-suggestions every month or so. It's frustrating, and completely unnecessary.

It's good. A great way to remember what I have to get done in a day and have to get done by certain deadlines. A pretty streamlined featureset that doesn't get in the way when you want to add tasks or collaborate with multiple people. However I can't find a way to delete completed tasks automatically. I'm sure it exists, but it's not exactly clear how to achieve this. I swear, it used to be a feature.

App is simple and minimalist, which is good but a little bit of a learning curve to organise it in regards to how everything is bunched in list format only. Requires a more visible seamless method to link tasks to associated Outlook calenders and also provide a weekly and monthly view of tasks, to review as your setting up plans etc. It is possible there is ways of doing this now but it is not obvious. If they can add some more features in that direction it will be a must have organiser app.

UPDATE 2: Microsoft may have fixed the issue below. I have not seen the auto suggestion prompt again. UPDATE 1: Microsoft is doing their best to ruin this app. They enable auto suggestion frequently now and still do not allow us to permanently disable it. ORIGINAL: Was much better before Microsoft took over. I turn off the auto suggestion feature, but Microsoft apparently thinks I need it, so they turn it back on every so often. They need to allow users to permanently turn that feature OFF.
replyContent: Hi James, we fixed this issue in version 2.90.500.02. Once app is updated & settings are turned-off, relaunch should not turn settings back ON. If issue persists, please file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,ToDo Team

content: This app would be amazing if it had a powerful notification shade integration like Notify me Notification by Lars Fe√üen does. I would like the ability to display individual tasks in the notifications and make them persistent too, so they can't be swiped away accidentally

I love this app but after a lot of use I'm docking one star for the following reason: whenever you go through the suggestion and add a task to your day, a pop up comes up at the bottom of the screen exactly where you would want to add another task or hit "more" to expand the list. This pop up stays way too long and makes the process very slow. A simple fix would be to either be able to swipe it away or simply have it appear at the top.

Helpful. Love the ease of adding date and time in same input field as task...also love that one can print list. Enjoy the customization of backgrounds etc. Would love to be able to receive notifications on Samsung watch.

It's a good app overall but recently there is a bug which when I try to mark a task which is repeated as completed, It gets marked as completed as well but a few seconds later, a task with the same information comes up in the task list.

I use it simply as a list, adding tasks as they occur to me.v Easy. However, the main caveat is for those of us that don't use Outlook : unfortunately MS has not configured the app to vwork with Google Calendar

I like it. When there are (say) 5 important tasks on the same list, it would be nice to be able to drag them into different order ( not necessarily in due date order or date order of creation). Can't seem to do that at the time of writing.
been using it 4 about a month now and it seems great! hope they'll add a feature that includes top,medium and high priority tasks to categorize

I cannot input my notes properly anymore. It constantly scrolls down when I try to type in my notes for a task. This does not happen in any other app I use, so it is not my keyboard/phone that has a problem. Is there a way to fix this? Thank you UPDATE: Developer's advice worked! Thank you so much for the quick response. I hope the compatibility issue gets a permanent fix in the future.
replyContent: Hi Alejandro, There is compatibility bug with our editor on some Samsung devices running Andoid 13.Can you try turning OFF the predictive text in keyboard settings?Steps to file ticket with us for further support: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with copied UserID and SessionID. Regards,To Do Team

content: The App is overall very great. I only have two issues with it. 1. Turn off suggestions feature not working properly! When I turn it off, it again gets toggled back after sometime. It is very irritating to turn off everytime. Please check into this. 2. After completing subtasks, they are not moving to completed tasks like normal ones but just getting crossed out. It would be better if they too move to completed list as normal ones. Thanks.
It works well except it keeps deleting the customised themes and changing them all back to plain black randomly. The color coding is to help me remember tasks so this is really unhelpful :(
Add a feature to skip a particular instance of a repeated task. Add a calendar view to Planned tasks. Add these both and Todo can act as a habit tracker as well.

it would be very good to add the location function in the tasks, then it would be possible to see whether the task was completed by the employee in the right place or if he was out of the office. It would also be nice to add the task assignment time and its end time.
When a task is done, it remains unchanged in widget. To update it, It has to be removed from homescreen and added again to get an updated list of remaining tasks. That's not good!!

I like this platform for working together with your Teams,There is no chance to communication miss match with this platform....but I need just ote thing into this....we are need the chat option for the list members....where they cordianates with each-other on the task.. And access manage for the list owner in this App.... please update this features Microsoft Teams.
The application is great, but it needs some additions such as changing the text color and adding an option to display task steps in the widget.
To the developers of the app : please add the feature of choosing specific days of the week, like choosing odd days and even days and only Fridays .it would be so flexible app then . Thank you .
One of the best apps that actually work. Still giving 4 stars because of slow sync and the fact that updates cannot be installed easily.
Great app for reminders but I think they should add a setting for changing the sound and the volume since it can become very low in volume and can go unnoticed

Great but not all tasks appear in 'my day'. How comes? EDIT: OK, got it now - I added the tasks from within 'my tasks' and they aren't automatically added to 'my day' although there is the option to long click and then add that task to 'my day'. If you want to add a new task directly into 'my day' then just click inside 'my day' itself and then add from there. Quite a handy idea because not all tasks will need to be done that exact day but the option is there to add it if needs be. Clever üëç

Update: Developer responded and fixed the issue. Pretty sad they don't QA their updates for issues like this Original Review (2 stars): I used to enjoy this app a lot. Now, every damn update turns back on the "auto suggestion" feature which I have to turn off for EVERY LIST EVERY TIME. This is out of control. I will be searching for a new to do list app that actually remembers my preferences. Really ridiculous that this is an ongoing issue.

content: I love using this app on a daily basis. If there was anything I could add it would be an integration with calendar. I.e., if I add a task here, allow me to add a start and end time and then add it to calendar automatically. Amazing app. Truly love it.

Could add more functions and link to ore windows products, directly from.e.g. Word, excel, off concert or add ad a task. Such like functions, more custom fields could be made available and groups should have ability to add multiple other groups with their own set of invitees not necessarily viewable to parent group.

please introduce sub, sub tasks & allow us to backdate "my day" - view of goals achieved over time (repeated tasks) - option to check off list without crossing out - download options for (this date through this date) of tasks -Great App!

it's missing "location alert" (remind of tasks when you're at, or passing thru, an area). But still better than many other apps
Great simple app. It should be able to sync priority and categories from Outlook.
Very user friendly and helps in daily planning and productivity. It also helps in planning for future tasks like weekly, monthly etc
Good app, would be good if you could set number of reoccurrences on a repeating task.
better to organise the tasks to finish
fantastic !

Great todo app. The only thing I dislike is how recurring tasks are handled. When a recurring task is completed, it gets copied to a new task. This adds clutter and is annoying to undo when you accidentally complete a task. I'd rather it didn't create new a task, but instead just "uncompleted" the original task when it was time for it to recur (ie. each day/week/month). Currently I work around this by having separate lists for recurring tasks, and manually "uncompleting" them as needed.
An easy way to share & manage lists.

I love it, but it needs more care and attention of Microsoft to implement news funcionalities

good
