I downloaded the app only today, so I'm still unsure what to put into To Do and what to put into my Outlook calendar, but I'm making impressive progress!

I downloaded the Microsoft "To Do" app late in 2022. I explored it a little and I didn't like it because it didn't seem easy to adapt to. So I stopped using it. But now that Microsoft has updated Outlook and migrated the previous "Task" function from Outlook to "To Do" I have been compelled to learn how to use it, and I like it now. All of the previous "Task" functions are still available but in a streamlined fashion, and there are additional ways to customize a task in the app. Fantastic!

By far the best todo app. I tried so many, all of which seemed to lack at least one of a few simple features needed. Microsoft's has everything and it's even free and syncs across devices. Truely a godsend. My only complaint would be there's no way to set a time for tasks, the easy workaround being you can simply put it in the task name. The app would be perfect if you could set a time for tasks and set up automatic notifications instead of setting them per task.

Essential. Wonderful Amazing, been with it since the WunderList days. Always Adding New Features, however the latest updates cause basic loading of tasks to go slower than I would like. Noted on two different phones. It may not be that long but when you're moving in and out of tasks fast and often there's a noticable hang time. Still a wonderful program.

I like the way this app looks and works. I say this because I've tried othees that we're similar and I prefer this one. I like how it's Microsoft which syncs with my Google accts. The only issue for me is remembering to open it and actually do the tasks I listed....if I would just do that I would be golden! But instead I rarely do- therefore the list never shrinks but gradually increases instead, making it all the more daunting... Such is life.. 1 day at a time, 1 task at a time. ‚úåÔ∏è Pese

I've tried many to-do apps over the years, this is the best, and it's free too! Clean, uncluttered yet with all the functions I need, including shared lists, sub- tasks, reminders, and the ability to attach notes, etc. No bug, no ads, just a great app!

Best app by far for to-do lists and i have tried many. Very clean, simple, uncluttered. I especially like the My Day feature that makes it easy to get focused upon the most important things to do each day. I now use this app exclusively for to-do lists as well as other lists (goals, shopping, routines, conversations, media to watch/read/listen, etc.) which each get their own list group. There are a lot of good to-do/list apps out there but this one is great and I highly recommend it.

I don't know where this app has been my entire life but I can't go without it now. I had paid for a different to do list app and it was absolutely terrible. There wasn't an option to set reminders, no due dates, no repeating events. It was a complete mess and I'd get so overwhelmed by it that I wouldn't get much accomplished, paper and pen would have been better. However, this app has been my ultimate life saver for my crazy busy life. It's so easy to use and isn't sloppy. You can add a task straight from your notification bar (s7 edge) if you enable that in your settings. I love not having to check it constantly throughout the day because I set a customized reminder with the task. I have this on my phone (primary use) and my computer, they sync without a single issue. My only complaint about this app is I personally don't need the "Important" list and there isn't an option to delete it.

For someone with ADHD who forgets things constantly (minute by minute), having an app that syncs across any device I want (PC, phone, work computer, etc) is a huge benefit. Think of some random thing I want to do? Add it on the phone, and then I can see it when I go to my PC next. It's a pretty darn good free app. It syncs with Outlook, too, for those of us who use it for work or whatever.

I was looking for an app, years ago, I could use that would sync with gmail. Sorry Google, I'm not a fan of gmail. Had to settle for using Wunderlist, which worked fine at that time, but eventually moved away from using it when we were able to switch over to Outlook for business, which I prefer. So happy Microsoft came up with the "To Do" app. Syncs to Outlook. I can add items to the list from desktop or app. However, I do have more options available on the desktop, but still recommend it. üëçüëç

Being able to see my Outlook take together with other take I create and be able to organize them in a useful way is so helpful. I also love My Day, and how it starts empty each day, so I can start each day with a fresh assessment of priorities. Otherwise I just keep adding stuff to my daily to-do list until it gets so cluttered that I stop looking at it altogether!

I originally left to two-star review after switching from Wunderlist. I was really annoyed that I was forced to switch apps, but after a few months of using this I've realized it is far better than Wunderlist in almost every way (except for the brief pause to load lists that Wunderlist never had). It's loaded with every available feature you could possibly want and I'm very pleased with it overall. Thanks for a great free list tool.

Helps me keep my life in order. It's seamlessly incorporated itself into much life. It's unobtrusive, and useful. Besides the standard to do, I use the create a list feature to keep track of books I want to read, and shows and movies I want to watch. It's helpful to be able to pop those things into a virtual list (that syncs across devices) when someone makes a recommendation.

This is -to me- the most intuitive to-do app I've found so far. It's not big, it works well across my devices, it's simple but offers more depth when desired. Example: I can make a general list and decide which items need reminders etc. The app doesnt make me go through several screens for every single item, prompting me to set up dates, notifications, steps, etc.

Absouloutly Amazing! I am a very list oriented person, and this app is such a great and handy app to keep everything in your life organized, from work jobs to household chores. The one thing I would improve is the design. It doesn't have a very aesthetically pleasing format. But other than that, I would not change a thing. Thank you Microsoft!

A bit more innovative than similar apps I've used. The fact that it integrates automatically with outlook is icing on the cake. The only suggestions I can think of right now would be to add more customization options for colors, especially. A color mixer is at the top of my wish list. But the bottom-line is that I had no problems getting up-to-speed after a couple of hours of random use. The app doesn't crash, supports floating windows; well-done.

Uncomplicated design that's easy to get familiar with. The ,, that is easy to use moving seamlessly from phone to tablet to computer while having the ability to check off items or add more without having to reach for another device. The ability to move from one device to another without problem is the feature that I considered a must-have for a list. Especially when all other comparable apps were single device or wasn't didn't really meet the definition of a tasks and list app.

Absolutely love this app and the many ways you can form a list. It's changed my life and how I use my mobile. I tried to get away from hand-written lists with various "notes" apps, but the lists got too long, too unwieldy, and too disorganized, and I couldn't sync across devices. To Do solved all those issues, and also allowed me to grab whichever one of my devices is closest at hand, without skipping a beat.

This app is amazing, everything I could ever ask for in a task app. Especially the widget. It's so neat and clean. Repeating tasks option. It doesn't auto delete tasks when completed. I have not explore it completely but I love it. Microsoft Please add a feature to delete tasks at a set time. Like daily, weekly, monthly, set date, etc.this would be a nice bonus.

I use it everyday and completely love it. It is very simplistic to use and understand, even for older folks like me! If I'm putting together a list of projects I want to get done; it's allows me to take a picture or a screenshot, then title and save it by Category! Extremely helpful for users of all age groups; and with the Backup & Sync features you just can't go wrong with this app!

I never write reviews but I love this app! I have tried a couple to-do listapps before and never found them really helpful. As a law student I need to keep track of a bunch of things and this app makes wrangling assignments, meetings and tasks so simple. I like that in addition to having your daily tasks there is a list making feature. It's also just plain fun to use. You have the option to change the theme and you get the perfectly satisfying ding sound when you check off a task.

I was nervous about the switch from Wunderlist to Microsoft To Do, but I'm glad my pessimism about it was proven wrong. I like the interface design on the desktop and so far using it on Android is actually just as good if not better than Wunderlist. I'm seeing a lot of outdated reviews regarding being able to add tasks to bottom or top - those are outdated. You can switch between the two. As long as nothing wonky is added or changed, MTD will turn out to be a successful replacement.
replyContent: Thanks for the 5-star rating. Hope you continue to enjoy using To Do, we would encourage you to refer it to your colleagues, friends and family.

content: As an avid wunderlist user I was a bit afraid of using Microsoft's version of wunderlist. I researched all of the other options and finally decided to take a chance. The conversion from wunderlist and the user interface was simple, bug free, and most importantly, did not require learning a new interface (unlike the transitions from the various releases of Windows!!!!!). I have several shared lists with quite elderly and computer illiterate friends who were afraid to transition. No problems

Finally, a dedicated To-Do management application! I've cycled through various alternatives from Google Keep to Calendar but never stuck to one. My favorite feature of Microsoft To-Do is its ability to add tasks from different lists to a consolidated "My Day" view, allowing me to prioritize the tasks for that day. So far I've been using the app for a couple of months and have not had to reach for any alternatives.

ADHD? This apps for me. I work full time as an engineer and artwork on the side, so things can be a little nutters when it comes to being organized. This app has helped a lot, especially since I can have it synced across my pc, phone, and tablet. Very simple, easy to use, and no adds or premiums. My only nitpick is not being able to choose the background color on the phone widget itself (in app its fine.)

Love love love this!! Easiest to use and most tightly integrated to-do list I've worked with yet for anybody that uses Office 365 and Outlook. Only Gap I see at the moment is the ability to assign tasks from the mobile app. However it works perfectly when you assign tasks from Outlook. We just need the reverse functionality as well and then this thing is nearly perfect. The only other comment is it would be nice to have some easy way to add priorities Beyond just the favorites üåü Must have!

Almost as good as Wunderlist. The only thing I would change, and this is very minor, is that every time I open the app, it goes automatically to the last list I updated, instead of to the main list of lists. That's my only pet peeve. My husband and I share grocery lists, Home Depot lists, etc through this app now that Wunderlist is gone, and it's very useful and user-friendly.

I love this app, I use it for everything! I do have one suggestion, but it's not important enough for me to dock stars haha. Since you can due dates for tasks, I think it would be cool/ easier to use if there were a calendar section (that looks like a traditional calendar) so you can see all your tasks all at once instead of scrolling through them.

Very user friendly and great to use for work, home, or just for fun/ideas/wishlists. I use it for all of it and it's been a game changer. Would definitely like to have more ability to customize/personalize things with colors/images and put in photos in the lists (unless that's already a feature that I'm not aware of/don't know how to use) in case you need a visual aid.

Great app!!! Able to keep track of projects, add steps to tasks, keep notes. It has simple, easy to use intuitive interface. Looks same on all platforms (android, apple and windows) so you don't have to relearn how app works on each one. Amazing part it's free, and it has apps on a d syncs across all devices, including desktops. The only thing that I could think of would be if it was integrated with Outlook. Other than that Looks, huge thanks Windows Team!

I transferred from Wunderlist. I enjoy many features, especially being able to share it all with another person. They have fixed some of the comments I've seen like you can tell it to put a new item at the top of the list. Only problem I've seen is when I move a weekly item to a different day, it keeps the reminder on the day it was originally on.

I was a longtime Wunderlist user and had a very hard time converting over to the Microsoft To Do. Once I got into the app and started using it I saw it was still a very good app even though there were differences between it and Wunderlist. I have completely converted over and probably use the Microsoft To Do app for more things than I did Wunderlist. The ability to switch between accounts is very helpful to separate personal and business lists.

Best to-do so far. Created by Microsoft, it has all the reliable things you would expect from them. One feature that I heard is coming, but has not arrived yet is the organization of stacked lists (lists inside lists, etc.). They keep it running nicely and update frequently. If you need to organize your life or if you have a job that requires a lot of tasks to complete, this is the app for you.

Extremely flexible, fairly intuitive, and versatile. Takes the place of several other apps I had been using, for notes, reminders, lists, life balance trackers... and wraps it all up in a daily to-do list that is totally personalized and editable. Apparently you can sync up with your other devices, though I haven't tried that feature yet.

There are few expectations out of a To Do app - operation and be everywhere. This app does that perfectly. I never had any hiccups regarding it not syncing on time or anything of that sort. I love the fact that it works on so many platforms smoothly - Outlook, smart phone, laptops.. Plus, it's has a great UI, simple thoughtful, yet options and settings to do nearly everything. And if you use it for work, you can create group and then lists. Microsoft, at least you got something right!

I like it. However, when sharing lists, I find it frustrating that I cannot share with someone who has a different email domain. That was not a requirement when the app was called "Wonder List." Other than that, I greatly appreciate this phone app. I appreciate the ability to use the app or the Windows desktop app and item stay in sink. I also have many lists shared with my wife and we can both work on items and they stay in sync... even when we are not in direct contact. Technology is awesome.

I tried Microsoft right after Wunderlist was discontinued several years ago, and HATED it. However, I decided to give it another try, and I'm glad I did! I like it MUCH BETTER NOW! The dark theme, unlimited open source categories, and ease of use brought me back. I would, however, like to see more solid colors added to the themes, and the capability to add your own photos to use as themes. Otherwise, it's perfect!

The widget is spectacular and being able to quickly enter multiple tasks on the computer is wonderful. The widget shows all the useful data and shows the next recurring task as soon as I complete the current one. I tried Samsung's and Google's task programs. They integrated with my calendar (which I thought was important), but they were both woefully lacking. This program needs another program to sync with Google calendar. I don't like the idea of having to use a separate program to sync (I don't want to give companies I don't know or trust access to my data if possible). I thought that would be a big deal, but my calendar is actually cleaner without the tasks in it, and the widget takes away the need to have it there. I highly recommend you try it.

I like how the experience is ad-free, and is able to sync across all of my devices. Best of all, it has an offline mode, and is totally free. However, it would be nice if the app had more customization in regards to the backgrounds and appearance. A seasonal or monthly automatic wallpaper change like Google Calendar would be nice.

I used to be extremely organized & keeping a small notepad with each day's to-do was the key. Over the years I've fallen away from that with more use of the digital calendar - which just isn't the same. This app is PERFECT for a list making person like me. I love the way it's formatted, that you can make sub-lists, and that your flagged outlook emails are noted! There's a certain satisfaction in checking things off your list. Great app!! üëçüëç

I was very hesitant to switch from Wunderlist to this app. Especially given that Microsoft bought out Wunderlist just to kill it and push "To Do". However, over the last year.. as updates have ended on Wunderlist and "to do" has continued to get better - I have slowly become a fan. I've switched over all my notes now. So far, I'm happy with this app. However, please remove the "Delete List" option from inside of the list. It's too easy to make a mistake there. Allow deleting only from outside.

Pretty useful, works as both a collection of lists for myself as well as lists I share with my girlfriend. Has nice features vs other list programs as well. Couple things I don't super like, (but still think it's a five star program): Each list item can only be so long (a few sentences), definitely wish it were a little longer. And it has a nice feature of letting you choose to add new items at the top or bottom of your lists, but it's a universal setting instead of being per list.

I was using another to-do-list app for several years which started becoming unfunctional. I decided to give this one a try. The list creation setup works with your imagination. So far it totally meets my needs and then some. The sync between devices is awesomely immediate! There is one functionality that I would like to see implemented which is the ability to sort list "STEPS" by a selection choice the same way that lists can be sorted. Overall, it's a keeper app!

I LOVE this app! I have it installed on every device. (Phone,tablet, and computer) I literally plan my life with it. I created monthly list so can plan for future dates, or just get stuff I want to do out my head on to something I can organize better. My only requests is it sync up with my Goggle calendar and I can move my items on the list from one list to another. Other than that it's great!!!

My one problem with ToDo was that new irems were added at the bottom of the list instead of at the top because my lists are often hundreds of items long in reverse chronalogical order. At some point it started putting new entries at the top. I then discovered a setting that chooses whether new entries are added at the top or the bottom. I assume that this setting is new, since I had not found that setting at the time it changed. I now really like this app. Now a good replacement for Wunderlist.

userName: I eat spaghetti when I'm sad.
content: This app is incredibly versatile, it provides a variety of useful features without being cluttered. The layout is easy to navigate, and it makes setting daily goals and organizing to-do lists much easier. It's definitely boosted my productivity, and I would strongly reccomend this to anyone with an existing microsoft account.

This is the best task list app out there. I have been using it for several years now. It has improved exponentially, especially since late 2018. It is much easier to add tasks with reminders and due dates with extra taps, share lists is great, I like grouping lists. We'll done, Microsoft.

When Microsoft announced they were killing Wunderlist, my expectations for the New Thing were soooo low. But they did a great job! It has all the familiar featues plus some new ones like subtasks, and the user experience is pretty solid! Importing was easy. Great job! The one negative is Microsoft's strongheaded wrong assumption that everyone wants "one Microsoft account for everything." Please preserve the ability to create different accounts for different purposes!

Great app for organizing and sharing . I love how simple it is to use so we can share lists and other users are able to use it without issues. I miss the folders that I had with Wunderlist and would like to see that feature added. Also the notification alerts only once unlike outlook which continues until dismissed. With those 2 changes my rating would go to 5

This is an excellent task tracker for small projects. The notes section is critical to keeping track of specifics and notations. I also use it to keep track of correspondence with vendors. It would be even better to have a date/timestamp feature that I can use when documenting phone calls. Right now, I have to manually key in the date and time before I make notes. In some instances I can have multiple phone calls for one task. I've had software in the past with that feature and it's great!

I have an issue keeping organized and remembering to do things. My experience with this app started out not very great but by my own design. Now that i put things in it with reminders and due dates set right away, it's been super helpful. I just have to put the thing i need to do in it as soon as i realize it needs to be done. I would suggest any sort of reminder app for people who struggle keeping their goals and due dates in their head, like myself.

This has turned out to be a pretty great app! I love the My Day feature. Wishlist: 1. overdue items shown on the Today list, 2. in Wunderlist I could highlight an item when the keyboard was up, but here I have to close the keyboard first, then highlight (that extra step is a distraction and a little annoying), 3. ability to hide Flagged Email list when empty, like you can with the other Smart lists. Otherwise, perfect. Thanks!

Awesome app. Allows for custom lists and allows collaboration on ones you specifiy for group projects/tasks. The interface is clean, crisp, but also allows you to make it your own by adding color themes to the accents of the task pages. The only thing I wish this would include is a customizable "smart list" based on certain parameters. This would make the app even better, though out of the box - this has everything you need to get your tasks and projects done!

This is truly a great app, from my experience. Been looking for this type of functionality and interface for two years. Aesthetically pleasing and user friendly. Have uninstalled so many apps like this before finding this one. A great planner, which I created a shortcut on my phone for, then easy folders set up for my business and writing. A+ grade.

SO useful, I was bummed at first when I found out this app was replacing the Wunderlist app I used for years (Microsoft bought it and it became To Do list I guess), but this is incredibly convenient and easy to use. No pads of paper with lists scribbled on them laying around. It only takes a second to create, update or edit a list and it's straightforward to learn how to use. Best list app I've found.

This app keeps me sane at work and organized at home. This is by far the best To-Do app I've ever used. I love the ability to schedule things to do as one time or reoccurring tasks, have multiple lists, group lists, and be able to access your list from any device you install the app on and sign into your account with. The only thing I wish was added was being able to add your own background picture or custom color rather than pick from the very few options available.

Update: Thank you for fixing the add item to top feature. Now it adds it to the top of ther list instead of the bottom. No more having to scroll to the bottom to manually move it to the top. Many many thanks. I learned about the Wunderlist buyout. So I transferred over to MS To Do List. I love it & will surely miss my Wunderlist. MS To Do List is almost identical. I wasn't too afraid of the change. MS works great. Thx

Great app. I prefer this over Google tasks. Google task is very basic into the point. Microsoft took it just a little bit farther, and thankfully this is one of those apps where they don't actually push anything on you. There aren't any ads or anything that forces you to use Microsoft features. It's a clean and useful app, could use some more features, but it definitely has the basics of exactly what you need

I have been using this a lot since last year. It is a good addition for more organization. it takes a lot of practice to get into it. It can be overwhelming at first but the app pools categories very nicely and it is also integrated to my outlook which is great. You can also categorized and put tasks in different lists. I love it. It make me more productive everyday.

It is a great step forward. Microsoft has a lot of assets within the office setting and this is just solidifying their position as king. The app could use some improvements: - 'open in outlook option for email chains. Could be awesome, but it opens via the web browser. I could maybe accept this on the app for a little longer, but on the desktop version this should open the email chain via outlook (if you have it) directly. - a refresh button

Best to do list and tracking application out there! Microsoft knocked it out of the park with this one - excellent UI, useful features, and a well defined organizational structure for sorting, searching, and indexing all of my lists. I especially enjoy the ability to create sub points for a list item for a more granular breakdown of your tasks. It's great!

This app is as good as Trello and almost works the same with some minor differences. I love it. It would be great if it combined the features of Trello Boards as well as Evernote. Still givin deserves 5 stars on its own merits. It can get overwhelming the more items that are put into it, but that's my own problem of having so much to do more than the app. This is the best automated To Do list I have found. I use it in combination with my handwritten lists.

I love how I can set labels for tasks to keep them organized and have the ability to move them over to a Today view so that I only need to look at what I want to try to accomplish everyday. The app also does a good job of syncing so my phone and laptop stay up to date with each other. No complaints, and really the way it is set up makes me gravitate to it more than other tasks/reminder/list apps that I have used

CANNOT recommend this app enough. Absolutely works wonders and is incredibly simple and user friendly with lots of nice options for colors and customizing lists. All for free too which is remarkable. As someone who often feels anxious when handling a number of tasks at once this app is quite literally life changing. Basically a perfect, and endless paperless alternative to a planner so thats always great.

On the non-technical note, its a great app. You can use it for so many things, of which ONE is to-do lists. I moslty use it while traveling so i don't forget anything, or miss out on any activity. Some things could be added, like a ringtone to the reminder, or adding more emojis to the list name, but in the end, if you're going to use it for its main purpose, it will serve you well.

With improvements over the last year, this is now become the full full-blooded tasks app many of us have long hoped that it would be. It has everything important that was in Wunderlist, plus a new task model that I have found, over the last couple of years, has reshaped my thinking and actions to make me more effective. I wish it had voice assistant integration and plugged into my Outlook app calendar, both options that exist with Wunderlist but for some reason not yet with To Do.

May 22, 2020 - updating to 5 stars, this app is my go-to. Easy to use, pleasing UI, and sharing is easy. Also, thanks for listening and responding! Was a 5, dropping to 3 after last update. Separating completed items would be fine (though less tidy visually than hiding), but sort orders now don't apply to completed items. Grocery lists become much more tedious, as you have to now either search through an unsorted list or type every grocery list item again from memory.
replyContent: Thank you for downloading our app! We will keep working on it! :)

content: I replaced using OneNote with this. OneNote would not always save entries properly,which made it hard to share information between my various terminals. I have no such problem with this. Also, it combines with Outlook notifications, giving me a heads up to what's on the list for the day. Very nice and highly recommended.

Powerful apps and easy to use. I usually use this for my grocery list. However, for complex tasks organization it looks limited. For instance, when you start having too much tasks created, it beecome impractical to follow. I guess the apps where not designed for that purpose. But it would have been great to have well organized function as the number of task grow.

I love it. I don't use many Advanced features but for a simple note-taking app that syncs with my laptop and my phone quickly this is great Before I was using Wunderlist. It shut down and I got transferred to here and it moved all of my data seamlessly. Before that was Astrid and they also moved over all of my data. Hopefully this one doesn't shut down

This app is really great! It is so easy to use from day one. Easy set up and nice organization. I love how I can oragnize my tasks into differnet subjects (unlike other apps) and get remiders of when stuff is due and that if I want to see an overview of everything, I can! Being able to choose themes makes the app more customizable. The only thing is when making titles you can choose emojis but from a limited list.

It's great! I have discovered that this app has almost everything I need. Alarms for med's, for appointments. Schedule tasks once or daily. I try not to schedule too many daily tasks though, because once the daily tasks are complete and on repeat, the tasks get sent to the bottom of the app when completed. Every single task daily must be deleted individually by swiping to the left. It would be really nice if we could delete the completed tasks all at once. The gmail sync would be great!

Read this if your lists disappeared. Still love the app. Noticed about a week ago all my lists were gone after a recent update to the app. I thought maybe a bug and they would come back but never did. I came on here and saw others reporting the same issue. I was about to contact support, but went ahead and went to the app settings in my phone, cleared cache, cleared data, rebooted phone, signed back into app and all my lists returned.

Surprisingly amazing app. Ive been through all the online and app planners out there and this by far is the best one (for me at least). This is great if you are using it for school or anything with deadlines. If you like a clear set list on what you need to do and when you need to do it, with a little bit of elbow room to do that, then this app is great for you! It has reminders and lists that you can categorize as well, which I find very helpful. I use it for highscool and chores/tasks!

Love it! Easy to use, intuitive. No learning curve. Can be customized to be as detailed or as simple as you want. Pleasant to use, you can select from several beautiful backgrounds.. so I enjoy checking it every morning & planning my day. I have tried many to do/reminder apps and this is the best.

This is the best to-do list on the market. You can use it stand alone, but the great thing is that it also syncs with your outlook or exchange server data. Everything automatically syncs. I also use this app to track my goals and habits, and to stay focused. This checklist app has done wonders to help with my productivity.

Easy to keep up with all my task lists and honey-dos. I'm asked to do something at home or work and I magically seem to remember because this allows me to see notifications and reminders across all of my devices including my Invoke smart speaker, my Xbox, my computer at work and home and on my phone. All around the most usable across everything and very simple interface. Love it.

SUCH a good app, very organized, ability to create lists within groups/categories, add sub-steps to each task, due dates, reminders, notifications you can't just swipe away, etc. A lot of thought has clearly gone into this app, and I sincerely appreciate it! The only feature I'd like is to see all my tasks in "all tasks," regardless of whether they're assigned to a list or not; I personally like seeing a bird's eye view of everything I need to do. Keep up the good work Microsoft!!

After years of using Wunderlist, I was nervous about moving over to this new app, but I should've known I had no reason to be! When it first moved over, my only complaint WAS that new tasks only went to the bottom instead of the top of the list, but they fixed it almost immediately. Any complaints you have they're quick to take care of. I love the additional features they didn't have in Wunderlist, ease of use, and how easy it is to share lists with my husband and use for work. Excellent app!

I've been using handheld devices going back to before the smartphone (Palm Pilot, etc.). I have used Microsoft Outlook for ever and its my computer-based calendar., contacts, and email that I sync to my phone. However, as far as I know no one has ever able to sync Outlook Notes. Until this app came up with a solution. It's wonderful because I use Notes to keep track of so many things. Thanks!

Great app! Keeps me on track. What I'd like to see though is reminders also repeat when a task repeats. Repeating tasks can't be set for a particular weekday for monthly, but yes for weekly...odd. Like I want a repeating task for Sat. once a month...can't do that. A calendar view would be great. When the app updates, my tasks in the status bar disappear but don't return after (minor thing).

Really nice. Has all the features you could want in this kind of app. UI is beautiful. While I'll miss Wunderlist, this app is a worthy successor, and I don't think they could have made it any easier to switch over. Hopefully Google Assistant support is added at some point, but given this is a Microsoft app, I have a feeling it's entirely up to Google whether or not they want to play nice. Please Google, please.

love this app. nice to look at. syncs across all my devices, apple, microsoft, android. I would like to see widget customization that would be the very last thing to make this app perfect! atleast give us some transparency on the widgets, or more customized options! please! my favorite device for this app is my Note 9, which is great because this phone was designed for tasks and note taking, and a plethora of those accompanying apps. The nicest app for this and syncs very well across the board.

Microsoft has made the best To Do app, hands down. Looks great, simple, and super effective. I'm using it to keep track of my college assignments, along with a few other tasks. The only thing I wish it had was a grid calendar view option. But even without that, Microsoft did a wonderful job.
replyContent:
Hi there!
Thanks for your feedback :) 
Integration with calendar is in our backlog. Stay tuned for updates :)

content: This app is simple, easy to read, and the integration and sync are outstanding. I like the ability to set things up on my desktop where typing is easier, and the fact that it is important flawlessly to my to do app makes it perfect. I also like the way it integrates with Microsoft launcher. The only thing that would make it more perfect is if Cortana returned to the mobile platform, but for now I don't have any complaints. Great job everyone!

Fantastic experience! Has everything I need, utterly useful, and a beautiful, convenient, easy, and frankly enjoyable way to capture all my random thoughts and get myself organized!!! I love how it perfectly synchronizes with my work email, computer, and calendar. Only thing I would change is have more background themes to further customize and personalize it, or the ability to add your own themes or pictures.

Incredibly intuitive. Supports effortless integration with outlook. Very easy to maintain multiple lists and maintain entries - drag and drop, add, delete, or mark completed. The best thing that can be said about any app is that the reliably allows you to do everything that you need to do, and doesn't get in the way. This is such an app.

I find this app easy to work with, intuitive, and very helpful. I can quickly add to-do items plus attach files and make notes that really help me accomplish the tasks during the day. To-do items can be as simple or as complex as needed. For me, the only thing the app doesn't do is the tasks themselves.

I woke up this morning to this amazing app. Wow! This task reminder is totally radical dudes. I get some options to choose theme color time date and moreüòÄ I love the tropical theme for my reminders and ease of accessibility is straight forward. I'm experiencing more difficulty with talk back and buttons but I'm testing it all out so I can show my friends and family how to use it too. Great job Microsoft, you never miss a bullseye. I'm testing out voice reminder too.

Exceptional and robust productivity app by Microsoft. The app is packed with features that seamlessly integrate with Microsoft services. Keep up with your flagged emails, make dynamic lists, customize the appearance of the indicidual lists, create shared lists.. I could not be more happy with an app in this category. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a solid "to-do" list app that is much more than a glorified notepad. 10/10 stars if possible.

Of all popular to-do applications (doist, ticktick, etc.) this one is free and has most levels of organization. You can create groups, which contains lists of To-Dos and each To-Do can have sub-tasks. Each To-Do has option for many file attachments and lists can be shared with other users for interactive collaboration. Not only does this app do it better, but it's also free! PC, Mac, Android, iOs native apps. No Linux desktop app, sadly, but web-interface is very good

When u add a task or something into a list it give many options on how to set it up. It let's set due dates and reminds u to do your task. And when you complete a task it make a little chime sound that makes you feel like you have accomplished something and makes you want to complete all your other tasks. Its just a good reminder app that makes you feel good.

This app is very handy! It really helps to be able to move tasks around form different lists so easily and it syncs perfectly with all my devices. It would be nice if there was some sort of visual weekly planner/calendar; that would be my only suggestion. Great app overall!

I use this app for keeping track of grocery and pharmacy shopping. We all end up having to go to multiple stores to get all our various needs met, so making a list for each separate store helps! I also make a To Do list. Nothing feels as good as hitting the button after completion and hearing that satisfying ding as it disappears from my list! I have lists for books to read, movies/tv to watch, and garden/nursery supplies needed.

I was a user of Wunderlist but then MS bought them out and transitioned to TODO. It's about the same, at least for the features I use/used. I like that my wife and I can share lists and assign tasks through it. I haven't checked to see if it offers location features - that was a feature I liked from the similar "G" based offering.

Perfect to do list: can add steps for an item, reminders, and add things to My Day, which helps because there's no way I can do everything on my to do lists in one day so it helps me prioritize. Most importantly, I can move things up and down within the list or to another list. Sounds minor but it's not a feature on many apps. Developers, a nice future enhancement: add tags so have the ability to view across lists, by tag. And view by due date across lists. But great as is and helpful!!

I would like to be able to select all completed tasks and delete them with one click. Its quite a tedious task selecting hundreds of completed tasks when i need to. Please fix this. However, I've seen a few improvements from my last rating which is great. I'm definitely enjoying the app. Keep up the good work!^_^

Well done here....not always a Microsoft fan but this app is simple and intuitive. I have tried so many "GTD" apps, to do lists, etc... So far they lean heavy either on too busy, too many clicks needed to get a task put in or....missing one or two key features that were really needed. This one....it's simple and effective. Finally....thank you!

I have severe ADHD. This is the first thing I've stayed with. I use it all day every day. Color coding is DESPERATELY needed for people like me. And subfolders for subfolders! The ability to add my own backgrounds. And a quick to do on my lock screen. And the ability to add screen shots . Not Evernote though, that's bland and annoying Those be everything. THANK YOU!
replyContent: Hi, thanks for taking the time to share feedback. We are glad to know that our work helps you. We are always striving to improve. We would like to connect with you and learn more on how To Do adds value to your life. If you would like to connect, please drop us a note at todofeedback@microsoft.com. Once again, thank you.

content: It is very user friendly and has so many options to personalize and seperate to do lists. Helps me keep track of everything from appointments and phone calls I need to make to grocery and shopping lists. The reminders are so helpful and it takes a lot off my plate by remembering things for me so I dont always have to. I recommend it to any busy body, working mom, or the people like me with severe A.D.D.

It's incredibly useful to me professionally, though it certainly has it's quirks if you're trying to do something like reconfigure an already established recurring event and having to select the date and time twice to establish an event seems an unnecessary step (why not an option to just make the selected date and time recurrent?). But it's actually my most used MS app by a longshot and I get an enormous amount of mileage out of it both professionally and personally.
easy to use

Fantastic app! Just what I was looking for. I've tried so many free To-do Apps and none are anywhere close to this app. I can flag a mail (Outlook) and find it here on this app. Perfectly synced. I downloaded the Microsoft "To Do" app late in 2022. I explored it a little and I didn't like it because it didn't seem easy to adapt to. So I stopped using it. All of the previous "Task" functions are still available but in a streamlined fashion, and there are additional ways to customize a task in the app. Fantastic!

**so you need premium for it to actually work? Deep focus mode just mentions reminders to come back to the app nothing about it being necessary for the app to work. That should be explained I really love the idea but it won't work, if I'm outside of the app on other apps it'll still fully grow the tree even if I was out of the app for the entire timer (I've done tests). I found a switch that was off for "wither the tree when forest is closed" and I turned it on but it didn't change anything
replyContent:
Hi,
Thank you for the feedback. This is how the mechanism works. You are not able to access other apps during a focus session but leaving Forest in the background does not wither your tree. In the Pro version, users can set up an allow list where they can use apps that they need to use during focusing. More info can be found in our FAQ page :)

content: I've set the app to not treat notifications as a disruption, and it still does. I respond to the warning that I need to "return to Forest as soon as possible or the tree will wither," it looks like it's going fine, and suddenly a minute later I have a withered tree. A bit of a slap in the face to be going along for 55 minutes and have something wither on me in the last 5 minutes of a decent run. Where are the instructions on how exactly the notification disruption setting works? What's there right now is vague, unhelpful, and flat out doesn't work. It's a waste of money and a giant irritation if they can't get this to ignore certain apps properly. I'm ignoring my notifications to let the app continue running, and then I'm being punished. Very frustrating.
replyContent:
Hi,

Sorry for your inconvenience.

Please provide us the details and the screenshots of the problem via our in-app feedback system. 
We will look into this issue. :) - Forest

content: Thee planting reminders aren't working for me for some reason. I have them set and on, but I don't get notifications. Also, my trees don't wither when I go into an app that's not on my whitelist. They have an advanced detection mode, but sorry, I don't want Forest to be able to collect data on what I'm typing (it includes everything but passwords, even credit card numbers)
replyContent:
Hi,
Sorry for the inconvenience. Could you please send the details or the screenshots of the problems to android.support@forestapp.cc? We will investigate the problems further.

content: After the update, there is no sound on completion. I have tried restarting my phone, reinstalling the app, clearing app data, checking every setting and permissions very thoroughly, but to no avail. It's very annoying to constantly check the app to see when the tree is done growing or when my break is done as I do not get notified at all. Please fix!
replyContent:
Hi,
Sorry for the inconvenience. Please go to Settings page, enter FAQ, and go to "Tree-planting and counting", then "Why don't I hear the notification sound...". If it isn't solved, for the free version, please email android.support@forestapp.cc. For pro version, please email premium.support@forestapp.cc or contact us via in-app feedback.

content: I've been using this app for 2 years and almost unlocking all the trees. It was very helpful. After the new updates, it lost me as a user. Since I don't have "pro version" all the tress I had unlocked were refund and I lost all of them. The only ones I have are the free version trees. I am very upset and disappointed in changes. Not longer does this app care for their users, they only care about profits.
replyContent: Hello, we have made changes to the relevant mechanism in order to prevent pirated software. Some tree species will be classified as professional tree species and cannot be planted. We understand that this will cause inconvenience, but in order to provide better services and improve operations, we have to take this measure. Sorry for the trouble.

content: I have been a regular user of the free version for a while and was constantly telling people about this great app. However, most of my previously unlocked trees disappeared after the most recent update and it appears this was intentional on the part of the developers. While I understand that this app is part of a business, it is very disappointing to have features stripped in this way and it does not motivate me to move to the pro version, it just burns the goodwill I had toward this company.
replyContent: Hello, we have made changes to the relevant mechanism in order to prevent pirated software. Some tree species will be classified as professional tree species and cannot be planted. content: It's a cool concept but bad execution. The coin reward system is very gimmicky and not at all conducive to a soothing environment you would expect a digital forest to have. What's more concerning is if you are in deep focus abd give the app all of those concerning permissions to monitor you, it doesn't let you use your phone at all with no option to stop, even in an emergency. You have to go back into the app and close out the task. This is insanely stupid and hopefully will be addressed.
replyContent: Hello, Sorry for causing inconvenience. Thank you for your feedback. We will forward your idea to our team.

content: This used to be my favourite app for work, but the excellent main feature, as enhanced by the clean UX and cute art, are completely ruined by the integration of ads in my face after every tree is done growing. I refuse to pay for the way the app used to be. Mourning the extremely useful and beautiful app I first downloaded years ago, and off to seek a replacement.

Hello, sorry for the inconvenience. You can consider purchasing the Pro version to enjoy Forest without ads! There are additional features in the Pro version, like syncing between different devices and even planting real trees in Africa.

content: This app requires a ridiculous amount of permissions, including location, camera, and data cookies?? When I heard about this app, I got excited. Really thought it was going to be nothing more than say an animated timer that only works when you stay within the app (like Youtube pauses when you switch apps). This is just downright data mining and invasive. Edit: Funny that I mentioned this and now it doesn't say the same thing.
replyContent:
Hi,
The Forest app installed from Google Play do NOT require permissions for camera and location. Data cookies are for Internet Communication and web pages like the News page and the Real Forest page. Please reach us at android.support@forestapp.cc if you have further concerns. Our privacy policy was last edited on September 27, 2019.

content: This used to be a solid app. It did the job but would take you off of Do Not Disturb whenever you hit start which was a mild inconvenience but still annoying. However, their decision to change their app so that only a few trees are available in the free version while anything of any visual worth is only in the paid version was the final issue that led me to uninstalling the app. Lost a star for their copy & paste answer to everyone suddenly leaving low reviews.

content: Well. when you remove from the recent apps, it will stop working properly .. easily you can access other apps if you close the app. The issue is not resolved even after 2 years. Inspite of giving all the required permissions, it doesn't work in the background and deep focus mode doesn't work.
replyContent:
Hi,

content: tldr: Misleading advertisment. App penalizes use of the Pomodoro method by requiring 2 hour sessions without breaks for optimal 'reward'. This discourages use of the Pomodoro method. Claims to be a Pomodoro method app, but penalizes users for using shorter focus sessions by providing loaer quality rewards when compared to doing a 2 hour session without breaks. Requiring people to do long focus timers without breaks to get the best 'reward' actively discourages use of the Pomodoro method.
replyContent: Hi, sorry to hear about this. We do not penalize anyone for anything. Regardless of focus hours, users are rewarded virtual trees and coins for every session they complete. To encourage users to focus more and stay away from their phone, longer sessions generate more rewards. Pretty trees are worth the effort! :)

This app also plasters users with ads which is decidedly not good for focus.
replyContent:
Hello,
Sorry for the inconvenience. You can get rid of ads and just enjoy the app itself by getting the Pro version.

There are additional features, like setting up your Allow List, syncing your data between different Android devices and planting real trees in Africa.

Hope you consider! :)

content: Without deep focus mode one can use other apps without risking the lives of growing trees in the forest. But enabling deep focus mode requires the app's access to notifications including personal text messages, which seems like too much information to give. And without deep focus mode the whole purpose of using the app is defeated. The app's become useless with this new update. The previous version was better at serving the purpose. Please change this ASAP.
replyContent:
Hi,
Because of the limitation of the Android system, we had to change the mechanism and develop the "Deep focus mode". When you're planting a tree in Forest but goes to another app, there should be a full-screen notification that tells you to go back to Forest. If that isn't the case, please contact us again. -Forest

content: Before the update, this app has been with me throughout all my studying sessions and it was so so motivating and fun to use! I've been religiously watching all the ads to get the double coins to save up to get the trees. After the update, I am absolutely DEVASTATED because I can't even buy any new trees because they are all premium. This was a terrible update because you just made it so hard to use for students who can't afford to get premium. I don't mind watching 10000 more ads!
replyContent: Hello, we have made changes to the relevant mechanism in order to prevent pirated software. Some tree species will be classified as professional tree species and cannot be planted. We understand that this will cause inconvenience, but in order to provide better services and improve operations, we have to take this measure. Sorry for the trouble.

content: tldr: Misleading advertisment. App penalizes use of the Pomodoro method by requiring 2 hour sessions without breaks for optimal 'reward'. This discourages use of the Pomodoro method. Claims to be a Pomodoro method app, but penalizes users for using shorter focus sessions by providing loaer quality rewards when compared to doing a 2 hour session without breaks. Requiring people to do long focus timers without breaks to get the best 'reward' actively discourages use of the Pomodoro method.
replyContent: Hi, sorry to hear about this. We do not penalize anyone for anything. Regardless of focus hours, users are rewarded virtual trees and coins for every session they complete. To encourage users to focus more and stay away from their phone, longer sessions generate more rewards. Pretty trees are worth the effort! :)

content: It's an interesting idea, but this app missed some extremely important features, namely: a landscape mode, as well as a custom notification sound. Why? Those are extremely easy features to add! My use case is placing my phone on a stand in landscape mode so I can charge it while at work. I want a custom notification sound at work, and I want to be able to watch the timer go down without the screen stuck in portrait. Also, I keep the screen on, and the app disses me because I have the app open.

Hi,
Thank you for the feedback. You can change the notification sound for Forest in your device settings. We will consider adding support for a horizontal mode. If you have further suggestions or questions, please send us a ticket at android.support@forestapp.cc.
- Forest

content: Used to love this app. Was disappointed when they added a premium version and locked some trees, but I understand the decision. We understand that this will cause inconvenience, but in order to provide better services and improve operations, we have to take this measure. Sorry for the trouble.

content: Inconsistent with regard to what counts as focus time and what doesn't. Hello,

content: This is a great app with misleading/unethical privacy problems. I paid for the full version expecting to be able to use the full version, but I can't use the features without giving my personal information (name, email, birthday). I tried to add my birthday to sign up, even though I'm really not happy with the privacy and data collection, but you tap several hundred times to get to the right year (for example, if you are 32, you have lived 384 months, and you have to tap through all of it).

Good but needs simple improvement = It should really have more ringtone (and a light notification) options for when the time is up. I don't want to that horrible alarm sound or have my phone vibrate after every study session in order to know when to take a break. If you don't add more sounds, please give us the option to create customized sounds/ringtones. Also, for the S9, it is unable to make a noise in silent mode, even when I give the app exception permissions.
replyContent:
Hi,
Please go to your phone Settings > Sounds and notifications > App notifications > Forest app > enable "Set as priority."
Hope this helps! Thank you. -Forest

content: Just installed it on my latest tablet. It worked great for two days, then tonight, froze up and I had to cold crash/reset the tablet. Tried reopening the app and, it was still counting down but instead of the 20ish minutes it had been stuck on before, it showed over 40000 minutes!!!  Tried the "Give Up" option but it wouldn't work. The app then froze again--had to reset the tablet again. Ended up just chucking/uninstalling it. Can't really use it if it's going to freeze like that. And, now that I'm reading some of the other recent reviews, this seems to be an ongoing problem.  And Forest just asked for screenshots of the problem in their reply to my review. I don't think you understand the term "frozen"--if I could take screenshots of the issue, the tablet wouldn't be frozen and require a cold crash. I won't be reinstalling the app just to attempt to take screen shots, thank you.
replyContent:
Hi,

Sorry for the inconvenience. 

Could you please provide us with the details and the screenshots of the problem to android.support@forestapp.cc?
We would investigate the problem further. :) - Forest

content: Great concept, but unfortunately have to uninstall as it's a data privacy risk. Our firewall detected (and blocked) hundreds of attempts to servers in China when the app was sitting open but idle. For its function, this app should be able to run locally without call outs unless there's an error state. Combine this with the permissions required, and it's too risky for my comfort. Hope to find a safer option elsewhere.
replyContent: Hi, sorry for the inconvenience, would you please contact us for us to investigate this issue further? For the free version, please email android.support@forestapp.cc. For pro version, please email premium.support@forestapp.cc or contact us via in-app feedback. Please provide screenshots or videos of the problem and your Forest account details.

content: Please atleast add login option for free. content: When switching to a new phone there is no automatic syncing of your records, tags, etc. Using the export data doesn't yield any results as on my old phone as I only get a loading circle but nothing happens. content: I love the idea but few things bug me: should you pick a background sound and cancel the growing phase, the sound keeps playing. Hi,

Please check if you:

1) Turn on Notification in the Forest settings page
2) Allow Forest to send notification in your phone settings
3) Turn off the Do Not Disturb Mode
4) Turn off the Silent Mode or allow vibration during Silent Mode 

If you have done the above and still receive no notification, please contact us. 
Thank you! :) - Forest

content: This app is everything I needed and wanted to manage my ADHD except for one thing that makes it useless for me - there is no notification when the timer is up unless I use the distracting background sound.This means I go back constantly to check if I can stop working already. content: I have the premium version. The app is good but not great. Please fix the following: (1) After a break, when hitting "plant" do not go to the forest view. This happens every time. content: First, "favourites" could be improved by also including stopwatches and deep focus, as well as tags and times. content: The concept is great and would work to keep me focused. content: I really enjoy using this app. Not only is it user friendly, the creative types of plants you can unlock add another incentive to being productive. it's quite effective. my only real issues with the app is that 1) the prices go up as you unlock more things, and 2) the trees and bushes cost the same amount to unlock but do not give you the same amount of coins in return. Trees and bushes should obviously be differently priced.
replyContent:
Hello,

Currently, the first tree species purchase will cost 500 coins. Every additional tree species purchase will increase the cost by 100 coins, with the limit set at 1000 coins. We kindly ask for your understanding and we will further improve Forest overtime! Feel free to contact us via in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :)

content: I want it to count up infinitely not down based on rounded chunks of time like 25 minutes, 10 minutes, etc. I want to both keep myself from minimizing the app to get on other apps AND just count the minutes I successfully did so for each work day. But with this, if I don't complete the entire 25 minutes, then the 23 minutes and change I completed just doesn't get counted, and even if I do complete the 25 minutes, I might forget to plant again for another 40 minutes, then those 40 minutes of productivity don't get counted. I wish it just had something like a stopwatch mode, and then for every 10 minute mark it gives me a plant, but it tracked every single minute I went without getting on another app regardless of whether I met discrete chunks of time or not. Need it to work without me constantly replanting, because remembering to replant is another form of time-wasting. Need it to track all the time I have it running in toto. I love the idea, just wish it had options for the mode it does now and the mode I'm talking about.
replyContent:
Hi,
Thanks for the feedback. Currently, the focus time in Forest could only be adjusted by 5 minutes a set. However, there is an option in settings called "count exceeded time" which might fit your case! Please try out to see if it helps!  Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! :) Forest

content: Everything used to work great, but I think in their new update, they have added a new sound each time the countdown is finished, a terrible sound is played which I guess it's a "jungle sound" but it's really more like loud white noise! content: I like the app because it helps me limit my distractions and resist the temptation to waste time on my phone. However, sometimes I get a call while my tree is growing, and the call kills my tree even though I did not pick up the phone, which is rather unpleaseant. Additionally, sometimes I will get a very important message that I need to respond to, but I cannot because Forest will threaten to kill my tree if I leave the app, which can be inconvenient. I suggest allowing a "pause" feature for these types of situations where a disturbance is quite important. Now, I understand that people may take advantage of the pause feature, thus ruining the very purpose of the app. This is why I suggest a limited number of pauses, likely one or two allowed per day or per week. That way, people with an important call will not kill their trees, and people likely would not abuse the pause feature if they knew they only had one. Otherwise, the app is fairly simple and very useful, and I am mostly satisfied with its performance, thank you.
replyContent:
Hi,

You could consider the whitelist feature in Pro version, which could prevent your tree from dying.
Feel free to contact us if you have further questions. :) - Forest

content: I would only give this a three stars becuase it is hard to change the time, and I was stuck with 10 minutes when I just wanted it to be 5 mins, but it would let me. Other than that it was cute and great.

content: Adding 30 second unskipable mandatory ads in a productivity app.... Getting yourself to put your phone aside for 30 min is hard enough without having to watch an ad just to click the 'study' button. Love everything else it's just the ads being so prominent that really bothers me, especially in an app geared towards easily distracted people.
replyContent:
Hello,
Thank you for using Forest app. You can get rid of ads and just enjoy the app itself by getting the Pro version. There are additional features, like setting up your Allow List, syncing your data between different Android devices and planting real trees in Africa. Hope you consider!:)

content: Nice app that easy to use. I wish there was maybe a to-do list or daily planner feature (?) so we could keep track of what we're going to do and please make it available for PC, Windows, as well as Mac, not just extension apps. Lastly, I don't think the pro version is really worth because it has no features as I said before.
replyContent:
Hi,
Thank you for the feedback! Would you mind taking a moment to detail your needs and expectations in the survey below? We strive to make Forest as user-friendly as possible and your feedback will contribute directly to the enhancement of the app! :)
https://forms.gle/bGujNMvAUCzVvDdg6

content: I really liked the UI. Yet 2 suggestions. 1) Design the app in such a manner so that even minimising it is not possible, i.e & trying to open any other app is not at all possible till timer ends by focus app taking over the entire screen 2) Some apps are accessible like clock, etc. Ensure none of the app is accessible. Incorporate it & higher ratings are there for the taking :)
replyContent: Hi, please make sure to enable the Deep Focus mode by tapping the fire icon in Forest Home page before starting the session. When you open other apps under Deep Focus mode, a full-screen overlay will appear to restrict your access. For more info, please refer to this article: https://faq.seekrtech.com/Forest/articles/203 Thank you!

content: Listen, I love Forest, I have it across 3 devices and I bought the Pro version. But PLEASE PLEASE GIVE ANDROID USERS WIDGETS. They're such a basic Android functionality nowadays and I keep forgetting to use the app unless it takes up screen real estate!! It's also motivating to see a widget with your forest (though any widget needs to have a 'refresh' / manual sync button in an upper corner - my iPad widget only syncs when I tap it and launch the app)
replyContent:
Hi,
Thank you for supporting Forest! We totally understand your point. Would you mind taking a moment to detail your needs and expectations in the survey below? We strive to make Forest as user-friendly as possible and your feedback will contribute directly to the enhancement of the app! :)
https://forms.gle/bGujNMvAUCzVvDdg6

content: Hi, how can I change the notification sound when tree is grown? Default one is really quiet. Can't find how to do that in settings.
replyContent: Hi, if your device is running on Android 8 or above, please go to your device settings > Forest > Notifications > Notification categories > Tree Completion > select any ringtone in the sound section. Besides, the volume of the sound is adjusted according to your device notification volume. You may turn that up so that it can be louder. Thanks!

content: This app is so useful, i always use this whenever i feel like im not paying attention towards studies so i just start the timer and it helps me stay motivated and productive, but there are some options i want to be removed from pro version like ALOW LIST, cloud forest, customs phrase, free trees and events, i badly want to try them but i cant purchase it. Plz remove some options from pro version, this app is very different as compared to others! So i wanna try some new options THANKS
replyContent: Hi, thank you for the feedback. As a start-up, we require assets to keep the company running. It is after much consideration that we decided to put certain trees and features in the Pro version in the hopes of providing better services and of higher quality. If you like our app, please consider supporting us by unlocking the Pro version. Thank you!

content: Nice. Break should be automatic though. Better if the app doesn't let you leave and look at other apps; it records you as being on your phone when you're in the app itself while a tree is being planted but doesn't do so when you're on your phone but in other apps while the tree is being planted.
replyContent:
Hello, thank you for the feedback. When you open an app that is not in the allow list under Deep Focus mode, a full-screen overlay will appear to restrict your access to that app. If you have further ideas of how we can improve, please fill out the form below to share more with us! Thank you! :)
Survey: https://forms.gle/bGujNMvAUCzVvDdg6

content: I think that this app is pretty great cz it's motivating in the simplest way Wich is amazing...but i think they should notify u when the Timing u set ends and show it on the lock screen so u don't need to pick up ur phone, open it and check it up Wich can somehow distract u from the work u do... And i wish if they can add more features to the activities that's because all we can see is growing a tree in every single one Wich is kinda boring.... And thank u
replyContent: Hi, sorry for the inconvenience caused. Please refer to the following article and adjust your settings accordingly: https://faq.seekrtech.com/Forest/articles/106. If the problem persists, don't hesitate to email us at android.support@forestapp.cc. We'd be glad to assist you further. Please also don't hesitate to share any ideas with us! Thank you!

content: deep focus mode is not properly work all the time!
