Used to be great app due to unique "Moment" feature no one else had. Got buried and de-emphasized in latest update by removing it from long press of the home screen icon. Devs, please return it there. I know how to set a time for it to launch. I know how to trigger it from deep in the settings. Please put it back up front like it was. You can put it along with the "new event" and I appreciate that you are doing more calendar and schedule tie ins. Please add it back to the icon long press. Thx.
replyContent: We forwarded this feedback to our team and we are planning to add it back for the next versions :)

content: Started a free trial to premium without my permission, can't take it off. Im not going to pay for it so I don't want it there so that I don't use premium features on accident and get used to them. Tried to delete account to start over and do differently but every time I type in the password to delete the account I get an error message. Waste of time. Going to use a different app.
replyContent: Our 7 days trial allows free users to give Premium a try before committing. Any user can dismiss the trial offer or take the trial and cancel before the 7 days are over and use the app for free for as long as they please. Our team would be happy to look into your subscription issue, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: All of the great features such as list sharing grocery list categorization, and easy to use UI are being "phased out." I also got a charge of $39 dollars to my account without authorization for a "yearly subscription" when I had never had one before. Bad customer service and shady dealings.
replyContent: A payment can only be made upon the user's authorization. Grocery lists are sharable and the categories are still available. Please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. If you're still experiencing any issue, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: The recent update has really limited the features of the free version. For example, in the Grocery list all items are now placed under "Other" whereas before you could categorize them which made it easier to find items when walking down aisles. I'll be looking for a different task app...
replyContent: We did not change the Grocery list functionality. Please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. If you're still experiencing any issue, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: Don't use this app!! Any.do charged by credit card $29.99 without my permission, for a premium plan, after I'd used the free plan for quite a while. When questioned, their support team said that it was an automatic feature. Then told me that the only way to turn off this "automatic" feature was to use an app downloaded to my desktop. I only use the app on my phone and never on a desktop. They did also say that deleting this app from my phone will not cancel the automatic payment!!! Unbelievable!
replyContent: A payment can only be made upon the user's authorization. Users can upgrade from the mobile app, desktop app and from promotional links and discount links. Once the subscription is created it will renew unless it has been canceled. All of this is according to our terms of service you agreed to once you upgraded.

content: This app was great until the latest update and the grocery list changed. Now, it's just annoying to use. It takes more steps to get to what I want to do. The app forces a default list to display that I don't use, so I have to navigate back to the home screen to get to the grocery list. I preferred generic Shopping List where I would enter all items. I don't want a different list for each store. The predictive function stinks because you have to clear the field after you add the suggested text.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way, please note that you can disable the Grocery List from your setting (Setting > set Smart Grocery List too off). You are in no way obligated to use the Smart List :)

content: Product images show the month view at the top of the screen with dots, each one represents an event on that particular day. For android, the month view up top just shows the days of the week (no event indicators). Just an empty calendar. At the bottom of the screen there's a chronological list of events. Essentially, what I'm looking at is no more useful than list on a word document. Sure, there's a ton of bells and whistles, but the Android version is almost entirely useless as a calendar.
replyContent: We appreciate the feedback. The images for iOS and Android are intentionally different. The Android ones specifically show the calendar as it appears in the app (with dots in the daily view). All other functionality, though, is exactly the same as in the iOS app and you can vote to have the dots added here: https://bit.ly/2YGoktL.

content: This app used to be great when paired with Alexa. Every once in awhile the sync would break but disabling the app and relinking the account would fix the issue. This has not been the case for the past several months. Any.do it is no longer syncing with Alexa and based on the reviews of the Alexa app it is affecting a lot of people, has been ongoing for weeks, and there doesn't appear to be a fix coming. Going to give anylist a try to see if it works with Alexa.
replyContent: Sorry about that, our team is currently working on a fix for this. Please submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support, so we can assist you with any further questions.

content: Very annoyed that I have to keep signing in and then it deleted all my lists. Ive been working on a master shopping list for several months. Im trying to track what my regular purchases so that I could have just opened an app such as this, gone down my list, and checked off what I needed. But when I logged back in AGAIN, my shopping lists were gone for the third time. When it works, its great. It just doesnt work enough and I dont have time for this.
replyContent: Hi, that's odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: I really do like this app, but I have horrible problems with it crashing constantly. The stability is AWFUL. Every time I try to check something off a list, it crashes. After every single item. While it's got great structure and is easy to use otherwise, it is the most unstable app I've ever used. Just uninstalled because even updating it didn't stop it from crashing. Fix the damn app; I've submitted enough feedback about it. Highly frustrating and not worth the time.

Love the interface, love the concept. But it lacks several key features on the Android side. The app both web, and the download version have sync issues, to keep your data inline you must keep the Web version up and the if you are using the downloaded app, you must keep it running to keep anything sync. Then you will lose any type of reoccurring tasks.   Love the sub task concept, really slick but if you cannot keep them in sync it does not work very well.   Another item that does not work, though I have requested it is that face that landscape mode is not coded for in all of the app, again in both the web and app version, makes it difficult to use on a tablet if you are switching to a keyboard for example.   So because of syncing issues, missing key landscape issues in several places in the app, lose of data due to syncing issues I had to uninstall the app. Lucky for me I am using 2 or 3 to do list so I have my primary one I am still using, so nothing lost except time. Though I was really hoping this one would pan out.   So though I am marking it as 1 start, I like the concept, and lots of it, but it is buggy,, and needs some serious testing to work out the syncing issues.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear that you experience async issues! You are welcome to reach out to our support so they can help you get Any.do's sync back on track (at Customers@any.do). We are planning on adding more support for landscape mode in the future.

content: Smart Grocery List From Hell. While it might be handy to sort your list by catagory. Now everything is spread out all over the place. I wanted to turn the feature back off and it will not turn off. I like to sort things in the order I travel through the store. i know where everything I purchase is located. Well can't do that any.more. Having to change the category on each item i buy to Esential household item so that i can keep everything together. what a drag!
replyContent: Please note that you can turn off the smart list by going to Settings > Smart Grocery list > OFF. Accordingly, you don't have to use this feature. Please make sure to convert all smart lists (after turning the feature off) to regular lists by tapping the list menu > convert to a regular list.

content: This was my favorite To Do app, so much so that I purchased the Premium subscription and then notifications stopped working on my phone and desktop.  I tried double checking all the notification settings on my phone, where I want it to work most and everything looks fine.  So I tried to cancel my Premium subscription and it seems impossible.  The instructions to "manage your subscription settings" doesn't exist, so I can't get out of the premium subscription.  Their FAQs don't provide accurate instructions.  The desktop app refers you to the manage the subscription setting on your phone which doesn't exist.    I was impressed with this app initially, so my so that I purchased the premium subscription but all the notifications stopped working and I forgot I even had the app at some point until they charged me $26 for the annual subscription, so now I want out but can't get out.

I have the same recurring tasks to do every day. I need a to-do-list reminder to buzz me when it's time. The problem with this app, is that those reminder times somehow start drifting every day, giving me different times the next day! That is an annoying fail! Screw it, I'm going elsewhere. if I find a better app, I'll let you guys know. UPDATE : Suggestion did not work, and I found an app, that does not drift. I have moved on.
replyContent: Our team will be happy to look into it for you, should you submit a bug report via the app's Settings - Support. That said, if this is not the type of solution you are looking for, we respect your decision to move to a different app.

content: I have had this app for almost a year. I was really enjoying it. I mostly used it for my grocery list and weekend to do list. However, I will be uninstalling it now because it deemed it appropriate to automatically add "Welch's brand Fruit Snacks!" to my grocery list without permission. I encounter ads in a lot of places, but I refuse to use an app that panders to corporations in such a way that it starts adding branded products to my damn grocery list.
replyContent: This could happen if a user pressed on an advertisement for a product. We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report)

content: Great UI/UX but INCREDIBLY buggy, especially with repeating tasks. I'll set a reminder to occur every 2 weeks but when I set that task as complete it'll move the next reminder to 3 weeks from then, then after that 4 weeks from then, and so on. Having to go back and manually change the date each time renders the app useless. Also, $40 for basic features? No thanks. I'm sticking with the default Google calendar reminders.
replyContent: Hi, that's odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: What an awful UI. When creating a new reminder, the entire screen is disabled except for the text-entering line. Then you have to go back into the reminder to set options. But some of those options can only be changed via drag and drop, so if you have a lot of reminders, you will be dragging for a long time.
replyContent: To set a reminder, you only need to tap an existing task and press the "add reminder" button. Then you can choose a pre-set time or "custom" and enter your time. You should not need to open the reminders screen multiple times to add one. Also, reminders are not only editable with drag/drop. Learn more about them here: support.any.do/reminders

content: Instead of shopping around, I downloaded Any.do because of how widely used it is. Setting up one day's schedule should have taken me just a couple of minutes. But the app seemingly randomized which day of the week an entry was for. On two occasions, it picked a day over a year away. After twenty minutes of fighting the app, I finally had my schedule together. I spent another ten minutes trying to get any notifications to work, with no luck. Fortunately, uninstalling only took a few seconds.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with randomized times for entering tasks, so that sounds odd. As per the notifications, there may be an issue with your device allowing the app to send notifications properly. If you're still experiencing any issues, kindly let us know at- www.any.do/contact_form, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: Why does every once in a while... out of the blue, the app asks to update acct emails or such and then everything on my task list has been lost??? This last time, my list went back to some list I had quite awhile back... must have been the list I lost at another time. This is quite frustrating. And if I have to spend the time to make a new list, I cld just as well spend that time finding another app to use. Especially since this seems to be reoccurring. So disappointing.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that! It sounds like you might have logged in to a different account. Please submit a bug report in your app (via Settings - Support) or contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we will be sure to get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: Terrible Update! This app used to be perfect for planning out when certain tasks were to be completed. The interface was easy to understand and you could see and plan as many days into the future as you wanted, and everything was perfectly broken down by date. Now when you add tasks, regardless of when they need to be completed, the app just says to do it today. It has completely eliminated the only use for this app, which was to make out a planned future.
replyContent: Please note that the tasks in your tasks view are sorted by their reminder date, to move a task to Tomorrow/ Upcoming/ Someday, simply add the relevant reminder. That said, we are unaware of any issues with tasks being set to Today, so that's odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, so we can look into this for you.

content: It looked good but it doesn't work. I scheduled simple tasks and it would change the timing. I re corrected to make it right several times. The navigation was difficult. Like I'd want to set a task but then I'd have to say the task was complete so wouldn't be sure it saved. Couldn't just back out to see the task was set correctly. Had to confirm the task was done then undo the task for later which might then change the time to something I never set. üò≥
replyContent: Hi, that's odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: Edited to 1 star. It is fine for personal lists but you cannot share them with others. When you look up 'how to' any.do claims you can do this with a free account and even shows you how... With a function that does not exist in either of our apps. The only option available is exporting it in a clunky text list- no in app shared lists. Uninstalling and re installing did not update. Gonna switch I think.
replyContent: As we‚Äôve announced on our Blog and sent by email to users with shared lists, The list sharing will be phased out in favor of our new collaboration and sharing we recently launched. You can try it out right away with a 14-day free trial. You can learn all about it here: https://www.any.do/workspace

content: The current notification sounds each of which lasts for a couple of seconds makes the app useless. How can the developer fail to realize that the very idea of a reminder is make sure that the user is reminded. There is an excellent app on this store which is perfect in this regard. I don't want to name it but the developer has to find it and learn how reminders should be. I. Have uninstalled this app after 10 minutes of trial.

Almost perfect but the developers choose to ignore one very important thing. There are several people posting the same request. Keep the popups but stop them from interrupting other apps, which can be crucial at times. The forum posts I saw requesting this were old so it's obviously not a problem you're willing or able to fix. Otherwise I might have bought the full version but I had to uninstall
replyContent: Popups have been proven to increase productivity and is a main feature for the app right now. While we are not removing it yet, there is a UserVoice for this suggestion that you can see here: https://bit.ly/2xyuuQX. Feel free to vote for this suggestion and our dev team will take this into account for future updates.

content: As a programmer, this is absolutely the most lazily put together trash that I've ever come across. The basic version of this app is only meant to accomplish the simplest of tasks, but it abhorrently fails to do so. As a user, I'm appalled. My task lists were constantly being manipulated without any input on my end; I'm talking added information, reordering of items in my list, and even complete deletion of subtasks. Do not trust this app with anything of even the slightest importance.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We encourage users to reach out to us directly in order to better understand the issue, or feedback and get to the bottom of things so we can offer a full resolution. We work hard to resolve any issues! :). If this is not the type of solution you are looking for, we respect your decision to move to a different app.

content: This app is deceivingly terrible. There are some really nice design features like the home screen widget. All of this nice user experience is trashed by the "POP UNDER" that doesn't turn off. Every day, it's there waiting for you when you turn on your phone. I have all alerts in app turned off, my phone blocks app notifications, and I'm on Do Not Disturb and yet, there is this annoying feature that Any.do won't allow you to disable. EDIT: I DISABLED MOMENT NOTIFICATIONS A PRIOR TO DEV COMMENT
replyContent: Hi Ryan, it sounds like you are describing our Moment notification. You can disable it from the app under Settings - Any.do Moment - Disable. If you are still experiencing any issues you're welcome to submit a bug report via Settings - Support üòä

content: I love this app, but I do have one major gripe - I want an option to buy premium once (even at a higher price) and not as a monthly or yearly subscription. Edit - very unhappy with developer response to pricing. I want to buy premium for this great product they made, but it's NOT a service. This isn't Netflix. You're going to turn potential buyers away with this pricing model
replyContent: We ensured that Any.do would be fairly priced, basing our cost on standard business models for the industry. If you don't want to upgrade, you can continue to use Any.do for free for as long as you like. That said, you are welcome to reach out to our customer support (https://www.any.do/contact_form) to hear more about all our special offers :)

content: The option to sync with Google Assistant is completely useless - it doesn't work at all. It's like they added the feature just to trick people into downloading the app. I hate typing on my phone, so this was a huge disappointment. I wish I could give this app zero stars, but one star is the lowest option available. Save yourself the trouble and avoid this app at all costs.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with the Google assistance integration and have tested this feature today and it works. If you're experiencing any issues, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: Redoing my review after messaging with the app for a while. Basically everything I need to do is either not there or you have to pay a monthly subscription to do it. Not worth it to think you're getting somewhere with the app finally, only to have the "upgrade to premium" page keep popping up when you try to do the only useful things in the app. S'a shame. The widget looked nice.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app, 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade.

content: This keeps crashing, freezing, not responding. If I choose to wait, it eventually moves forward, but takes so long that it is useless. I tried restarting the app, restarting my tablet, futzing with settings, sending a report... nothing has helped. I uninstalled and re-installed the app, and it is still freezing/not responding and asking me if I'd like to quit it.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Absolutely worthless. This app runs a prohibitively clunky interface that effectively voids the promise of ease-of-life automation. Google Calendar will provide all other services promised by Any do for free with no annual subscription rate. Don't sign up for the free trial. It's not worth getting pinged for forty bucks when you decide you don't like it and forget to cancel it in time. Save your money!
replyContent: We're sorry you feel this way! 90% of the app is completely free and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade. If a plan isn't cancelled in time, it will be charged per the TOS the user agreed to upon upgrading.

content: Works decently most of the time, but I've noticed that any of the reminders I have long time (things that are supposed to remind me every day indefinitely) eventually just stop reminding me, even though they still show up on my to do list. Very frustrating. The inconsistencies make this unreliable, which essentially makes the app useless to me as a tool to plan my day around
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: There's an issue where the bottom pop up notifications do not display in Android 10. Which is my entire reason for using this app and why I paid for a year. I understand bugs happen but I'm losing the value I paid, for a reminder app that doesn't remind me... I reached out to support, they said a fix is coming in a few weeks. I asked to have my subscription extended for the loss of use, so far no resolution. I'll give 5 stars once my money doesn't feel wasted. Thanks
replyContent: Hi, we don't support beta versions for your OS, and we have a fix for the notifications issue already out to our beta users, which you can learn more about here: https://support.any.do/super-users/ , with the update rolling out to standard users in the next few days. Because you were using a beta version of Android Q, we can't refund you.

content: Wunderlist was everything I needed and I had no issues with the app. This "replacement" tried to keep a somewhat similar format, but replaced the things that I really enjoyed from the original app. I don't like having a list app connected to Google or the rest of my accounts. I just wanted something simple that I could easily share with my family. I'm really disappointed with this forced move to a new app. Can't Wunderlist be allowed to continue to function?!
replyContent: Any.do is a task management app, which has no relation to Wunderlist, but simply allows you to import your tasks from there. Any.do has an extensive Help Center detailing how to utilize our features -https://support.any.do/. You are also welcome to contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form with any questions.

content: I had a premium. Scam.The app is very pushy and annoying. I couldn't get into 80% of my incoming calls as it blocked the screen so the call doesn't appear on the screen. You only hear it and hopelessly looking for the call screen that you only get once the call is dropped. You have to call back then. Disturbing and annoying. I barely used this app as to maintain it takes a lot of time. I asked them to cancel they said they will not refund as more than 48h passed of yearly(!) subscription.

No longer usable.Awful Have used this free app for years for grocery and To Do lists. Was simply laid out,easy to use. For years, I created lists I could easily check and uncheck as reminders of what I needed from each store. IDK what happened in the last 6 months, but app has become useless and an exhaustive waste of my time. It completely erases the items I typed in after I have checked and saved the lists, leaving me to waste time to retype things.Have uninstalled/reinstalled. Nothing works.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: This app has an appealing interface but the only problem with it is IT DOESN'T ACTUALLY WORK. If you want to use it for anything other than a list of things to do. It doesn't sync. It loses your data. It basically wastes your time rather than saving you time. Customer service is a joke. It's useless too. Very nice, but utterly useless. The idea that you can have assistance and delegate tasks is basically a lie because it's not available in my area and I live in Los Angeles.
replyContent: Hi Valerie, our team has already confirmed your data as well as provided you with a complete report per your query. We're not aware of any issue with the app syncing though we would be happy to continue assisting you should you reply back :) The Assistant service is currently in beta and will open up to more users in the near future.

content: After a task is done a duplicate will appear for the same task causing me to have to remove one. Then even if I haven't done a task that day it will still have one of them marked done (the duplicate is always unmarked). I believe this is due to an error in the day tracking it. It seems to be unable to tell whether or not the day is ended. It's rather unfortunate considering it is very easy to personalize and even allows you to create a grocery list. Uninstalled and will not be reinstalling :/
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: This app does not warn you when doing the trial that if you choose to cancel that you have to contact their support to do so. Theres a delete account option or a sign out one...they do the same thing and doesnt stop the payments. This doesnt stop them from charging you anyways and is a huge inconvenience. If it werent for this terrible service and unreasonable price I would have kept. Will not recommend.
replyContent: Since the trial was created through Google Play, it must also be canceled through Google Play under the subscriptions tab. To check if you are eligible for a refund, please contact us at Premium@any.do.

content: I downloaded the app, tried the free trial, and forgot to cancel in time. I didn't have a use for the app but left it installed because I was paying for it. Even after turning off notifications it would pop up to give me my to do list every day. It would also randomly alert me that items have been added to my shopping list. For not using the app ever, I have a very full shopping list of things I don't want or need. And I didn't click an ad to add it, since I don't even use the app.
replyContent: If you are referring the the "Plan my day" pop up, you can disable it under settings-> moment. Regarding the added items, please contact our team so they can look into this matter for you at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: This app has consistent issues with syncing. My boyfriend and I used it a few years ago, but stopped using it due to frustrating with all the syncing problems. We tried using it again recently because the app is fantastic otherwise and we wanted to give it another shot. Still our shared lists refuse to sync often enough that the app is more hassel than help. The app is great if you don't need to share lists with another person though.

Android 10 recently got pushed to my phone a few weeks ago and ever since then I've had no pop up reminders from the app. Now I need to be using a whole different app for my reminders. I do have a paid version and until a fix comes which hopefully will be in the next few weeks I seem to be paying for an app that doesn't work. Hopefully they can get this resolved quickly as having two apps for my to do list is quite inconvenient. 9/19-Play store shows Aug 25,2019 as the most updated release
replyContent: Hi, the latest release is gradually getting pushed to everyone, uninstalling and reinstalling the app will download the latest version right away!

content: Ugh! After years of using this app, I am so very tired of the reminders not syncing across all my media! I get notifications for the same task on my chromebook, cellphone and tablet; I have to dismiss on all three! Now that Google Tasks has reminders (and syncs across all media devices), I can create lists, AND it's free, I will probably kiss Any.do goodbye. UPDATE: Contacted Team and they confirmed sync problem, and at this time don't have a solution üôÑ
replyContent: From checking our records, the issue you've reported is not related to a sync issue, this is simply the intended functionality of the Reminders. Once a task has an active reminder, it will pop-up and alert on any platform on which your account is synced. You will need to dismiss the reminder from each device accordingly.

content: Wanted to use this with my Android phone and my Alexa show. "Zapier" sync Only available for a monthly fee. Really disappointing. Was hoping this would be the answer. my Alexa list shows up separately from my any do list, which would show up separately from my Google list. so it's kind of useless I want everything to sync into one list! as I would have then used it to sync to an iPhone so our family could connect and have one list kind of stupid if I have to search through a bunch of lists.
replyContent: Hi Stefanie, please note, we create new lists in order to help try and organize all of your tasks. Furthermore Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. You can use Any.do for free for as long as you like. However Zapier is a premium feature.

content: $$$ Im being charged a full year up front and not at end of year or monthly as advertised! Great app, and i was hoping to enjoy it. I have been busy so i didnt have time to appreciate the 7 day trial, and that is ok, so i was going to do that during first month in wich should cost me about +-$3.00. But instead i was charged $35.88 right at the end of first week. When i went tovunsubscribe, it said I'd have to keep full year subscription, so there is NO monthly... Messed me up, im NOT rich!
replyContent: A payment can only be made upon the user's authorization, and we allow you to switch up or cancel your subscription plan, in accordance with our TOS. That said, our team will be happy to assist with any subscription issues, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Used to be my go-to for my shopping list but 2 updates later it's become frustrating and wasteful. As I'm going through my saved items in each category to add it back to my list, the category just randomly closes and now I have to reopen it. Before I could just run down the list and click on what I needed to add.
replyContent: Hi, that's odd, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: I used to love this app. I have used it for years. I even had (until yesterday) the paid version. I primarily use this app to sync up my alexa tasks. It started having issues, then got fixed. Now the company is saying that Amazon sync is no longer usable (unless you want to add a 3rd party to allow it access to your Amazon account).
replyContent:
Unfortunately, Amazon has rejected our fix and will not be reopening the Any.do Skill just yet.
At this point in time, our efforts seem to be blocked and we will not be able to offer with any estimate to when the integration will be reactivated :(

content: Constant crashing. After reading all the negative reviews, I Uninstalled it from all my devices. **Canceled subscription. App was great, until it crashed. After spending more than a hour setting it up on my Samsung tablet, it will not run. Cannot even get it to start. Too bad. In the past, my experiences have been good with this app. Guess I will see how long it takes to crash on my cell phone. So much for multi-device sync. Such a disappointment. **see above, for new comment added.
Been using for years, they try and add more features, I ignore them. Decent checklist, that's all I need. UPDATE: recent version sucks. It doesn't do what I want anymore, very disappointing change.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: The latest version makes it VERY hard to just create a SIMPLE event!! It used to be one click to create an event..... now I can hardly find how to create an event! It takes about 6 very "unintuitive" clicks before I finally stumble onto a new event!! Please fix this! Thanks!
replyContent: To add a new calendar event in the calendar view you can simply start typing the event name in the input and select the time and date. If you need assistance please contact our team here www.any.do/contact_form and they will be happy to help and advise you.

content: My day sucks. I don't like it and why is forced as default option everywhere? This is not the right way to treat your loyal users. Please make moment easier to access again. It took a lot for me to get used to an app. I don't want this change and will probably cancel my subscription since the app is making me jump through hoops to use the only reason I have subscribed. Plus I don't really want to collaborate with any team. This was a personal todo list. Make another app for teams.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear you are not enjoying this feature! In our next version, the moment option will be available from the list menu like in the past. If you have further questions please reach out to us via our contact form: www.any.do/contact_form

content: I used to LOVE this app years ago. Don't remember why I stopped using it but JUST downloaded it and if the fact that they only bill ANNUALLY which turns into almost $50 wasn't enough of a turn off, the repetitive forced close EVERY TIME I tried to open my calendar was the nail in the coffin. Ugh. I really needed this app.
replyContent: We have a monthly plan, if you are not able to see it our team would be happy to send you a direct link you upgrade, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form, they will also be happy to have a look at the issue you reported and help resolve it.

content: Really annoying. It was, until the last update, (and it still a bit is) a good product. That's why I bought the premium subscription, but I'm done with it. Because the support is just not supporting. We had tens of emails and no progress at all about some bugs. They're not reading what I wrote carefully, not checking the screen shots I've shared with them. The only thing they do is finding excuses and sending some prepared texts...
replyContent: We still have Any.do moment under settings-> open moment. You can also set the daily push to moment to get a reminder every day for it. The recurring reminders feature does require you to complete the task in order to get the next reminder set up.

content: Too quick to ask for money. Description says it syncs with MS Exchange/Office 365 but I see no evidence of that. Give me time to make it work before asking for reviews and money. EDIT: Thanks for the reply. Can any.do sync MS Exchanged/365 tasks?

There's no easy way to adjust all these details anymore. You have to click on each separate icon to fix these to what you want. I use the app begrudgingly.
replyContent: There are still indicators for each task in our latest view. If you can't see them, please send us a screenshot and your account details to customers@any.do so we can look into this for you.

content: I really love the app, but the lack of full calendar month view is a major hindrance for me. Also, it would be nice to sync Google tasks and anydo Tasks, it syncs the calendar why the tasks as well? I wish these 2 features were added. I would be set. By the way I love the major feature: (the bottom pop up for Tasks that are do. I love how it interrupts and lets me decide what I want to do.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: Just started using it, creating my lists etc. Until I noticed the free version doesn't have such basic feature as adding a photo to a task (it lets you theoretically, but up to 1.5mb, which means that practically you can't take photos since they are bigger). You could add an option that auto shrinks the photos so they could be added in small resolution. This makes the free version impractical basically.
replyContent: With the premium version you can upload as many pictures as you want. We have a 7 day free trial and we also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: Buggy interface. The grocery list feature is fine but the schedule is terrible. It kept changing event details after I saved. I had to go back in and turn off alarms for previously saved events (that I had alarms off). And it would NOT let me create an all day event that was only scheduled one day. No matter how many times I changed the dates it kept including the day before in my "all day" event. And then when I would try to edit it, it would change completely to two days before. What a mess.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with editing the calendar, so that sounds odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I switched to Any.do when Wunderlist ended. I wanted a simple interface that let me share lists and tasks with my husband. Any.do did that, but in the least efficient way possible. Our initials are the same and tiles aren't customizable, so it was impossible to tell who a task was assigned to. The app always defaulted to tasks even if I had just been using a shopping list. It was a huge pain to navigate. Not what we needed at all.

Syncing with Alexa takes over 10-15 minutes which renders it unusable. Any.do, before you post your generic response: yes, I added the skill to my Alexa and, yes, I logged into my accounts. It syncs... kind of... so I can verify the two accounts are talking... just not well at all. When I use Wunderlist or Google Tasks or just Alexa by itself, the changes are instantly viewable across all platforms. The only reason I downloaded with app was to give me more control over my Alexa lists (which for some insane reason you cannot reorder). The extremely lag in syncing Any.do with Alexa renders this app useless. The UI looks really nice and user friendly, so I bumped it up to 2 stars.

Easy setup for the most part but ended up deleting it. Only one level of subtasks makes the to do list suboptimal. Only links to Google based calendars so my work, school and personal calendars aren't seen. [there is a disconnect between the app and the referenced article's options and instructions]. I don't mind paying for premium features as long as it is a one-time payment, the whole SAAS model is annoying.
replyContent: Any.do is a calendar integration and is not a calendar provider. Therefore, you can add any calendar that is on your native device. If you're having a problem and you're not finding a solution in the Help Center, feel free to email customers@any.do with your device, OS, and Any.do version and someone will be happy to help you!

content: Hasn't been meaningfully updated in a long time. Difficult to organize lists and save/archive. Very simple without the ability to add any details like quantity on a grocery list. Used to auto categorize but not working anymore. I still use it because it's easy to share with my wife and that's about it.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: Once the app reinstalled itself and I lost everything. I still have no idea why it did this. Also, it often doesn't open when I first tap the icon. If I tap it multiple times it eventually opens within a particular task. I found it frustrating and I've now uninstalled it. It would be a great app if some of these bugs could be resolved.
replyContent: This sounds very odd but we apologize for any inconvenience! Please submit a bug report by emailing customers@any.do so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: What a letdown. Forces you to use your device's native calendar with no option to change. Most apps let you connect with an account directly, but this made me use the Samsung calendar, which I have had nothing but issues with. "Integration" options through Zapier offer automation for new events but not a general account sync. Desktop and mobile differences are confusing. I can add my Google account to desktop, but it won't show the events on mobile? Poorly executed, really disappointed
replyContent: You can view any calendar including your google calendar in the mobile version. You can read all about our calendar setup in our Help Center: https://support.any.do/calendar-setup/ As long as you have your google account in your device you will be able to see it. We will be happy to shard more information here www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I keep going back to this to see if anything has been fixed or added, every time I'm disappointed. Smart Shopping List is about as dumb a Shopping List as can be. You cannot add or delete categories, you're stuck with whatever categories they seem fit to give you which are grocery based. If you're planning on using it for something like a hardware store and need Building Supplies, Electrical, Plumbing etc you're out of luck. You can't even add Quantity! Isn't that usually a basic feature of a shopping list?! So if you add Potatoes, how many? 5lbs? 1lbs? who knows.
replyContent: Any.do's Smart Grocery List is not the main feature of our app, but an additional productivity tool that we created, to provide a designated space for such items. That said, our Product Team is putting a lot of efforts into updating and improving the Grocery feature's functionality! We will be sure to post on our Social Media about future updates!

content: I'm afraid the app promises a lot but doesn't deliver. I rely heavily in To Do in the office suite. I was looking for a few more features but integration was important to me. The promised integration comes through Zapier which requires get another premium subscription ($20 per month). Zapier is extremely confusing and time consuming. This just isn't any better than To Do and honestly One Note blows it out of the water. If you're already paying for office, don't waste your time here.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! The Zapier integration helps to connect thousands of apps to Any.do and offers up to 5 Zaps completely for free for our Premium users. We encourage users to reach out to us directly so we can offer a full resolution at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Spent 2 hours tinkering with this app just to realize that it can't do what I need it to do. It's quite frustrating that no digital planner has the option of showing future tasks before they're due. I have a task that's due every third Wednesday of the month. I want to see that task on my calendar 3 months ahead so I can plan around it. But nope, the task won't appear until it's marked complete in the previous month. Pointless! How can that feature possibly be helpful for anyone??
replyContent: Any.do is a productivity app, and therefore, the way Recurring Reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. That said, you are welcome to create a calendar event (support.any.do/the-event-menu), which will be displayed on your Calendar View, so you may check your Agenda months ahead :)

content: I had made an account for this app a long time ago but didn't use it for long and I forgot why until I re-downloaded it today. This is one of those apps that's incredibly frustrating because a lot of the main advertised features are behind a pay wall and/or you have to make an ADDITIONAL ACCOUNT FOR. Paying more than $1/mo for a list app is ridiculous. If anything it should be a one-time purchase.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. We modeled all our pricing tiers off of similar services so we could stay competitive. We also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: Just trying it out. Seems like a great app but has a really, really basic miss that I saw referenced in another review: Theres no intuitive way to specify or change the time of a task. Tasks are all just all automatically set for 9 am and theres not visable button or option to change the time. The other user mentioned trying to use Google to figure out how. But such a basic miss seems like a flag that maybe I should try a different app.
replyContent: Hi Seth, please note that you are able to change the time of a task, to do so simply tap on the task you wish to edit, and ether tap on the reminder to edit it, or tap 'Add reminder' to set a reminder. You can learn more here: https://support.any.do/reminders/

content: Seriously Lame! ‚Äì Seriously limited interface. ‚Äì Only a few characters can be used per entry. ‚Äì Not easy to use. ‚Äì Task entries are huge, taking up screen real estate. ‚Äì Doesn't handle projects. ‚Äì Doesn't connect with other major apps. ‚Äì Help system is ineffective. ‚Äì I don't see any.do being anywhere near as effective as my multi-point diary. Any.do doesn't ask enuf of the right questions. It's not engaging, but boring. ‚Äì Any.do is get getting left in the dust of the competition.
replyContent: We have a new workspace version for projects, the task title can be very long as well as notes so we are not sure we understand what you are referring to, we recommend checking out our help center to learn about all our features here: https://support.any.do.

content: I believe the WhatsApp integration feature hasn't been working as expected. I've set a few daily task reminders on the app and turned on WhatsApp integration. I did get the reminders on WhatsApp a couple days but not anymore. Anytime i go back to edit a daily task all over again i get reminder the next day but not after that. Am I missing something. I'm asking specifically about the WhatsApp reminder as I don't check app notifications.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Yes, I mean, Work Space feature might be useful for individuals working as a team or various teams collab. with each other on a project. But here I and many others have no use of such a feature. As an individual I have no use case of this feature as I don't need to assign a task to anyone and just need alacrity. Such a feature is needed for corporate Env. which uses separate project management suite. I don't need to try or pay extra for WS. No inherent need. Is Any.do team sure of need for WS?
replyContent: Are you referring to the workspace offer? If so we are going to add the option to remove the add on the next versions.

content: Decent but recent changes ahem Omer are not helpful! It's giving less sticky, pushing new features (üò¥) and makes me want to move to another app!ü§≠ I doubt replying to their customer feedback will get any changes. The priority will be paid customers naturally.
replyContent: We reply to all users within the time frame we committed to. We are sorry you feel this way! In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please pinpoint the issues you are having and send it to us via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to assist you :)

content: Getting slightly annoyed at the new "my day" that has replaced Moments. Not only the list to choose from completely ignores that some tasks are already scheduled for later, but it is also impossible to reschedule on the fly using this function. I find it now much harder to organize coming tasks over the week than with the previous versions.
replyContent: Hello, we are sorry you haven't found the advantages that come with MyDay useful yet! MyDay was introduced so that users can prioritize tasks for the current day. MyDay also resets each day to ensure a fresh start. If you have any more questions feel free to reach out to us https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: I want a day planner that lets me set a time for tasks without there always being a reminder notification. This app can't seem to provide that. I'm also not happy with how the free option wasn't made available to me during sign up. Seems fishy to say "free forever" on the homepage, but when it comes to signing up, I only saw a 7 day free trial. The help section was a joke, so I unsubscribed immediately.
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 90% of our features at no cost. We never require our users to upgrade. All users can use the app for free for as long as they please. Any user can dismiss the trial and user the app for free. If you have any feedback regarding our help center we will be happy to hear via our contact form: www.any.do/contact_form

content: The app has become practically unusable. The grocery list section drop-down list always closes before I'm able to check items in the list. I also lost all my categories due to the updates üò°. I am using the paid version, but I will be switching to an alternative soon.
Really bad thing that you cannot convert regular list back to shop list, so you may delete your 100 items shoplist once you missclicked in list menu.
replyContent: Our team will be happy to convert the list back for you please reach out to them here: www.any.do/contact_form

content: getting ready to uninstall. Keeps coming up with a notification saying it added bubba burgers and other stuff to my grocery list. Obviously paid promotions
replyContent: It sounds like to clicked on an ad outside of Any.do that added this item to your list, we do not add items without the user adding it.

content: Love it!! 9/7/21- what happened to the shopping list? 02/26/2023- I hate this and will be deleting most likely before renewal date. The daily moment is gone and now when it wants me to plan my day it gives me a list of tasks.... tasks even from my list of ideas of what to get my kids for Xmas. Before I could say when I was planning to do a certain task with ease. I don't understand why the change but this is about useless to me now.
replyContent:
We do still offer a moment feature on our mobile device along with ways to prioritize tasks on MyDay! You can learn more about setting moment instead of MyDay right here: https://bit.ly/41KbXOD
If you need help locating it please contact our support team https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: The reason I paid for this app in the first place was the 'moment' feature as I found it really helpful and intuitive. It's the primary reason I used this app over similar ones out there. Not sure why that's now been buried into the settings with a much worse daily scheduler taking over. Please revert this or atleast allow users to toggle to their preferred method. An update should make the experience better, not worse.
replyContent: You can set your daily push under setting to moment and select the day and time you want to get the notification.

content: Update #3, 1.21.23: 2/5 stars because all my tasks from the past 6 months are now missing - I suspect from latest update? I sent a bug report and will change this review to higher score once my tasks are restored. Update #2, Aug '21 (edited): Have been using for years. Would be good to choose to have over due tasks only show up in folders instead of one big unread task list. Had to replace much of my old review, cos character limit for Play reviews.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're still experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using and add your suggestion regarding the folder, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Loved this app until the recent update. Now it takes extra taps to mark an event complete and it defaults to showing way too much information when you select a task. Needs to go back to the old setup.
replyContent: Sorry, you feel this way. Was there a specific issue you encountered? We will be happy to assist, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Don't know what happened to this app, but I'm about to uninstall it List-making was very good with many optional subdivisions though it looks like I have lost that feature (& if that is now behind a paywall I've not found an easy way to upgrade)
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please pinpoint the issues you are having and send it to us via www.any.do/contact_form. We will be happy to assist you :)

content: I've had a subscription for years. I used to be able to invite/assign tasks to colleagues etc, but now I can't without a better subscription so that's frustrating. I feel I'm going to have to invest a lot of time in upskilling to the features which is also frustrating, and who knows where I go to find those resources.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you with any questions should you contact us here: https://www.any.do/contact_form. feel free to check out our Help Center: Support.any.do. Or if you want tips or news about Any.do, take a look at our blog: blog.any.do.

content: I hate that you've removed categories from grocery list. The suggestive item feature is also gone. Stop saying an update is an improvement when it doesn't progress the experience.
replyContent: Categories and our suggestive feature on our grocery list is still offered through our update! Please log-out / log-in and make sure you have the latest version of our app installed. If you are still experiencing issues please reach out to our support team and we will be happy to assist you :) https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: I'm a student and was looking for something get myself very organized. I have tried series of productivity apps before. Two things I found disappointing, features are extremely limited without premium, it's almost impossible to use like that also very expensive. I couldn't find statistics; from totally hours and other reports
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 95% of our features at no cost, including all core features. We never require our users to upgrade. We modeled all our pricing tiers off of similar services so we could stay competitive. We also occasionally offer promotions, you can inquire about them at premium@any.do!

content: Frustrating to use. I set up tasks to repeat weekly and of the five, one showed up for the following week but then disappeared and the rest only appeared for the first week. I've triple checkd the settings and they are all set to repeat each Monday. It's another one of those apps that claims to save you time but ends up being a time sink as you mess about with the settings trying to get the damn thing to do the basics.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: Still the same issue, 3 years later..I'm giving this app 3 out 5 because there is a really annoying behaviour when you're adding a quick note and if you by mistake tap outside the text box (which one would do on the go) your note is erased and you need to start again. I'm considering uninstalling it because this happens almost every time I add a note which means that it takes me twice the time. Please at least keep the text and don't erase it in case of an accidental tap outside the box. Thanks

Push for new grocery list feature with auto order. Tried adding items. No auto ordering happen. Try and report bug but only get sent to a help page which repeats that this should be automatically done. How do you get bug reports if you block submits?
replyContent: We do not block submits, you can also contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form. For the grocery issue please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. If you're still experiencing any issue, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: Once it was good, but now: extremely bad UI-design with lots of steps to set simple reminders; notifications don't appear; internal design and mechanics contradictions; setting exact time is the pain in comparison with the previous versions. I understand that lots of IT-programmers have to do something to get extra bonuses, but not making the app worse! It also seems that Any.Do team doesn't know the A/B test processes and live experience checking. Otherwise they could understand the difficulties of current design and withdraw the changes. Current version of the app - easiest target for the criticism with many points to mention.
replyContent: Any.do's approach to task and project management is simplistic and we intentionally avoid adding unnecessary features so that users remain focused only on what matters :) Please view our Help Center to learn about all our features here: https://support.any.do and if you have any questions, please contact us here- https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: It's buggy & I dislike the interface. Also, you can only connect ut with other apps with the premium account. Not what I was looking for.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We encourage users to reach out to us directly in order to better understand the issue, or feedback and get to the bottom of things so we can offer a full resolution. We work hard to resolve any issues! :). If this is not the type of solution you are looking for, we respect your decision to move to a different app.

content: I was about to jump wholeheartedly into using this app (its integration with Google Calendar being exactly what I'm looking for) but now I see that it has no search feature on Android. Worse still, Android Search has been on their roadmap since 2015 and it's still not done. 2015!?! In the meantime other apps can build smart lists it out of tags, status and free text. Seriously behind the curve, guys.

Nawww, sorry your yearly subscription price scared me off. By the time I've subscribed to every app I consider helpful I'm spending waaay too much. I would have liked it but I have other much more important bills to pay. The low stars is due to the price and there's no point in coming back to justify it because it'll still be too much for me. Edit: I know that I can use it for free, but then I'd still have to put up with ads. Surprisingly I don't like ads. I still consider your sub too much.
replyContent: You should only receive a pop-up about Premium if you try to use a Premium exclusive feature, plus one time when you first log in. If you are seeing it more than this, please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into this for you.

content: Very useful app except something has happened with the grocery list. I subscribed just for this list and now it looks like I will be removing my subscription. Dropped from 5 star to 2
replyContent: We are sorry to hear you are experiencing issues with the grocery list. Please reach out to us via our contact form (www.any.do/contact_form) and we will be happy to dig into this for you to ensure the app is working properly!

content: It constantly crashes and misses a lot of functionality. Hard to use and annoys with some popups that can be discarded only by closing app and then opening it again and permanent noticfaction that CAN'T be disabled. Payd 30 euro for this and used for month before it got so annoying that I started to look for another app. Fortunately I found one - Todoist. It's unbelievable how much better that is. Also there is version of todoist for PC, for your smart watch and even as browser extension which allows you to easily set a certain web page as task. And all these are synced.
replyContent: Any notification we offer can be disabled in your app settings. In addition, Any.do has a web version, smart watch integration, and a Chrome extension that can add web pages as tasks :) Regarding the crashes: We recommend you submit a bug report via Settings - Support in your app, so we can help resolve this for you ASAP.

content: Look this app had potential, but there are a ton of efficiency type issues. For example, if in a list and hit back on phone, it closes the app instead of going back a menu option. Accidentally clicked a task and crossed it off, gonna need remake it. I really want to like this app, and been using it for a while. But ever update i see is usually something like changing color scheme options or something. Been premium and used the app for a few yrs now hoping updates would come, they haven't...
replyContent: In order to save the changes you have to press the save button or swipe the tasks down, otherwise it will revert. We will be happy to hear about your suggestions should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form :)

content: I've had a paid subscription to this app since July 2020. I got it mainly because I want to add items to my grocery list via My Google Home devices using voice commands and I wanted an app that can manage both calendar events and tasks well. This app isn't it. I regret paying for a year's subscription. The grocery list functionality is very limited - you can't add price or even quantity. If you add recurring calendar events, there's no way to set an end date or set the number of occurrences.
replyContent: As explained on our Help Center, the Assistant integration is available for both Premium and Free users, and we only sync with the Notes&Lists feature and not with the designated Google Grocery feature (support.any.do/anydo-google-assistant). As per the price and quantity, and end date for events, our team is already looking into these options :)

content: Recurring subscription fees with no option to buy the software once and for all => uninstalled and replaced with a better alternative that one can purchase instead of having to rent it, at a cost that is lower than the repeated rip-off from this one. As for their reply: no, this app does NOT offer anything that the alternatives would not include as well.
replyContent: If you're having trouble figuring out how to take advantage of Any.do, feel free to check out our Help Center: Support.any.do.
