content: ADD TAG is not working on the tablet. Many simple things missing even on premium. 1. Even though I have allowed background activity that focus tree not working properly after some time it stopped automatically. 2. there is no dashboard as per the tag say study tag, How much time I have spent on the study today. and you are charging 840 yearly these basic things must be in the app.
replyContent: We are sorry you are experiencing issues with the app! Please reach out to us via our contact form and we will dig into this issue for you! https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Bottom Pop up notification for task not working for my phone.
replyContent: As long as you‚Äôve turned your reminders ON and enabled the app notifications in your device settings, you should be getting them. Please check out this article https://support.any.do/troubleshooting-reminders/ . If you're experiencing any issues please submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: The UI getting worse than ever. There is no delete function for a task. Update: Archive is not delete. Why should I have to archive if created a task accidentally or wrongly. In that case I want to delete because archiving doesn't make sense. Update2: No, it's not just an other way to say. Archive is not delete.
replyContent: Delete and archive is the same in the app. This is just another way to say it. We make sure a user can recover a task they accidentally deleted\ archived if needed.

content: Decent app, very helpful to split things up visually but several issues over the past few months of usage. Tasks suddenly stop syncing up from a desktop PC to the app, deletion of lists seem to work but then the lists re-appear, and most recently all the tasks that have been completed over a period of time are suddenly back in my list. On a basic level, this app is useful, for anything more than that it's not the solution I was hoping for. I am a little OCD but if you are too then look elsewhere
replyContent: We're sorry for this experience! Please submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you!

content: I have used this app for years, it is great if you want to be more organized and get reminders of the tasks you need to do. I must say however, that the app itself has regressed throughout the years with all the updates. Things used to be simple and intuitive, now I don't understand what half the buttons do, basic functions like deleting and removing tasks are way too clunky. The concept of the app is great but I can't recommend it anymore, each update makes it worse.
replyContent: Please note that completing and deleting tasks, have stayed the same all along. We'd love to get your feedback about what specifically you liked or disliked about the new update, by writing to us at https://www.any.do/contact_form. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: I really like any.do and having my to do list and events in the same place. However I have knocked off stars because I need more customisable repeat options and notifications. Sometimes my tasks are every two weeks, or every other day, or every 3 days. Would be nice for this option. I also like to put reminders in for my work calendar. I don't seem to get the option to change this when doing a new event reminder. Can't afford premium. Shame. Back to Google calendar. :(
replyContent:
Hi, please note that we do support advanced recurrence settings! You are able to customize your recurring reminders in this way, however please note that this is a premium feature.
You can learn more here: https://support.any.do/recurring-reminders/

content: This was a great app, a year or more, ago. The simplicity of adding and checking off tasks, without clutter of a bunch of fancy features, was it's strength. Basically, it was as simple as making a list on a piece of paper, with the added bonus of having reminders. Now, however, it requires more steps to add to-dos, and is becoming more of a complicated app, loosing the original appeal. As of some time ago, notifications also stopped working, which mean I will leave, after some 5+ years of use.

Very useful app if you are in the habit of forgetting things. But it has one major defect. If you have set up a recurring reminder and if you miss one instance of that reminder, further instances will never show up. They are gone forever. I had to pay a penalty fee for late payment into my credit card because of that ridiculous bug.

Some features just don't work in the free app! I have tried to set a daily reminder for 9am to put a ticket in my car. Once I click "Done", it sets the reminder the next day.... at 1am. I dismissed the 1am reminder once, half asleep as the sound woke me up, it never reminded me again and now I have a parking fine to pay. I have real memory difficulties and need an app that actually works properly! Disappointing, as I find the one off reminders really helpful.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issue with the Recurring Reminders, so that's odd. Please make sure to follow instructions provided on our Help Center at- https://support.any.do/recurring-reminders/. For any questions or assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we will be happy to look into it for you.

content: To be fair, I downloaded it and uninstalled it after a couple of minutes. The reason for this is that I hate apps that scream "pay me money" since the instance you download it, and this one did that exactly. With the "free premium trial" being in your face all the time, and then setting it up or going through the tutorial you could see all the features and all you could see is "premium". Just do the app as a paid one instead of begging for people to pay for it. It looks amazing though.
replyContent: Please note that 90% of the app is completely free, and we allow our users to enjoy all core features for as much as they wish without a requirement to upgrade :) The Premium ad only shows up when first opening the app, and when clicking on a Premium feature. You can opt out by clicking on 'No, Thanks' on the ad :)

content: Great when it works, but currently keeps crashing. At the moment each time I try to open the app it just closes itself. Also when I try to rearrange a task it doesn't always work, particulay if it's one out of a recurring sequence. Even if I select 'only this one' it tries to change all events in that sequence, which is very frustrating. Shame, because there's a lot I really like about the app but the faults make it literally unusable.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Great app. I've been using it for years now and I love it. Great to see new features being added every now and then to keep it fresh and useful. Update: I have an issue with saving subtasks. Sometimes there's replication even when I create just one subtask. Also, can you enable autosave? God forbid if I create tasks and my phone screen turns off before I save coz I'll lose any new changes I made. I used to autosave a while back. Please fix this.
replyContent: If you are experiencing issues with the subtasks please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report). So our team can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: the simple layout makes navigation easy and intuitive. I decided to try this as an alternative to Google calendar and whislt its integration of AI assistants and task tracking seems very good, as a calendar I have to say im not impressed. Looking at the calendar from a months perspective doesnt show at a glance which days you have something happening, rather, below the calendar is a schedule view which shows you what events you have which i find confusing. Would be nice to view by month.
replyContent: If you would like to see color tags for events on the monthly view, you can view it on our widget https://support.any.do/widgets/ :)

content: It looks good, but it isn't as intuitive as it feels it should be. There are a lot of quirks. When I add a task, then go in to set it to repeat, it marks the first occurrence as done. Sometimes when amending reminders it creates duplicates in the list. I tried using things like "6am daily" when using the quick create, as it says you can use natural language, but it doesn't recognise daily. I can't see how to set a task as daily immediately, you have to create a task then go in and edit it.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: The free app works well but pops up with annoying notifications every now and then to remind you to set more reminders... Kind of pointless. I'm also not a fan of the subscription model for premium. The layout and app itself is good though so it's a shame about those negatives. I would have considered buying if there was a one-time payment model.
replyContent: You can disable any notifications you don't like from the app. The Any.do Moment reminder which can be toggled off in settings. The only other notifications you should receive are for reminders, which if you don't like, you can turn off these reminders and simply have due dates for tasks without any notification.

content: I'm using the app on my pc and Galaxy z fold 3; it works well and synchronizes on both but, the app on my Galaxy Watch5pro can't be synchronized with the phone
replyContent: We are sorry to hear you are experiencing issues. Please reach out to us via our contact form so we can dig into this issue for you. www.any.do/contact_form

content: A good app but it's got such an annoying design flaw... Every time you go to add a reminder and select a time from the swipable menu with "tomorrow morning, next week, someday, custom" options, the menu is so thin that if you don't click with extreme precision within the menu boundaries it closes the 'add reminder" section and deletes whatever you've typed. I accidentally click outside the menu alllllll the time and have to re-type everything multiple times.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback, In the meantime you can add tasks using the + symbol next to the category, there you can add reminders with out is closing. You can also add reminder after you save the task and have a full reminders menu.

content: This app is good overall but I don't receive any notifications for the reminders of the tasks.
replyContent: As long as you‚Äôve turned your reminders ON and have your device open and app synced, you should be seeing notifications in their designated time. If you're experiencing any issue with your device allowing the app to send notifications properly, please submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: When you have a list open and hit the android back button the app closes. It would be much more intuitive if instead it goes back to the view with all lists. Also the notifications for repeated tasks don't work properly. I just get the first notification but not the repeated ones for the following weeks.
replyContent: The way recurring reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. If you are not viewing the app in date view, it will look like the same task has popped up again, but it is really the next occurrence of the task. Only when completing the current occurrence, will you be able to see the next one.

content: The app is OK but it could be much better in terms of usability. For example: 1. When setting a new reminder, the first button (which you are most likely to press without thinking) should be 'set timer', not 'share the task'. More people will want to set a reminder than share a person note. 2. The 'focus' button when the reminder comes up is in the prime location for when you are typing/using your phone and leads to you accidentally cancelling reminders each time.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. We would be more than happy to hear any other suggestions you have for the app at Customers@any.do!

content: I'm new to using Any.do, so I'm still really unfamiliar with the app. I'm so far finding that the free version is quite limited... I wanted to try the free version before doing the free trial for the premium, to compare the differences. The main point I'm unhappy with, is the fact that the reminders don't make any noise, so if you're not looking at your phone, you never realize you're getting a reminder. Is there a way in the free version to put a sound to the reminders?
replyContent: You should hear sound when receiving an Any.do reminder! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I like it, a lot and also not a lot. I like the way it looks once the tasks are created, but I dislike creating the tasks using the current interface. 4 comments. 1. I have the full version with WhatsApp linked and it causes duplicate reminders. 2. The widgets are not recognized by my homescreen replacement app (go launcher). 3. I would like to be able to resize the fonts and spacing. 4. Creating tasks via WhatsApp or Google assistant is very limited in its possibilities and often erroneous.
replyContent: Hi Co, please note that you are able to turn off receiving Whatsapp reminders via settings => integrations => Whatsapp. We would be more than happy to hear any further feedback you may have, and assist with any issue, please contact us at Customers@any.do or submit a bug report via Settings - Support, so we can further assist you!

content: This is a simple free app. With an easy to use features and interface. But not much to explore, limited, with only the premium features as something that might pique your interest on. Other than those, this app does what it says on the description. If you're interested in a straight-to-the-point checklist, with minimal features, I think this can be your go to app. (3 stars; since this is not what I, personally, would look for in a to do app)
replyContent: 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade :)

content: Had to leave the beta when I saw the nice large bold text input (when you hit the + button) go away. I love the current nice large text design on the input. Hopefully it doesn't go away or at least remains an option. Turning off auto updates for a while on this app just in case you decide to make this poor life decision final.
replyContent: Please note you can control the font size from your device settings :)

content: Really loved the sorting function for grocery lists but it doesn't work anymore. Everything just gets thrown in "other" now.
replyContent: We would recommend you log-out and log back in. If you are still experiencing this issue , please reach out to our support team! https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Mostly good, but recently the grocery list suddenly stopped working. Everything now falls in the "Other" category.
replyContent: Please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. If you're still experiencing any issue, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: My notifications bar is telling me i have no tasks today even when i know i do which is kind of frustrating. Plus when i log into the app, my tasks aren't in chronological order for some reason after i set times for them at the beginning of the day. Other than that, i think it's a fab app and i love the little pop ups that happen at the beginning of the day and when a task needs to be done!
replyContent:
Regarding the notification bar, this is odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support. 
Note that our tasks are ordered chronologically only on our Calendar View, while on our Task View you can drag and drop tasks to anywhere you like :)

content: does not seem to work with google calendar, I see no reason to give them my payment info for a free premium trial. // I managed to add the google calendar. it took all the events, bur not the reminders in calendar . I still won't use this, as it seems to be a replacement interface but I like the google display better. I don't need to pay this much for few benefits to me. I have not found anything that I like yet, either.
replyContent: The payment info is a Google Play requirement which Any.do has no control over :) That said, 95% of the app is completely free and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade :)

content: Hi, today the editing or deleting of events stoped working. When selected to be edited the event opens in a window without it's name and if you choose edit the window closes and goes back to the calendar. Also by swiping your finger on the list it can not be deleted. I really love the app, it's has worked perfectly so far but like this it's useless, please advise. Kind regards, Marta Santos
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: Nice but there are few things that make my experience difficut: 1. It's definitely inconvenient to drag task from one manu to another 2. No option to change the manues to be in parallel (like columns) or to change the titles 3. Web ui super small! You cannot see the big page at once (I really didnt understand why it's so small!) 4. No direct chat or support
replyContent: Please note that you can drag and drop tasks (support.any.do/tasks), and change the lists' titles as explained here - support.any.do/lists. The parallel columns view is available on the Web apps at this time, and we would be happy to receive any feedback you have regarding the UI. Please feel free to contact us anytime at- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: When entering grocery itema, I like that it auto populates items that you can tap on while you're typing but after you tap on an item, it should delete what you started typing in the test field. Even better, if you could simply hit enter to add the most relavent item on the left, that would be awesome. Much like it works on spotlight with iOS or mac os.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: I've been using the app for a while mostly just as a reminder app. Finally, I put together a plan to use it as my primary task tracker. Great app for managing tasks üëè A little learning curve ü§î Sync with Google Calendar was easy üòÅ No CUSTOM Task reminder sounds?!!? üò° (üí¶ sound = Drink) Also, no multi-reminders for Tasks or times for Subtasks. Had to put 4 of the SAME daily tasks in as Stretch 1, Stretch 2....etc.

Used this when it was a slick and minimal to-do app years ago and wanted to give it another shot. Slick UX still, but no way to sync the calendar (that takes up half of the apps feature set) with my outlook / work calendar without jumping through hoops and zapier integrations. Between that and the other task apps I already have, uninstalled for now.
replyContent: On the mobile app you can sync any calendar you wish on the desktop apps we have a free workaround to view your events from other calendars, we are sorry this is not the solution you were looking for.

content: Been using this app to replace Gtasks and after a couple if days so far it is pretty good. Only given three stars as I have a Ticwatch Pro wear OS watch and the app does not let me complete or snooze a task from the watch. I get notification and a list of options to snooze 15mins, 60mins, tommorrw or mark Done. What ever I select nothing happens and the notification remains on watch. The reminder also appears on phone and the functions work fine if selected from phone.
replyContent: We are so sorry for this issue! Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: New update was step backwards. My recommemdations: 1) Have daily/weekly/monthly calendar views that show reminders and events in visual boxes (instead of just a list). 2) allow rearranging of the order of subtasks and add subtask reminder capability. Also should be able to check off individual subtasks. 3) allow a task to be turned into a calendar event instead of just a reminder 4) show that an event has subtasks from main view
replyContent: We do support re-ordering subtasks! You can drag/drop them the same as tasks! You can check off individual subtasks too! You can also see whether tasks have subtasks from the main view if it has our subtask icon! As for your other suggestions: These are great ideas! We've forwarded them to our product team and will definitely look into adding them.

content: Anydo is great, but... - 1star for no account free option. I value privacy more than cross-platform. - 1 star for upgrade requiring yearly payments. I understand that $3/mo doesn't seem like much to developers, but for people who have many apps and limited funds, subscriptionware adds up. (And we don't hit a coffee shop more than a couple times a year, so swallow the urge to make that comparison) Anydo is simple to use and has a clean, clear interface. Too bad there's no simple upgrade.
replyContent: Like many other apps, we require users to log in with an account, to make sure that all your information is available 24/7 across all platforms. That said, 90% of the app is completely free! There is no need to upgrade, since you can use all the core features of Any.do for free!

content: The tasks completed are no longer shown on the date itself, which made us hard to trace back what were the activities done on that particular day Add on review: thanks for the reply. But when I check on my calendar, completed tasks are no longer shown. I'm not sure we are on the same page. Yes They are still on the task list but no longer in calendar
replyContent: If you do not remove the Completed Tasks from your active lists, they will continue to show in the Calendar View :) Once moved to the Completed Tasks folder, these tasks are cleared from all views. The tasks will only appear on the original dates you added them to. If you cannot see them please reach out to the team at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Just one thing and I will definitely change to 5 stars. Make the 'Quick add bar' easier to use! Just expand the letter 'ADD A TASK' in the notification bar. Or at least make it easier to reach when using one hand. I'm right handed but the 'add a task' is located on the bottom left of the bar so it's hard to reach with a thumb. Please, I believe it's not too much to ask for.
replyContent: Thank you for your suggestion! We've forwarded it to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for a similar feature from other users we'll definitely look into adding it. :)

content: I regret paying for a subscription to any.do. Seems like a good app, but keeps showing me text that says "connect Google calendar to plan your day." There seems no way to say "no thanks, now stop asking me this! I find it irritating. Meanwhile, I found a beautiful Tasks app that does everything I want, is free, and does not nag me, so I think I will switch to that.
replyContent: We are not sure what you are referring to, are you referring to the calendar view in the app? Our team will be happy to look into this, should you contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: The widget is nice. But if you have a Samsung phone, the task and events sync with other services makes a comparable experience with no subscription fee or zapier headache. And the Evernote integration which is what intitally peaked my interest ... Doesn't support Evernote tasks.. It only creates a task in anydo if a page is created in Evernote per zapier.
replyContent: We are sorry you feel this way! We would be happy to hear your suggestions on how to improve the Zapier integration through Evernote. In order to better understand and advise you accordingly, please reach out to us via www.any.do/contact_form.

content: It's okay, but very focused on tasks, when sometimes I just want a list. The integration with Alexa and list sharing are the best features, but sync can be flaky at times. Also there doesn't seem to be a way to dismiss all those notifications!
replyContent: You can use the Someday section to have tasks in a list with no due date. The integration with Alexa is currently down and we war working with the amazon team to resolve it. If you have any feedback you would like to share please write us here :) https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I really like must of the app but it has 2 horrible bugs that made me uninstall it. Whenever I make a new event in the widget it places it a day after the date that I chose and then the edit button doesn't work and you are stuck with it and it might get confusing. I might download it again if that is fixed.
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with adding events through the widget. Please email customers@any.do with your account and device details so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: Started out strong... First few days perfect, synced to smart watch and woke with everything planned. But now it's not sending the notifications regularly - not to watch or android phone. Added it to the PC and tried the phone widget - maybe that broke it. Weird pile of repeated completed daily tasks with no time set, while the daily tasks with times don't notify. Some work then don't - very frustrating. Clearing the cache/reinstall didn't work. Feels like a battle to get it to function. :/

I like the application and the ui and love the way it displays notifications. But it's missing native integrations with Google suite, the sync with Google calendar is laggy for desktop and Android app, there could be plenty of features like detection of time and date on desktop app and more focus on work days like daily schedules of tasks with time periods and focus mode on desktop. I hope you improve it and I am willing to pay for it then, now I will use the free version for personal purposes.
replyContent: We appreciate your feedback, we have a gmail add on from GSuite Marketplace: support.any.do/any-do-gmail. The desktop apps have the smart type feature if it is not working, please submit a bug report and out team will be happy to look into this for you :) If our Dev team see high demand for Focus mode- desktop they will consider implementing it.

content: I love this app & I use it as my calendar. I would've given it 5 stars, but in one of the last times it updated, I lost the ability to delete takes that I set up on repeat. Please fix this issue!
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Overall not a bad app. For the first week or so, it gave me notifications when it was supposed to, but after that, it's almost like it forgot sometimes itself, e.g. notification on Saturday when I set it for Friday. Reminders for things I have set daily don't even come up anymore, but it remembers to give me an display-over-app notification to remind me to set a reminder. Also, no push notifications that take you into the app so you'd have to do it yourself. Sub-tasks are my favourite feature!
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with the Reminders, so that's odd. Please make sure to follow this troubleshooting article on our Help Center at- https://bit.ly/3cw9BZx. If you're still experiencing any issue, please submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support, and our team will be happy to look into it for you.

content: Overall, I like the app. However, I'm uninstalling because of the pop-up notification that goes over other apps and basically freezes my phone until i dismiss it. The app doesn't have permission to draw over other apps and no way to disable this notification. The only reason it isn't 1 star is because overall the app is good.. they just ruin it with that 'feature'.

Change in the calendar feature really made the experience worst :( It became more difficult to identify days with appointments because you have to click on each day and roll all the way down to see through the hours. Can you, please, fix this or return to the previous version? I really enjoy this app and I don't want to change to another one.
replyContent: Please note that we have not made any changes to the calendar. However, you may simply select you preferred view, to see your entire agenda, under the calendars menu, from the top left corner of the Calendar View (https://support.any.do/calendar-view/). For further assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Updated: It's widget can switch between calander / todolist and view the events for the calander, in the widget when clicking instead of it opening the calander app like most apps. It's task list doesn't seem to sync to gtasks but the calander does. Upgrade to premium to add things like a recurring event, daily planner, WhatsApp reminders, extra colors etc.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you aren't enjoying Any.do. If you have any feedback about the app that you'd like to share, we'd love to hear it at Customers@any.do. We're constantly trying to make the best app possible for our users, so feedback like yours is vital for improving the app.

content: My number start with 96778****** But It is not work when I want integration with WhatsApp.
replyContent: Please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: Great app! But have a few suggestions that would make it the best app in the market! Trust me people are looking for this! 1) The ability to add your schedule with a few clicks. For example you can set reoccuring events, but peoples schedules alternate. Would be great to be able to click the days you work group then at the same time and categorize them under work. (For reference look at the nursegrid app) 2) add your spouse or family directly. So everything is synced real time.(familywall)
replyContent: We have forwarded your idea to the product team Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. Regarding the real time sync with your family, I would recommend trying out shared lists, you can find more about it here: https://support.any.do/sharing-lists-and-tasks/

content: This app was a life saver for me. But its not working properly with my new OnePlus 7. It doesn't gives reminders which I set for whatever time. I get it once in a while, but most of the time no reminder. Please provide a solution for this asap. Thanks. Edit (7/7): It started working now. All I did was, in the battery settings, selected Any Do app, n selected the option Dont Optimize in it.
replyContent: We are so happy your app is back up and running smoothly now! üòâ

content: I have been using this app ever since I switched to an Android phone 5-6 years ago, and I have liked it for the most part. However, the recent addition of the "focus" button in the pop-up reminder bar is annoying. Focus is only available in the premium version and there's no way to turn it off. Time to shop for a new to-do list app.
replyContent: Please note all of the app's features are inherent to the design, therefore we are not planning on removing any of these features, premium or not. Furthermore you are not obligated to use this feature. We are sorry to see you go, but we hope you can find an app that better suites your needs!

content: I used to be a big fan of any.do products and I used any.do, any.cal for years, I think these apps are really easy to use. However, when I set a reminder for an appointment every Monday, it only allows me to set reminders on every Thursday( the date that I created that reminder) instead of Monday. it's really disappointing.
replyContent: Heya, did you try changing the start date? If you did and it's still not working, please submit a bug via Settings - Support so our team can look into it for you!

content: It's good, but some bugs. Most frustratingly: Today it randomly moved all my tasks into the default list so I lost all task organization. Notes for calendar events has to be very simple or it loses all formatting. I'll keep using it for now but still looking for a great task + calendar app.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with the app! We will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report. Please submit a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report) with the relevant details, so we can get to the bottom of this for you!

content: It is a fairly nice app. The tasks section is amazing, I am glad that all the tasks are organized into "today" "tomorrow" "upcoming" and especially "someday" sections, it is such a time saver and super conviniet and easy to organize, but for some stupid reason, you cannot see your subtasks in preview. Additionally, the UI of calendar is quite poor ‚Äî looks like it was designed ages ago; and the UX of "task details" is also too poor. You guys need to work on these.
replyContent: The subtasks are located in the task details. You can also create a list with the task title and add subtasks as tasks. Our calendar integration have other views: day view\ 3 day view\ weekly and agenda view. The learn more see: https://support.any.do/category/anydo-calendar/

content: Is it possible to change the time the "I'll remind you again in so many minutes" is displayed after pressing snooze...it's constantly blocking other functions on my phone and there's no way of swiping it aside, or getting rid of it...I'm usually doing something on my phone when a reminder pops up...I'm pressing snooze because I'm busy ..but I'm still delayed by the reminder now blocking the screen with this acknowledgement of what you've asked it to do...it's frustrating and unnecessary!
replyContent: You can set your preferred notification setting from settings-> apps-> notifications. If you are experiencing issues please contact us directly by submitting a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: We are missing a chat feature AND notification when a task is changed / completed / modified in shared lists. Any.do is pretty good for my personal use but even though we are both premium, we don't see any possibility of interaction with the - kind of interaction Wunderlist provides not just tiny notification WITHIN the app.

Cannot sort tasks. For example, if I have a list of 100 items and I want to put 20 of those items to the top I have to drag each one! This is ridiculous when some other similar apps have the ability to sort the list in various ways such as highlighting or flagging the items and having them all appear at the top of the list.

Good app, small inconvenience. When finishing typing I use the back swipe gesture to close the keyboard, but that doesn't happen. Instead going back while typing closes the current view. Also if you don't manually close the keyboard after finishing typing the keyboard stays up until you type again and close it or leave the app (the keyboard even stays up if you check the recent apps apps).
replyContent: Hi, we are not 100% sure we understand what you are referring you. We would be happy to assist you should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report.

content: I mainly wanted to use this app's grocery list with my Google Home. It's not syncing up with my Home even though I changed my defaults to Any.do in my Google Home settings. I really like that the list populates by department, but if it won't connect to my Google home, I'll have to try with a different list app.
replyContent: You are welcome to learn how to connect and work with our Google Assistant integration, on our Help Center here- support.any.do/anydo-google-assistant. Should you need any further assistance, please feel free to reach out to us at - www.any.do/contact_form, and our Support Team will be happy to help! :)

content: latest update away from daily moment has reduced automatic reminders which makes the app rely on input more Edit: when I try this is doesn't update it
replyContent: Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly.

content: The app works great. If you don't use the reoccurring task option. When you create a task, that reoccurs daily and you didn't do the task today, the next instance of the task is added on the next day to your today list. The problem is, the app doesn't always remove the predecessor instance of the task what results in a buggy mess. Is there no system in place to remove all older instances of a reoccurring task, when it gets added to the today list?
replyContent: The way Recurring Reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. Without completing the current item, the next recurrence won't come up. If the previous recurrence has been completed, you can clear it from your view by tapping "Clear Completed". For further questions, contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form

content: No experience with it. install / "Open" goes to a login screen. No thanks. I do not want to login to use this. I'd appreciate it if developers would say upfront that their app is not a standalone, local, private version. Too bad, could have been just what I need, otherwise. Sure looks good. To dev: thanks for the response. I rechecked. Neither the images nor writeup specifies an account is MANDATORY. "can" is different than "must". Updated with Extra star for prompt service. Thx.
replyContent: Heya! We ask users to register for an account so that we can save their data on our servers, allowing for cross-platform sync and ensuring no information is ever lost :) The cross platform sync is mentioned in the app's marketing images on Google Play.

content: Edited: Had a premium account and really liked the app but it got buggy and basically stopped working in the ways I needed on my samsung s10+. Support was unable to help so I requested a refund, which they quickly granted, and I've moved to a different app. Three stars for the app being good until it stopped working for me, for quick service, and for the easy breakup.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you are experiencing issues! We are not aware of a problem with recurring tasks however, our team will be happy to look into it should you report a bug via Settings - Support üôÇ

content: Not sure why but sometimes when I make an edit on one of the items on the list, next time I open the app the changes are not saved. Happened couple times already and I'm sure I clicked the check mark to save the item before leaving the app. A bit annoying
replyContent: This is strange behavior. You may be experiencing syncing issues. Please submit a bug report through your app by going to Settings - Support so we can check this for you.

content: Hello .. now I have been trying to cancel my premium subscription for over than 2 month but i get no response. Pls delet my premium subscription and let me know. Thanks I have used it for just one day and I just love it!! Easy to use with a separate reminders for each task in the day. You can prioritize the tasks easily and tag them. I just dont know if it is an offline app too?
replyContent: We're so sorry to hear you wish to cancel! You can find information on how to cancel all subscription plans on our website at https://bit.ly/3nIPU5A. Our team would be happy to look into your subscription issue, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Love the app, but it's almost useless on my Galaxy View because the app switches back to portrait mode when adding a task, for a tablet that sits stationary in landscape mode, it just doesn't work. love the app on my phone and the website is nice too.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We are working on adding support to all screens on landscape mode :)

content: Pretty good app but nothing crazy that I can't achieve with Google calendars already if there is I'm not in need for the feature atm. I've really been looking for the feature to set a reoccurring remind with a full custom option for say repeat every 43 days or repeat 3 months, then 4 months then 3 then 4 etc this sorts of features would be amazingly handy as you would then not have to set up a new reminder for each date after having worked them out manually. If you add this feature please LMK
replyContent:
Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. The suggestion you posted has already added to our UserVoice forum, and you are welcome to vote for it here: https://bit.ly/2mol4oZ
The more votes a suggestion gets, the more likely it is to be added in the future!

content: So far so good. But isn't there multi alarm function for specific task, as to make alarm in various times as it is in Google calendar or couldn't I see? Why don't you think of this easy but functional feature guys? One star gone for this. Edit: That's what I've been asking exactly why there's no way to have multiple reminders in a day or in various days, in differenttimes while it'savailablein Google calendar. Recurring alarm is ok. That's another thing.
replyContent: We have a recurring reminder feature to set reminders for tasks, that said there is no way to have multiple reminders for the same task on the same day, only if you snooze the original reminder. If you have any specific questions, you are welcome to contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we‚Äôd love to help you out.

content: The app's really nice and I really like it but it's just REALLY REALLY BUGGY for my phone. I can't switch between the calendar and tasks with ease. I can't even slash out items on the to do list smoothly. It could've been such a big game changer for how I do things!! :-(
replyContent: We're glad you like the app!  üòÑ If you're having issues, please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, and our team will quickly look into this.

content: The app is useful but now that I'm trying to configure it in a different handset, it is neither importing the html file exported from previous phone and if I'm trying to create a new account it's telling me Cannot find an internet connection! Thats weird!! What's going on with your App, team?
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: It seems like it could be good but very disappointed that it's subscription based and that there's not a one time purchase option. Not sure if pro has this option but it also doesnt seem to have a history of completed tasks. Will need to keep looking.
replyContent: Any.do is a service, not just a product. We continuously add features, keep information synced, safe 24/7, and provide Priority Support. Since Any.do offers more than a standard product, we chose a subscription as the best pricing for it, like similar apps on the market :) You can view/restore completed tasks by going to Settings - Completed Tasks.

content: A minimalistic task management and scheduling app with an beautiful interface and great widgets as well and packs a punch in terms of free features. Any.do does not allow sublists and allows only one level of subtasks to ensure simplicity, but compromising power. I have also found it quite cumbersome to add a task, put it into the right list and add a label to it. This is a long drawn out process which takes so much time and completely ruins the rest of the simplicity the app has.
replyContent: Hi Sujay, thanks for the feedback! Any.do supports a minimalist design which leaves things at surface level. This is why we do not plan on adding more layers for the time being. As for adding tasks, you may add them directly to a specific list from the All view or the Grid View :) For instructions, reach out to customers@any.do.

content: The android homescreen widget keeps on hanging every now and then. I'd have to remove the widget and then add it again to the home screen to make it work. It's really a headache. I may opt out of the app if the widget continues to behave like this. Google calendar was what I was using before and that worked completely fine.
replyContent: You appear to be using an old version of the app. Try updating and the issue should be fixed! :)

content: Great while it lasted. Used this as long as it's had an Alexa skill. Tried all the top list apps and this seemed the best. Now Alexa skill has disappeared, it's time to look for an alternative. Can't complain too much, it's not like I paid for it. So long and thanks for all the fish.
replyContent: We are working with the Amazon team to resolve this matter. They have not informed us of any specific ETA.

content: It used to be five stars but lately it's not synching or categorising and sometimes all items are just gone from our list. My wife and I have had to uninstall and reinstall the app and still have intermittent usability problems. I need to start looking for another app.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Our team will be happy to look into it should you send us a bug report (Settings- Support- Bug Report).

content: updated review; left review here for wrong app. Not bad so far, migration of data off wunderlist mixed up all the items in the list, sorted by date, not within each list. not necessarily the apps fault. just challenging just to get started. already deleted two other apps that were worse.
replyContent: We have an extensive Help Center detailing how to utilize the features -https://support.any.do/. You are also welcome to contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form with any questions. We'll be happy for an updated review once you get to know the app better :)

content: Everything else is amazing. 1.)But there's no option to reschedule a task to some other day. 2.)And see all my task completed in a given time frame. (It just says all the task completed till date) 3.)Also if you could add a box showing no. Of task completed and pending in this month would be amazing(as it is in To-do list App) Rest the interface is light and cool
replyContent: We have the "Someday" section for tasks that don't have a due date, if you sort your tasks by time form the 3 dots menu you will see this section. We have the completed tasks folder to restore tasks you have removed from your view. regarding the task tracker you can vote for this idea here: https://bit.ly/3E4q5G5

content: Missing an important feature!!! They need to add the option to remind you every x minutes and x hours per day. It is a must for someone who has ADHD. I would definitely keep the upgrade if they can implement this feature.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. The suggestion you posted has already added to our UserVoice forum, and you are welcome to vote for it here: https://bit.ly/2MHwrlq. The more votes a suggestion gets, the more likely it is to be added in the future!

content: Nuisance app. It probably works fine, but it's definitely not for me. However, when I decided to uninstall it, it gave me no easy way to delete my account. To delete my account I need to enter a password. I never set a password because I signed up with Google. So I have to login to create a password just to enter password to delete the account. I haven't figured out how to revoke the permissions I gave. This is abusive. Deleting an account and data should be straightforward.
replyContent: Please note that in order to delete a profile that has been connected with an external ID, you will need to first create a password for the account. After creating your password, you may delete your account under the profile page in the mobile app or via our Web app. For further assistance, please feel free to contact us- www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Hi team, I liked your app free version. I want to try full version for sometime, for effective usage. But there is no free trail or monthly subscription. It is asking for yearly subscription for which I don't take a chance. I hope you understood and provide solution for this. TIA.
replyContent: We have a 7 day trial , if you are not able to see it our team would be happy to send you a direct link you upgrade, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: App is fantastic. However, when a task reminder pops up, it disappears without acknowledging the notification. It used to have an icon at the top left but it does not show up anymore. Not sure if it is a big in the latest update. Please fix. I am on a OnePlus 7 pro running the latest OS.
replyContent: This sounds odd! Please reach us at https://www.any.do/contact_form so we could further assist you in resolving this :)

content: The is good and is really helpful when i plan my day. I have problem with the widget that has task and calender,problem is if i had a task that had to be done yesterday and i schedule it to do today,it doesnot show on calendar tasks but it shows in task list. If that could be solved experience using the app will improve
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: The latest app update (7/26/20), "new app navigation..." is a definite downgrade, from panes to a one side scroll, now I can no longer see full task list names, the "all tasks" option is changed, the new layout sucks. Why do developers always do this, "fix" things that aren't broken? Why can't you just improve the things people are requesting, instead of changing everything else around too? This ver is much harder/inconvenient to navigate than the previous one was. Trying to revert to older.
replyContent: This sounds odd! While the new navigation offers new shortcuts and an improved design, it has not changed the basic filtering and view options which have remained exactly the same as before. We will be happy to assist with any question, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I used to like this app, it is simple and easy to use. but lately it keeps deleting subtasks, or not saving correctly, so I go back to do thing I needed help remembering, it to find it gone. it also could be a lot easier to add a reminder notification
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: The app itself is great. What's not great is that it has popped up 10 times in the last week, taking me out of my current tab, one of which was a very important form I had to fill. It's extremely pushy when you dont use it, so if you dont plan on using it 24/7, DONT get it, it will mess up whatever your doing whenever it wants to.
replyContent: The app syncs and runs in the background, and will only notify you regarding your reminders with a pop-up message on your screen, which can be easily dismissed. We are unaware with any issues regarding the app interfering with other screens, however, our team will be happy to look into it for you should you submit a bug via Settings - Support.

content: Awesome app but hate the new placement of the buttons. When you use to create a task you clicked under the title to select when you wanted a reminder. Now it's halfway down the page. I keep hitting "share task" and it takes forever to back out of that screen.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! Please note that we have done this to make the app more consistent across all platforms, however we will be sure to review your feedback!

content: Recurring tasks an essential feature is available only in premium. Premium is not available for one time purchase. monthly payment is way too much for an Indian. it got to be affordable with one time payment for everyone to use. may be some one time payment option for different features like recurrent tasks, location reminder and paid themes would have been made it accessible for many.
replyContent: Our standard recurring reminders are available to all of our users, you can learn more about here - https://bit.ly/2GAP1JW. To learn more about our special Premium offers, please reach out to us at Customers@any.do :)

content: Honestly, this app is not user friendly, is not intuitive. When I try to schedule a repeating task, it's confusing. After selecting a task to be repeated, I am asked how many days?! What the heck does that mean?! How the heck can I SIMPLY set a task to be repeated every day? Developers, where's the user guide?
replyContent: Any.do supports advanced recurring reminders. This means that you can choose how many days will be set in between each occurrence. You could have a task go off every 2 days, 5 days, or 20 days. If you want a task to repeat every day, just set the number to "1 days" and you'll be set! :)

content: Simple and effective! although charging for color themes is ridiculous. I understand getting charged for the other add ons but color shouldn't be extra! The widgets are white and black see thru which makes it hard for me to see. little dots aren't helpful.

Notifications are annoying and not customizable (was getting them for not having any tasks for the day). I turned off notifications via my android settings and am still getting impossible to turn off pop up notification that blocks whatever app I am on. App is fine otherwise, but not for me.
replyContent: We're sorry for this Katya! You're welcome to reach out to customers@any.do so our team can help solve this :)

content: The task add bar blocks the list if it's too long with no way to scroll down. Also would like an option to have completed tasks to disappear not just sit there crossed out taking up space. And make it easier to share lists with others. Should be able to accept invites in app not over email.
replyContent: You can clear your completed tasks by shaking your device or pressing the "x" icon to the right of them. You also can accept shared list invites in your app! The email is just an alternative way of accepting. Regarding the Quick Add bar: please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into this for you.

content: Couldn't Find an option for what I was looking for: widget with events from calendar of several days ahead.. It has the option to add new events (and tasks!) right from the widget and the rest of cool functionalities but not the key one I was looking for... Edit: thank you for the answer but I think that will just work for the tasks and not the events correct? I don't need the whole month view (I can deal with the space taking on my screen for the advantage) but I do need the agenda
replyContent: Please note that the Calendar widget shows you your upcoming events for as many days ahead as you please. The whole month view is a part of the design and functionality. For further information contact us directly at https://www.any.do/contact_form and we will be happy to help :)

content: Great for daily list. Used to use the grocery list. Used to. Had to turn it off due to spam. If it continues, I'll uninstall the app. UPDATE/CLARIFY: IMO, spam is getting items added to my grocery list that I don't want & never buy. It was the app telling me "we've added XYZ to your grocery list"
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: It does not remind with a pop up notification continuously for consecutive days even when the dates are saved and the notifications are not on the home screen and therefore often missed. Moreover, it does not remind about the task the whole day even when no particular notification time is noted. This App. is not dependable.
replyContent: This is very odd! We highly recommend you submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: It's a great app but please remove the Workspace advertisement from the top of the tasks page. It is enough that you tell users about it but some of us use this app as a solo user not in a collaborative or work setting. Don't clutter up the tasks page. Allow deletion of grocery item entries. The "smart grouping" in grocery lists is also not very smart.
replyContent: Did you get the ad more than once? f you are seeing it more than this, please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support so we can look into this for you.

content: App looks great. UI is wonderful and the feature it have , they all are useful. Only problem because of which I uninstalled the app was simple and basic features like recurring task creations are made premium. Switching to tick tick for the same reason.
replyContent: Standard users can create recurring tasks for free. You can have a task return every day, week, month, or year. Only advanced recurring tasks are part of our Premium feature-set.

content: I really need a feature to work properly, and that is the calender widget. Once I fail to complete a task today, it sounds show up in the next days list in the calender, but it doesn't. Please add some option to fix this. Then it'll be worth the 5 stars. The rest is good

Honestly I would give it 5 star, since I'm not going to subscribe or anything, but the fact that you need to subscribe just to change the theme (just to change it into dark theme) is deal-breaker, so 3 star it is. I know, you guys also need to make money but for a appearance options need to be paid is a no for me, I get it if it's like new option like color-coding so you can easily sort stuff, things like that.

I first began using any.do in 2016, I think. Uninstalled it because clearly I did not think it was worth the hassle. Now, in Nov 2021, installed it again. The app has grown smarter and its many integrations are an attractive selling point. I want to try the paid version, but don't want to commit to paying for a full year upfront.

Seems like a great start for a to do list but having to integrate another app to make it work with outside apps is frustrating. However the BIGGEST issue is that on my smart watch (Galaxy watch 4 with wear os) all I can access is "new task" where I can input info but that it. I can't see my upcoming tasks, nothing.
replyContent: We integrations with Amazon Alexa, Google assistant, Siri and Whatsapp that don't need outside apps. Regarding the wear os, at this time we are working to add more functions. For now it is made for adding tasks on the go. For further questions, please feel free to contact us here- https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Long time user...do not like the latest changes! Changing the location of the remind feature is very frustrating. Now I keep clicking on the wrong option because it is in the same place as the remind feature used to be. Please change back...
replyContent:
Hi Alyson, please note that we recently updated the UI to make the app more uniform across all platforms. 
However we may review your feedback at a later date.

content: Now able to see list view from widget thanks to developer response - but there's a new bigger problem now. The integration with Google Assistant is going terribly. Everytime I try to add an item to my grocery list through Google Assistant, Any.do creates a new list called "Grocery". When I ask what's on my grocery list, it replies "you have 3 lists named Grocery, which would you like?"
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with the Google Assistant integration, so that sounds odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I don't like a widget with the monthly calendar plus events plus task. That monthly calendar is too big and unnecessary. I would like to have the option to watch a widget just with the date, the events and tasks. Something SYMPLE: As if we can watch it in the application the same would better in the widget. When they change it I'll give the 5
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback! We've designed the calendar in both the widget and the app in order to maximize productivity. For now we have no plans on changing it; however, we will forward this to our dev team for consideration.

content: Very good concept for an app. Very useful in day to day organisation. Issues: 1. Cannot connect to more than one app 2. When using App across multiple devises, updates only occur on the app you are using. 3. Seems glitchy when using on desktop. will not change who the task is assigned to but will easily change on android
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your app. Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Where is the priority setting? My app interface doesn't match the video you created for new users. I liked everywhere and can't find any any to prioritize tasks, only set a time for a reminder. Please provide up to date instruction for setting priorities and other details for using the app. Thanks.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback! We are going to update the video in the next couple of weeks with a new version. You can find all of the features in our Help Center and here is the direct link to our color tags, which you can use to prioritize your tasks: https://support.any.do/color-tags/.

content: i would honestly give this app a chance if more features were available for free users. a lot of people dont have the money to spend on an app like this, and since there are many other options i will try those instead. premium for this app looks really helpful and the layout of this app is great but im going to have to uninstall since the free version isnt really helpful to me :(((
replyContent: Please note that 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade :)

content: I can't set my time the same time I write up a task. I always have to save then revisit and set the time, which is very annoying. Also I can't upgrade to the premium version which is very disappointing. Overall not a bad app but there are a few things that need to be tweaked
replyContent: This sounds odd! Please reach out to us at https://www.any.do/contact_form so we could resolve the issue for you ASAP :)

content: Happy with the App...but personally I had two issues which are if addressed, may provide sort of convienience to the users. 1. If any task is not completed and deleted by mistake it can't be undone that I felt inconvenient to write the task again. 2. If any task is being feeded and there also undo/redo options are not available
replyContent: You may find completed tasks under Settings - Completed Tasks and retrieve by simply un-swiping :) Once you save modifications to your tasks, there will be no option to restore old data, which is pretty common but we do appreciate the feedback and will be sure to forward it to our Product Team for further review.

content: Absolutely loved this app until it stopped syncing with Alexa. Was told it's a problem with Amazon, they say the opposite. Sure hope they can work it out fast since I relied on it for the whole house shopping list and reminders.
replyContent: Amazon's stopped sending us the information regarding the Alexa lists. We are trying to work with their team to solve it as fast as possible.

content: Searching a task by words is nust when we have to find and edit a task out of many tasks. When editing or changing just date of a task, time saved previously should be changeable only when we need to do so. Here previously saved time is deleted and changes to current time itself which is not required. Because time is very important part, it must be shown in summary list even in case of unending tasks . It is not shown at present which is inconvenient.
replyContent: Hi, we are not 100% sure we understand what you are referring to. We would be happy to assist you should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: App UI is really good, i have tried almost all the top task list apps and like any.do best however would like to have Heisenberg matrix added to organise my tasks. That is the one thing stoping me. I want the quadrants features in this app and i would be absolute member of this app until forever.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback - we appreciate the suggestion! We are forwarding this over to our dev team for consideration üòä

content: I love this app on desktop, but the mobile version has annoyingly fewer settings. For example, it continues to show my entire family many calendars and I cannot choose to shut off particular ones like in the browser version. Please make this consistent across devices, Anydo!
replyContent: From the calendar menu you can check and uncheck the calendar you will like to see, the same as the desktop versions.

content: Please can we go back to entering the time with numbers. The clock thing is fiddly and pointless. It seemd your developers don't have enough work. Also when I select this evening I have to select the date before messing with the time which makes no sense.
replyContent: We use Android's native time/date selection screens for our app. Therefore we are unable to modify these because they are built into the Android OS. However we appreciate your feedback regarding these screens.

content: New User experience just logged in. pretty simple. started a list. saw that you could categorize them as personal or work. since i had typed all my tasks in the same place (first experience landing). i tried to move some of these tasks to the "work" section. couldn't. i can't tag them either. i have to retype the whole thing! Bummer.
replyContent: You can simply drag and drop or change their list from the task's menu :) You may find more details, here: https://support.any.do/tasks/

content: Please make the widgets more customizable and make us able to change the background transparency. Edit: Looks like you didn't understand. I'm talking about the background transparency of the widgets. Again, if you didn't understand - I'm talking about the ability to change the background transparency, the blackish background which makes the contrast higher and isn't necessary on wallpapers which aren't too bright.
replyContent: We have many widgets including resizeable ones :)

content: The app doesn't have audio alerts, it only displays a notification after you unlock your phone. Please add audio alert feature as well, so that you can get an alert even when you're not using your phone.
replyContent: You should be able to have audio alerts along with your notifications. If this is not the case, then we recommend you submit a bug report via Settings - Support, so we can look into this for you.

content: Great To Do list. The only issue is location based reminders seem to be sporadic. Also annoying that you can't set all day tasks, hopefully an update soon. No resolution and tech support slow, a shame.
replyContent: Sorry for this, our slower response times are due to the current events. Please make sure your device's location settings are 'on' in order to enjoy the Location Reminders. If you're still experiencing this issue, our team will try to reply back asap. At this time, we are not planning to add daily tasks, though this could happen in the near future.

content: App is awesome but one problem is that if i accidentally press back without saving my tasks, it doesn't even confirm to exit and directly discard all changes. Many times i have lost all my sub task whoch i typed and accidently pressed back instead of saving it.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issue with adding tasks or subtasks. Please note that in order to properly save your changes, you need to scroll down the Task menu. And after you type in the subtask press return. For any questions or assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we will be happy to look into it for you.

content: Working great so far until my Nokia 8.1 was forced to upgrade to Android 10 lately, after the upgrade reminders no longer show in pop-ups, though they still appear in notifications. Please advise how to enable pop-up reminders again, thanks in advance.
replyContent: Hi, due to Android Q limitations pop up notifications, will display only after tapping the notification in your Android curtain. That said, we are working on a workaround that will allow for you to set the app to ‚Äòdraw over other apps‚Äô. This will enable you to see the feature if you so choose.

content: Full of promise but the lack of word wrapping means task detail is hidden. Particularly bad for sub tasks where the font is also larger and therefore exacerbates the issue. If and when this is resolved I'll be able to use the app and give a more balanced appraisal.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We've forwarded it to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for a similar feature from other users we'll definitely look into adding it. :)

content: Love this app however I bought premium and since the app has been constantly crashing on me I still try and use it on a day to day basis as I have hundreds of tasks I've transferred in it and I love the app when it works but when it crashes daily it gets annoying and I hope they fix it soon. I have contacted support regarding this and have yet to receive support to fix this. I am still using the app daily as I do still like it but does get annoying when functions don't work.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with the app not closing correctly, so that's odd. Please send us a bug report via your app's Settings - Support, and we will be sure to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I don't know why this app is an "Editor's choice" there isn't any special graphics and you need to be a premium to change a color. Keep Google give me all this for free! I was just looking for a different to-do list where I could change the size of the letters.

Hi love the app used since years however have you turned off sticky notification reminders ? Because I swear this app did that till a bit back and now there's no option to toggle the setting and it certainly don't stick by default. I just swiped away multiple test reminders without dealing with them.
replyContent: We're not exactly sure to what you are referring by "sticky notification reminders". Kindly contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, with any relevant details (as explained here- https://support.any.do/sending-files-to-support/), and we will be happy to look into it for you.

content: Great app BUT it takes away access to your data after a while unless you grant full access to email addresses/google acct/ everything. Fair enough request, but not by holding data to ransom. Either that or its been compromised by malware, but I don't think so
replyContent: Any.do requires user to setup accounts under a user name and password for years now. We do not block access at any point as this data always remains under the account the user initially created.

content: A lot cool features, but also missing some basic ones too, or they don't work as expected. In ability to nest tasks (i.e. to rearrange one task as a subtasks of the other one, and to make a subtask as a stand alone task) is a deal breaker for me.

content: Good but why is there no widget? I just recently decided to try this app again. I like the reminders. Unlike some other users, this feature works fine for me. content: A good app, but a reoccurring price model is not the way forward. I would like a one off charge. Around 5 euros would be about right, so considerably over priced in todays free app market. You would probably have more revenue in total by charging 5 euros

content: I'm shocked there isn't a free trial period for this app. All the things that I'm looking for are premium features and aren't unlocked without a subscription. As a rule I do not subscribe to anything unless I am confident it will add value. A trial would help me make that assessment.

content: When you have a list open and hit the android back button the app closes. It would be much more intuitive if instead it goes back to the view with all lists. Also the notifications for repeated tasks don't work properly. I just get the first notification but not the repeated ones for the following weeks.
replyContent: The way recurring reminders work is that when you complete the current recurrence, the next one pops up. If you are not viewing the app in date view, it will look like the same task has popped up again, but it is really the next occurrence of the task. Only when completing the current occurrence, will you be able to see the next one.

content: Overall seems like a nice app I just wish the widget was better. Would like it to respect the system theme day/night, add ability to hide events on the day after they pass and option for agenda widget vs the whole calander plus agenda.
