content: kinda nice app...it's useful but the only problem is u have to unlock features by paying. hate that though
replyContent: Any.do is a free app, 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality, and unlike similar apps, we allow our users to enjoy most of the features for as long and as much as they wish without any 3rd party ads or a requirement to upgrade :)

content: better one of the hundreds of apps I've tried in this category I would definitely say top 10!! it's definitely a different look and approach to the "to do" or "List" apps that are usually out there! you could say it's more of a simple or easier way of looking at everything that you need to accomplish as it uses the today tomorrow and some day layout but it can also be useful for details as it has the options for subtasks if you so choose! keeping it for a while for sure over a bunch of others
replyContent: Thank you for your review, we are glad to hear you like the minimalist approach and our layout!

content: It's a pretty good app, but there are a few issues. It doesn't sort tasks that occur on the same day by which task has it's reminder set for earlier in the day. Instead when I select sort by time, it orders tasks that occur the same day in a seemingly random order. For example, a 12PM task will be at the top but a 10AM task is at the bottom. Additionally, if there is a way to delete color tags, I have not found it. At some point a couple of my tags duplicated and now I can't delete the extras.
replyContent: You can delete the tags from the desktop or web version, we will add this option back for the Android app in the next versions. Once you sort by time it will have your tasks in the order of the time and date, once you manually change the order or add a new task this will override the sorting.

content: Would give 5 stars if it wasn't buggy and didn't cause me to miss a task. The calendar widget is a complete failure. It randomly removes some of the calendars that are synced and creates a duplicate of repeated tasks when they are marked as complete. The whole reason I subscribed to this app was because I needed to sync all my calendars and make my life easier by maintaining them all in one place and not miss any appointments or tasks. The app is useless if I can't rely on it to display and sync correctly. Fix the bugs and I'll reinstall and change to 5 stars.
replyContent: We're sorry for this! We're not aware of any issues with the calendar but would be happy to look into this for you :)  Please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can diagnose and solve this issue ASAP.

content: I've used this app to manage personal and work tasks for over four years with no trouble. Over the last few weeks, I've noticed that tasks which I've modified (by adding or removing words) are randomly defaulting to what was there previously. This morning I saw a task blink away and return as the previous version of the task (missing the words I'd added). I rely on my tasks being accurate and have never had this happen until recently. Any hope of a fix?
replyContent: Sorry about that. We are unaware of any issues with the tasks not being saved correctly, so that's odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, with more relevant info, and we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: It suddenly quit syncing. I've tried logging off and back on again with no luck. When I try to do it manually it just already says that it was synced "just now"...even though none of the things I have added show up. Never had this problem before. If I can't get it resolved I will remove app and find something different. Very frustrating. Update: I did a FORCE STOP on the app, and it seems to be back to normal. It works for what I need (shopping list) but isn't the easiest for rearranging the list, and the advertisement at the bottom of the list is very annoying and makes rearranging the list even more difficult.
replyContent: Please note that you can move items between categories on the Smart Grocery List by tapping the item you want to change the category of, and choosing your desired category. The pop up at the bottom simply suggest adding identifiable grocery items to your list, and is not an ad. To learn more, visit our Help Center at- support.any.do/grocery-list.

content: A great app for keeping things straight! This is the only app I've ever paid for the premium, and it's worth it. It's great even without premium, but it makes remembering daily repetitive tasks much easier. I have trouble remembering things like that, or knowing if I've already done it. Only thing keeping me from putting 5 stars is that completed tasks have to be manually deleted after theyre marked complete, and reminders will randomly stop showing up. Maybe the update will fix the second one!

The app looks great visually, and I really think the devs put a lot of time into it. But I'm not sure how it offers any real benefit over Google Calendar, considering the features are largely the same. Plus, this app still isn't available for the Samsung Galaxy Watch3. Truthfully, I would still be willing to pay $2.99 a month just to support the devs (the app really does look great), but there's no option to pay monthly, just one yearly price. If there was a monthly option, I'd likely subscribe.
replyContent: Please note that there is a monthly subscription option as well, which can be found under settings- Go Premium. For any questions or assistance, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form we will be happy to look into it for you :)

content: Clean, simple interface. Generally fast and easy to add things as I think of them. However.....I wish the app didn't think it was so smart. I find the auto-spelling annoying. Putting in 8-10 ft. electric cord under lists was automatically interpreted as August 10th. And the assumptions about categories for shopping lists is annoying. 5 different things to get a hardware store end up in 4 different categories. Changing the categories for shopping lists is not easy to manage (and why do they show up under Tasks at all?)
replyContent: Sorry about that! Please note that you can disable the Smart Type reminder, by clicking on the highlighted time that shows in blue. As per the categories, when each item is added, it is filed under a relevant category, or a new one is generated accordingly. At this time, please note that categories can not be added manually or edited.

content: This app has been my sidekick ever since it was released around 8 years ago!! The grocery list feature they recently developed really makes shopping a breeze. My only complaint, and the reason for only 4/5 stars, is that the long-press always vibrates when reorganizing tasks, even when my ringer is off. Really annoying when youre in a super quiet place, not just for me but for others as well. Otherwise, absolutely my favorite app on my phone!
replyContent: We already have a UserVoice for this and are happy to work on it if it gets enough votes! Feel free to vote by clicking here: https://bit.ly/2LHgWdY

content: The app looks great but it's limited. You cannot add notes for specific days. You cannot add a calander unless you connect it to your email calander and the stake white color scheme can't be changed unless you buy premium. Which is about 18$ a year. I would love to see a daily note option with text editing allowed and the ability to add a calander without having to sync it with your Google calendar.
replyContent: Please note that Any.do offers a Calendar Integration, but not its own calendar at this time. You can add Notes and files to any task, and assign it with a reminder to be notified on a specific day (support.any.do/notes-files). Kindly note that we've recently added the Dark Theme, to be available for all users for free.

content: I've used Any.do for years, both paid and free. I love how you can prioritize tasks, and the daily review of tasks easily helps keep you on track. The calendar that shows events and tasks is great. Highly recommended! My only comment would be that I wish it was a bit more customizable in the free version. üòÄ
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review, In the app settings you have an option to customize the app to your needs. For example you can choose your preferred home screen, the day the week starts, language, reminder sound, default list and more :)

content: almost perfect. I do wish we could sort by list AND time instead of either-or. and it's not quite to the point that wunderlist was. but the voice control is incredibly handy, and it's decent at both shopping & to-do lists (although grocery lists feel a bit weird/limited compared to to-do lists). and the paid version is not necessary for most basic functions, although I personally upgraded because I felt it was worth it.

I LOVE this app. It was the one I narrowed down to after having downloaded several to-do apps. HOWEVER, I wish it had just a plain note taking feature for day to day things to remember, without it being attached to a to-do item. I also wish the interface was slightly easier to manage, there are a couple fixes that would increase the apps ability to be intuitive for the user. (An easier way to undo checking off a list item, being able to view the agendas differently ie calendar and tasks)
replyContent: Any.do is a minimalist task manager, which reflects in our design and functionality. However, We'd love to get your detailed feedback by writing to us at - https://www.any.do/contact_form. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: I like the ease of creating different to do lists, ability to create subtasks, and that i can make my grocery shopping list according to what store I shop at. It's great that the grocery list are automatically sorted by aisle for you. However, i noticed that if i add a price to the beginning or end of the grocery item, that it gets put in the 'other' aisle category. I also like how you can switch something in one list to a different one just by tapping on it. Nice work üëç
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback Lisa! We're glad you're enjoying the app and we will definitely look into allowing adding prices and quantities to Grocery Items without losing their categorization :)

content: Long time user of this app, problem is it doesn't have a search feature. Or if it does I can't find it. Sometimes I forget where I filed my note or task (again longtime user) and then it takes me a while to go through all my files to figure out which title heading I put it under, but if it had a search feature I could quickly find it and get back to being productive. For this reason I gave it 4 stars because it has room for improvement.

Pretty good app! I've been looking for something where I can make events and "check it off." I couldn't find anything else besides this one. The sync feature with Google calendar works great but it reverts back to April 28th and you have to scroll to preset day for whatever reason. Aside form the bugs it's actually just the app I was looking for!
replyContent: Regarding the calendar integration, Please reach out to our Support Team, at- www.any.do/contact_form, mentioning the app version you are currently using, and we will be more than happy to advise accordingly, and make sure you are able to use the app properly! :)

content: Honestly, awesome app... or at least used to be. Lately, it is extremely laggy, which is honestly a pain in the ass when trying to check which tasks u have to do. Also, it seems like there is a new feature where every time you back out of a task, it asks you if you want to save or discard; previously, it just auto-saved, which was very neat. On top of that, whenever I try to add a tag to my task, it doesn't save. It either takes me multiple tries to save the tag, or it just never saves. Plz fix.

I really appreciate many of the features in this app, especially the ability to sync with Alexa task (or grocery) lists and see the list easily via the widget! One feature that I've not been able to find (and would love) is a dark mode setting for the quick-add notification. This would be a great feature to add (or make it default if the app is in dark mode). Thank you for all the great work on this app! Very pleased!
replyContent: The dark theme is part of our premium offering. You can learn more about this at any.do/premium üòÄ

content: Honestly, needs a lot more features for me to be worth paying premium for (I tried out the free trial). The deal breaker for me was the fact that I can't set custom alerts for calender events.. maximum I can do is 2 days before event.. why can't I customize it (i.e 2 weeks or 10 days)? Then they need other things like automatic dark theme switching. Other than that, it's a nice productivity app. Love that it combines tasks and events into the calendar
replyContent: Any.do is a free app. We provide 90% of our features at no cost, including all core features. Please note that event notifications can be set up to a week prior to the event. Additionally, the dark theme is available for Premium users at this time, however, we are working on adding it to the standard version in the near future.

content: Overall good and useful. I'll likely continue to use, and.. .. . ..I would like more control of reminder sounds including repeating (so i don't miss it) and sounds without needing to open app. (maybe there are settings i can adjust). also more integration with other apps including Trello and Evernote and more a general multi app share feature would be great. As is i am copying and reentering things in multiple apps, and i want to just send them.

Confused. I'm not sure what happened and I'm glad I didn't have a long grocery list because I just had to transfer everything from my "Grocery List" to a new one so it would open like a normal list and not as a pop up. I don't understand why y'all thought that was a good idea but whatever. I've clicked everything I can think to click. "Convert to regular list" isn't an option that I've seen anywhere. Is that only in premium?
replyContent: You can convert your Smart Grocery Lists into regular lists by opening their list options and selecting "Convert to regular list." :)

content: This is my favorite to-do type of app, it's gorgeous on an oled display, but I really wish there were a better way to set up repeatable checklists. To start a good habit I find the reminder to do it everyday very helpfyl, but even better is tracking how many times I actually did after a week and when. This app allows repeat events with notifications but doesn't track time completed or show completed or incomplete events on Cal or Google calendar so making schedule adjustments is a chore.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!üòÉ

content: So far I think I like it. I wish there was a little more explanation of settings, and perhaps an easy way to set a task to a particular day without adding a reminder. Otherwise, I like that I can view my Google calendar in the same app as my tasks, and I love the way the task lists and grocery lists work.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! You can learn all about the settings in our Help Center here: https://support.any.do/category/getting-started. If you want to add a task without a due date add it directly to the "someday" section or add a due date for someday. For further questions, please feel free to contact us here- https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: Love this app because it does exactly what I need it to do (I use it for lists).. however, lately if, for example I need to pick up 2 cases of water and I put a 2, it immediately wants to change the date of the "task", and moves it on me. That's a little frustrating but otherwise the app is great.

I wanted to b a more organized person so this app was editors choice, and I subscribed to Any-do for the year. I'm just not sure what the difference is between this app and a glorified notebook. I mean I'm still getting to understand, ex: Any-do moments I have no idea whats going on there (any advice). Also it claims to sync to all Google apps but I've seen things I put on NOTE that have yet to sync. Any way maybe I'm wrong and will keep practicing, overall it's a good organizer

As someone with ADHD, organizational tools are a necessity and this is one of the best. I say that having tried just about every well rated organizational app in the app store. That said, this is obviously still in development. The web version is missing many important aspects. However new features are coming out regularly and the team is very responsive. Once a few more features are up to par (namely the website and the smart lists) I'll be changing this to a 5 star reveiw and paying for pro.
replyContent: Thank you for your support Rin! We are working on improving our Web App constantly and planning on adding new features soon! :)

content: Missing one key feature that is a deal breaker for me. I MUST have the option to create recurring tasks based on date of completion. Ex: If I have a recurring task set up to complete every 10 days, but I actually go 15 days before completing it, I don't want to be reminded again in 5 days. I want the next due date to advance 10 days from whenever I last completed it. It's unfortunate because I love everything about this app, but won't subscribe to the paid version until this feature is added.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We truly value our users input, and our Product team is always adding user suggestions to our roadmap. The suggestion you posted has already added to our UserVoice forum, and you are welcome to vote for it here: https://bit.ly/2A0PyUT. The more votes a suggestion gets, the more likely it is to be added in the future!

content: This app is awesome to manage to do list and the sync across devices feature is exemplary. The tags are absolutely useful in sorting and enhance the productivity. One feature I would love to see is its full fledged availability on Samsung galaxy watch 4. As of now, i can add task from watch 4 but i can't see my list and all the previously added tasks from the watch. If this app compatibility for samsung galaxy watch 4 running on wear OS is done, then I am all 5 stars for this app .
replyContent: Thank you for your review, we let our team know so they can develop more functions to match other platforms.

content: Absolutely love that it seems to always be open and available for me to quickly add a note or memo or a reminder having ADHD and being a mom I tend to forget almost everything this is by far the best one I've come across! Please add a Galaxy Watch version!!
replyContent: We are going to add more platforms in the future we will be sure to update our website once we have news.

content: A great app. The reminders are intuitive. The app has enhanced my productivity greatly. It's a bit pricey, though, for premium use (especially to add new users/workspaces). A workspace costs same price as a fresh premium subscription, making it not cost-friendly for teammates. Other than that, it's a great planner, to-do list and reminder app.
replyContent: We ensured that Any.do workspace would be fairly priced by basing our cost on standard industry business models. We have lower prices than most of our competitors :)

content: Great productivity app, helpful to have any lists/tasks accessible across devices and to share task lists with others when necessary for group work. Grocery list no longer functionally beneficial, updates removed all categories making the list far less efficient.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear you are having issues with the grocery list. Please reach out to our team via our contact form and we will be happy to assist you and ensure everything is working properly! www.any.do/contact_form

content: I changed my mind upon reading after installation, I am deleting andI do not want a subscription. Very helpful customer service. Appreciate very much. Thank you, only 3 stars because I do not know how the app preforms.
replyContent: If you're having trouble figuring out how to take advantage of Any.do, feel free to check out our Help Center: Support.any.do. Or if you want tips or news about Any.do, take a look at our blog: blog.any.do. If you have any specific questions, you are welcome to contact us.

content: Seems useful, but why wouldn't you allow users to have multiple reminders for periodic tasks? How are these an alternative to each other? EDIT: I said periodic tasks. You literally have a toggle that switches between task repetition and reminder repetition.
replyContent: Hello, we have an option to add recurring reminders to tasks! Check it out at this link: https://support.any.do/recurring-reminders/

content: I used to love this app. It was simple and the tasks for the day used to pop up on the day required. Now with recent update I seem to have to go through all my tasks and assign them to pop up in my day. A giant leap backwards for how I use the app and I will be looking for alternatives. (UPDATED) Thanks for your reply I changed the settings so things are pretty much how I liked them. Thanks!
replyContent: The "Moment" feature is still available, you can set your daily push back to Moment instead of My Day, if it doesn't work reach out to our support team so they can help you set it up here www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I would like to be able to customize/ be able to delete lists in my lists, I'm surprised that you can't. Other than that, it's a very clean pretty app. I just dont want any mention of the word 'work' I want it for personal use only.
replyContent: Deleting lists is an option, all you have to do is open the list-> 3 dots menu-> delete. If you need any further assistance, please reach out to our support team here: www.any.do/contact_form

content: Love the concept of the app, esp the Moment and reminding me whenever I open my phone! Some dear requests: - allow customization of the times in Moment (eg changing Afternoon from 3pm to 2pm) - bring to Galaxy Watch functionality üôèüèΩ - When using natural language to set time, please do not include the time in the task itself. ~Thank you and I'm rooting for you all!!
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback! We appreciate your suggestions and will be sure to pass this off to our product team for further review :)

content: It was good until the latest update and redesign. Now i don't get reminders for most of the tasks. giving 4 stars, only because it put my productivity to a level i never thought i was capable of
replyContent: We are sorry to hear about this! Please reach out to us via our contact form and we will dig into this issue for you! https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: This is the best To Do list app / orginiler that I used by far. I like the fact that it is cross-platform, it's quite intuitive and easy to use. Regarding issues, I think that the design could be a bit better and cleaner, and there are a few small glitches like the fact that the order of tasks is not being updated according to time right after and you have to refresh it. Otherwise, a great app!
replyContent: The new year promotion was 45% off of the price we offer directly, not the pricing in the app store. Thank you for your feedback and we allow users to select the location of tasks by drag and drop so if it automatically sorest by time is will not let you drag and drop.

content: I really love this app. I find myself wanting to make tasks for myself about it. It has an incredibly clean UI and feels great to use. The only issue I have with it is the pricing model for the pro version. For 5 or 6- admittedly useful- features, there's a monthly subscription. Which personally I find to be ludicrous. I'd willingly pay a one time charge, but a monthly payment is just silly for this app.

I love this app and I am so glad that I have found it. I wish I had found it sooner, then I wouldn't have wasted my money on other apps! The only things I would like improved is: - preview of the tasks in the tags and my list view. - the box view for the tags to be colour coded. Instead of the text, the whole box is in the chosen colour. - Quicker synchronisation with windows Keep up the great work!
replyContent: We üíô you! Please note that we display tags this way in order to allow for multiple tags to be visible for a task in list view. However, we'll be sure to let the product team know your feedback, and make sure to consider it for a future update!

content: It's a great app, but there are a couple small issues I think are essential to be improved. 1. If I accidentally click off of a task as I'm creating one (which is easily done when trying to scroll along to set a custom time for the reminder), it will go away and I have to re-create the whole task again. 2. When I snooze a task that's on repeat (I.E Portuguese word of the day), it resets the task and stops repeating it also.
replyContent: Hi Leo, we truly appreciate your feedback, and your idea has been sent to our product team for further review! In regards to what happens when you snooze a task, that sounds a little strange, please send us a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you :)

content: Great tool. I use it every day. There's a bug, however, that's very annoying. I'm on Galaxy Note 9. When I move the items, there's 80% chance the item will loose previously assigned datetime and will be moved to the Someday list. It's very annoying and time consuming! This is the sorting mode by Time. Additionally, when I choose this mode, majority of items belonging to various lists, unfortunately, will not be sorted by date & time, so I'd have to move them manually... Please fix these issues
replyContent: For a chronological view of your tasks, by reminder time, please go to the Calendar View :) Keep in mind that the Task View does not sort tasks by the hour, but only by specific time categories (Today, Tomorrow, Upcoming and Someday). If you're still experiencing any issue, please submit a bug report via Settings - Support, we'll be happy to help.

content: I love this app for keeping track of my homework, but I wish they would add some kind of timetable functionality for students. Also I think it's a bit poor that you have to pay for a subscription if you want to use the focus mode. In general the app is great, though, ideal for keeping track of everything I need to do, and it's great that I can set recurring reminders for orchestra, clubs etc.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, we provide 90% of our features at no cost. You can post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: Very good app, simple and easy intuitive organization. The available free vs paid things are also very well balanced. The only thing I would change is giving it the ability to put tasks at a scheduled time. The task itself, not the notification, which is how it currently works. It makes it so you HAVE to have a notification if you want the task in the right place in the calendar.

I love this application so much!!! Good job to the developers. However, I've been having some issues lately with the application. The application refuses to notify me of some tasks I planned to do. When trying to set the time for a reminder, the clock's 5 minutes faster and automatically blocks the other minutes before. As an alternative, I set the date and time using natural language but sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Kindly fix this. Once again, it's a wonderful application.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with the Reminders, so that's odd. Please note that the "Custom" reminder option is designed to set the earliest reminder in a 5 minutes time :) That said, if you're experiencing a different issue, our team will be happy to look into it for you, should you submit a bug report via your app Settings - Support.

content: Very useful for day to day and repeatable tasks. Only problem I've had is when some repeating tasks stop displaying notifications and I have to delete them and re-enter them, which is a massive waste of time, especially when you have quite a few different ones set up. Edit: it seems reinstalling the app fixes this issue.
replyContent: We would be happy to help you resolve all of the issues you have encountered should you send us a bug report via (Settings-Bug Report).

content: Suggestions: - Make the tag colors the background of the task, and not just a small line under the task title. At least have this as an option. - The trees in the Focus mode are all the same no matter how quick or long you do a task. Add variety to this mode: trees/plants to choose from, other decorations, probably even animals or different landscapes. Add more music to choose from, too. I definitely love the look and feel of this app. I enjoy it better with Premium, though.
replyContent: Those are wonderful suggestions. we have forwarded them to our Product team and will definitely consider it for future versions. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it ASAP!

content: So far, so good! I've been eyeing this app for quite a long time and I'm pretty satisfied so far! I'd just suggest two features: being able to see completed tasks on the calendar, without them showing up all the time unless you clear all of them! And I'd love to see more features with the tags, like being able to sort tasks by them and putting different "levels" on them. For instance, this tag has more priority than the others. Thanks for the hard work!
replyContent: At the moment you can go to your grid view and sort it via tags. That said, those are great ideas! We've forwarded them to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for similar features from other users we'll definitely look into adding them. :)

content: Clean, straight forward, and easy to use for me so it makes it more effective and likely that I'll continue using it. No distractions and helps me plan my day I really like being able to access it on both phones and computer too. Would like the sync updates between phone and desktop to be better / faster, hopefully that will improve soon. Would also like some additional functionality but that comes under premium.

This is the best to do app I have come across so far, I love the interactive features and the pop up. I will recommend some improvements e.g. 1. pop-up shouldn't just disappear if you mistakenly click on your screen until you snooze or postpone. 2. tasks forgotten should pop up at some intervals until it is marked as done, even if the date is in the past.
replyContent: Those are great ideas! We've forwarded them to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for similar features from other users we'll definitely look into adding them :)

content: Tried many 'to do list' apps and Any.do best fits my needs. Has been using the web browser and mobile app on a daily basis for several years. Good UI and flexibility that allows everyone to manage their lists in the way they wish. Great value for the money, but it's worth mentioning that I often come across bugs that ruin the experience and make it difficult to work smoothly with the app.
replyContent: Was there a specific issue you encountered? We will be happy to assist, should you kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: It's fast, easy to use, and I like how my repeated daily tasks only show up one day at a time and only shows up in the next day after I've completed the task the day prior. The moments feature makes daily planning a breeze, too. In terms of areas for improvement, I would like to see the Gmail zap integration fixed because it isn't working on my side. Also, for an auto-sort feature in my task lists so I don't have to keep refreshing it when I adjust the reminder times. Thanks. :)

Update The reinstall fixed it and now my grocery shopping is back to being nice and organised the update ruined the shopping lists feature. I really appreciate how it categorised my groceries but everything is now under other.
replyContent: Please uninstall and reinstall the app's latest version from Google Play. If you're still experiencing any issue, kindly submit a bug report via Settings - Support so our team can look into this for you.

content: I absolutely love this app, I run my own property maintenance business and it's just what I need to remind me about appointments and ordering supplies etc. The integration with WhatsApp is an excellent idea - I haven't missed a reminder yet. My only criticism is that it doesn't have a decent month view on the calendar, so I end up gravitating back to Google calendar, if that could be sorted out would be 5 stars from me.
replyContent: Please note that Any.do is a minimalist task manager, to help our users remain focused only on what matters :) The Agenda view (https://support.any.do/monthly-calendar-agenda/) was designed to help you see all of your upcoming meetings and tasks, and is ideal for users who plan ahead! For any questions, please contact us at- www.any.do/contact_form

content: Very nice. One thing lacking in this and all similar apps I've noticed: lack of customizeability. The semi-transparent widget is cool, maybe my favourite so far. But surely it's not such a stretch to allow custom colours and an opacity slider? Otherwise seems fine, apart from the ridiculous premium fee for features that exist on preinstalled apps. My web hosting is cheaper than this, come on guys.
replyContent: 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality. Our premium subscription plans are based on standard business models for the industry. Regarding the opacity slider, you can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea :)

content: 1 week in. not bad. somewhat intuituve. I like this app so far for its thoughtful blend of simplicity and intuitive features that go beyond being a task list, & more into routine habits. some important features are hard to find or change after initial set up. my day planning activity 'anydo.moment': I could not find all week to modify... So, it was starting this important step at a difficult time of day to use. Many simmilar apps aim & claim to be useful but only achieve novelty.
replyContent: Thanks for the review Kirk! As a new user we highly recommend checking out our Help Center to learn more about utilizing the features (https://support.any.do/), as well as our Blog which contains lots of articles on how to best apply these tools to your daily routine (http://blog.any.do/) üòä

content: I LOVED this app because it has a calendar and to-do list in one go. I can categorize my tasks and put subtasks below. But when I recently updated the app, no radio button to tick off for the subtasks. I handle a lot of tasks categorized. Plus the notes below the subtasks is not there anymore. You need to add more clicks. It was easy and organized. Now, in uninstalling. So sad, i thought I have found the app. Was about to go Premium to get the full benefits but uninstalling. üò¢
replyContent: This is strange behavior. The button to complete subtasks was never removed, and neither were the notes below the task. If you're not seeing these, we recommend you submit a bug report via Settings - Support so we can check this issue on our end.

content: It's OK but it's not for me. I'm a student and cannot pay for an upgrade in the app. The free options are a bit limited so I, had to delete this app. Hope you enjoy it thoüòä Edit: Thank you for replying. I will make sure to give it another try and re-rate it depending on my second experience :) 2nd edit: it's very helpful. It does what it's created for: planning and keeping your life organized. And with reminders for us forgetful people . BravoüòÅ I still feel like its missing something...
replyContent: Please note that 90% of the app is completely free, including all core functionality :) We'd love to get your feedback and suggestions, by writing to us at https://www.any.do/contact_form. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: The app is good, but it's not for me. I found it too overwhelming. I prefer a more simple and quick app for my reminders, like Microsoft Tasks or Google Keep. Also, many features are paid. That by itself is not bad, but a subscription is a bit too much for a reminder app, especially considering that many of these paid features are available for free in other apps, like the ones form Google and Microsoft. It should good for professional use, if you're willing to pay for a subscription.
replyContent: Any.do is both a product and a service, and we aim to help our users remain productive, with exclusive features and a simple design and functionality :) We recommend learning more about the app and the features here- https://support.any.do. We will be happy to assist with any question, should you contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Really good app that has helped me get much more organised! Just one change to make it perfect. When deleting an event from the calendar, pleeease add an option to "delete this and future events". At the moment there are only options to delete one or delete all. Sometimes I need to delete client appointments from then on, but need the others in the previous weeks for invoicing, etc. Would make my life much easier üòÖ
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. You can also post your idea on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: Lovely app. One problem though, billing is yearly. An option for monthly payments should be made available. Even if it's just for the first 2 months only and then maybe quarterly after that. Still not sure I wanna make a commitment for such a long time frame after a 7 day trial. Edit: On it right away. Thanks guys. üëäüèæ
replyContent: We have a monthly plan, if you are not able to see it our team would be happy to send you a direct link you upgrade, should you contact us at www.any.do/contact_form.

content: I love the to do lists with simple and useful style and features, but the calendar is lacking a bit. You should be able to change events color. Would be nice to have independent notes, instead of notes in each task, if it had that, the app would be the best organizer.
replyContent: Hi Lucas, please note that we sync all events from your native calendar, from which you are able to change the color of your events. If you would like any assistance in doing this, please let us know at Customers@any.do.

content: If the grocery categories stopped working for you, please log in and out. It worked for me! My previous review complained about groceries suddenly all going to the Other category.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review we appreciate it.

content: Pros - Really good app in terms of productivity and usability. - Love how it's possible to colour code and label tasks eg personal, work, university etc. - Love that it syncs with my Google calendar. - Plus I love the app's UI. - I also like the focus option; Cons - I think the focus option should be more like the forest app and not allow you to go away from the screen/tree, otherwise the tree dies. - I also think you should be able to add attachments to events like you can with Tasks.
I like the app, however, I would like to have a month view just like in a Google Calendar where I can see my tasks and events for the month.
replyContent: At this time, the calendar integration has a day view\ 3 day view\ weekly and agenda view. To see the month you can press on the arrow next to the month and year. Our widget has a monthly view you can learn all about it here: https://support.any.do/widgets/

content: Decent Todo App. Good for reminder as it can be set to remind one on weekly or monthly basis. However, I would like to see some improvement in the area to sort the to do list based on time, keep a history of past reminder events, and a search on all future and past events.
replyContent: To sort you tasks by time press the 3 dots on the top right side -> sort by-> time (support.any.do/sorting-and-filtering). To see your completed task go to settings-> completed tasks (support.any.do/completing-and-archiving-tasks). To search for tasks and events open the navigation bar on type in your search (support.any.do/the-search).

content: I generally like the app, moving from Calengoo(a great app) after 6 years. I used a trial version of this app and it looked quite good. Decided to subscribe for this app with annual subscription. After a few hours, I get a notice requiring me to subscribe. Thinking that my earlier subscription did not go through, I subscribed again, then only to note that I was charged twice for the same app. Please cancel only my 2nd subscription and refund that payment. Thanks.
replyContent: We will be happy to assist you regarding the duplicate subscription. Please contact us from your premium account under settings-> support :)

content: Any.do - To do list & Calendar is hands down the best productivity app I have ever used! It has completely transformed the way I manage my tasks and schedule. The app is incredibly intuitive, user-friendly and has a beautiful design. The ability to create custom lists, set reminders, and integrate with my calendar has made my life so much easier. Plus, the sync feature ensures that I never miss a beat, even when I switch devices. I appreciate that there are advanced features available.
replyContent: Thank you for your awesome review, we work hard to make Any.do the best that it can be! How do you think we can make this a 5 stars review? We'll be happy to receive any feedback!

content: Great app. A couple suggestions to make it 5 stars. Would be good if the search actually found the item soi could drag it around as needed. Also ability to turn off alarm/reminder by default. Also Android app sometimes throws my task I'm trying to move around right down to the bottom and takes minutes to go find it then drag it back to the top
replyContent: We are not aware of any issues with the search feature. Regarding the drag and drop and the default alarm option, we will be more than happy to look into this for you and sort this out, should you send us a bug report (Settings- Support).

content: still would be a lot better if you had notifications that forces the user to snooze or dismiss. also I think it's a bad idea to have a "Done" button in an edit window of the task. you already have a place to result mark the task as done. this done button in the edit window is actually so much a pain coz that's the place anybody would expect an "ok" or "save" button to save the edit.

Love the app, but frequent changes to the UX are frustrating. I manage to get used to changes, develop some muscle memory, and more changes come. The new snoozing experience is very slow! It may be flashy, but it's just painfully slow, it's an added inconvenience. Please at least make it an opt-in feature.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! I will make sure to pass it to our Product Team for further consideration :)

content: Great app to be organized! (1) The whatsapp feature is fantastic - super easy to set reminders on the move, on the laptop via whatsapp web, & very effective to make sure I don't miss anything. (2) the widgets aren't great. I have a widget on my phone home screen/ Tab & the date doesn't automatically change so sometimes I'm looking at yesterday's tasks/calendar & I have to manually open the app - correct it... I can't seem to tick off the tasks from the widget. I have to open the app. Irritating!
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We are working on making improvements to the widgets in the near future and for the sync process all together :) If you have any specific questions, you are welcome to contact us at- https://www.any.do/contact_form, and we‚Äôd love to help you out.

content: I enjoy using Any.do! It is easy to set tasks and/or goals and since using I have gotten much more done!!
replyContent: Thank you for sharing! How do you think we can make this a 5 stars review? If there is anything that we can do to make Any.do even better, let us know at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: I like that my notifications will pop up on my laptop as well as the phone. Notes are easy to make and delete when complete
replyContent: How do you think we can make this a 5 stars review? If there is anything that we can do to make Any.do even better, let us know at https://www.any.do/contact_form

content: Love the app...it is very handy. I would like to recommend an improvement (at least for me)...I would like to be able to change the notification sound to something else other than the default one that is used for text messages and maybe one other colour for the free version.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! To change the notification sound in your native device settings. Go to Settings - Apps & Notifications - App Info - Any.do - App notifications - Reminder notifications - Sound. For further assistance reach out to our Support Team, at- any.do/contact_form.

content: I've used this app for many years with good experience. Lately the UX and complexity have caused some problems, nonetheless, new features have been very good. However, with the latest update I can no longer see tasks planned for tomorrow, a feature that was the reason for using this app to begin with. It's just gone with no possibility to configure it again. I do understand development of new features, but I do not appreciate removal of features that are being used. Great app, not for me anymore
replyContent: Please note that in order to sort the lists by timeline, you can simply go to the "All Tasks" view, or any specific list, and change the sorting from 'List' to 'Time' under the menu on the top right corner :) If you have any further questions, please contact us at https://www.any.do/contact_form.

content: One of the best apps there, recursive, monthly check list to do, even with sub-tasks. Good job. I'm giving just 4 stars because notifications are too much, you need to consolidate them in just one expandable and also because "do later" or "done" pop ups are a little strange, you can check a do later time for first one or something like that but not everything.

I used to love this (five stars) before you changed it. I was able to set repeatable tasks for each day of the week, but now if I set a repeating task today, for example, for every Wednesday, the reminder will come up today, not Wednesday. I want the reminder on the day I want. I am very disappointed. By the way, I won't use Any Do for my grocery list. I use a better one that keeps a running cost (including tax) for each store I go to.
replyContent: We are aware of this issue and working on an updated version that will fix it. Stay tuned! :)

content: Best wunderlist replacement with one major flaw. As far as a to-do list app it is pretty decent and has what you would want. It is very tricky to figure out how to disable all of the random notifications this app sends you. That is my major complaint, but once you finally get it all disabled this app is decent. The layout is a little messy, but the smart grocery grouping is nice.
replyContent: We'd love to get your feedback about what specifically you liked or disliked about the layout and the notifications settings, by writing to us at https://www.any.do/contact_form. We're constantly trying to provide the best possible app for our users, and feedback like yours help us do so.

content: Hi there, I've just started using the app and it's great! Just so that I already got the premium version! It's just great so far and I have nothing to complain about. The reason I'm giving 4 stars (for now) is for the fact that there's one major feature I really need that I can't find it on Any.do: The ability to setup a reminder for a different timezone. For example, I want a reminder to go off whenever US stock market opens (9:30 ET) independent on what country I am.Is that possible on Any.do?

I love this app but am having one big problem...while ticking off items with the app open the app often closes and has to be restarted. If I use the widget to tick items off it doesn't happen...but then I can't use the widget to create new items for all of my lists because there is nowhere to select the list I want to add to so a new item goes to the default list...so I have keep switching between the widget and the app. I submitted a bug report some time ago but nothing happened.
replyContent: Sorry for this! Please submit a bug via Settings - Support so our team can have this resolved for you :)

content: I have decided to delete my account, but in app that was impossible. I wrote to developer/customer support and the answer was indeed prompt and account was deleted
replyContent:
If you created your account with an external log-in you will need to create a password in order to delete the account. Our support team will be happy to assist you should you contact us at the following link: https://www.any.do/contact_form
We will always prioritize responding to customer requests and encourage users to reach out if needed!

content: This app is just great, it not only reminds me what I need to do, it really motivates me to do stuff. the only problem I'm facing, whenever I try to mark a task as completed, the task crashes, and then it updates and actually shown as completed, except this annoying bug, I love it.

1) It has a calendar feature but you can't customize the calendar events repetition as much as you can in google (can do daily but not 5 days a week all in one entry). 2) edit: figured the task sorting part out. Sort by time and collapse upcoming/tomorrow and it will just show your daily tasks. I like that. But it's still not worth paying for unless the calendar event customization is as good as Google's since that is free.
replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion. Our team is working according to a road map that we set every year, in order to keep the app simplistic. Every feature that we add is well thought out, tested and proven as valuable to our users. That said, as soon as our team will find this suggestion highly requested, we will do our best to release it asap.

content: Very useful, I am someone who constantly needs to write to-do lists for the day as I am forgetful and this app is simple and easy to use. I add a task for any particular date and cross it out when I'm done. You can also set times so the app reminds you, which is very helpful. I recommend so as to not use paper to write down lists all the timeüëç
replyContent: We work hard to make Any.do the best that it can be! How do you think we can make this a 5 stars review? We'll be happy to receive any feedback!

content: Absolutely wonderful. This app is so helpful. I love that it integrates with so many apps so easily. All I had to do was link my Google accounts and all my events were there. The only thing that sucks is that you can't share calendars the way you can share lists. It'd be great so that instead of having to constantly talk about it, my family could coordinate schedules right in this app. If not for that, I would've gave 5 stars.
replyContent: At this time, Any.do offers a Calendar Integration not an independent calendar. That said, if you integrate a shared calendar, you will be able to see its events in the app and others can integrate the same calendar :)

content: Great, but could have a "won't do" function
replyContent: You are welcome to post your suggestion on our UserVoice page: http://anydo.uservoice.com. Other users will be able to vote for your idea and give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: A Great app.  Nice interface.  However, it's missing the ability to sync other tasks/todo list such as Google's, Microsoft Outlook, etc.  The company shows good support but is missing an official user-to-user support forum... a method for users to assist in helping each other.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! We have been looking into a 3rd party API and integration with other software. We actually have a UserVoice page for this where you can add your support or subscribe to potential updates: http://bit.ly/2F48vXP

content: I like all the features in this apps like repeatable tasks, widgets etc. without premium account. One thing that bugs me and lead to give 4 stars is that the completed tasks cannot be hidden away. It could only be clear away. So if I still want to keep them, for the tomorrow tasks I gotta scroll pass all the previous completed tasks to see which is a lot if you are using for a while. It would be nice to have a feature to hide the completed tasks.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback you can vote for this idea here: (https://anydo.uservoice.com/forums/143587-general/suggestions/9396375-lists-show-hide-completed-tasks) to give it some extra power so we can make sure to look into implementing it!

content: It's a GREAT app. 4 Stars because I think one addition would be a way to have 2 identical widgets running without being connected. Like 1 widget set for my daily goals tasks (shower, laundry, gym), and the second widget for tasks I update and add throughout the day (pick up milk, get haircut)! That way i don't get overwhelmed by a single long list but instead have 2 smaller lists. I'm a "one screen all widgets" guy. Another addition would possibly be a widget calendar list, instead of having the 30 day calendar + each days events. Seems useless to have such a huge window of calendar days when I really just need to have a list of events of each day. Samsung calendar has this widget and it's perfect.
replyContent: Having additional widgets is a great idea! We've forwarded this suggestion to our product team for consideration, and if we see support from more users for a similar idea, we'll definitely look into implementing this.

content: Very good App to plan your day and works.
replyContent: We work hard to make Any.do the best that it can be! How do you think we can make this a 5 stars review? We'll be happy to receive any feedback!

content: This app used to be amazing for staying organised. It syncs with your Google calendar so everything can be in one place. My favourite feature was in the morning it will help you plan your day and choose what tasks you'll be doing, and it would play a cute jingle with a motivational message at the end. It doesn't do that anymore and now keeps trying to making me create a team workspace which is not why I use it.
replyContent: We uploaded a new beta version with fixes to the daily push moment notification. We recommend joining the beta community and in the new version setting your preferences for the daily push. To learn more see: https://support.any.do/super-users/. The fix will be released to all standard users in the next few days as well.

content: Beautiful app. Used premium for a while, but I just could not get over subtasks not being visible. Having to click into a separate screen to view subtasks is way too annoying. Also difficult to use with the Eisenhower method. Make subtasks visible in the list, and I might come back from Nirvana HQ.
replyContent:
Thank you for your feedback! We've forwarded it to our product team for consideration. And if we see more support for similar features from other users, we'll definitely look into adding them. :)
Thank you for updating your review.

content: 99% percent love this app! I would like the option to turn off the vibration that occurs when moving a task from one sublist to another. content: When I edit the notes section of a task, the editable field is very small, very hard to add something. content: Coordinates Humans üôåüèæ This app was my go-to until covid hit. Keeping my personal, consulting business, and day work calendars in one app was madness. I broke off my day work to microsoft .to do on a separate device. Any.do now coordinates my consulting and my personal and family tasks, lists, and bills. Its refreshing. I do have syncing issues for calendar events as well as a crash everytime I add people to invites when creating an event. Thats why I gave it 4-stars. Love it for tasks.
replyContent: We are unaware of any issues with editing the calendar, or adding invitees to events, so that sounds odd. Please send us a bug report via your app Settings - Support, we will be happy to get to the bottom of this for you.

content: I had this app quite a while back and wrote to Anydo that it was imperative for them to make it re-orderable... Meaning if it is re-orderable, you can simply move the tasks easily up and down in their order. When I discovered Google Keep... It had that component, so I started using it and I have been happy with it.. But I took a look at Anydo again, and was amazed that aspect had not changed. Anydo is a good app, and I would give it five stars if not for that glaring problem
replyContent:
Hey Lee, 
You can reorder tasks by dragging and dropping them as you wish. If you can't, please submit a bug report in your app via Settings - Support, so we can get to the bottom of this for you.

content: After trying literally every cal app on the app store this is the one. I've used Any.do a few times over the years but it was never quite right. This time they nailed it. It's a super simple UI but has everything you need without being annoying or overbearing. Very simple to use & figure out. 15 mins messing with it & I'm fully ready to go. I transferred all my biz meetings, personal sched. etc. In minutes. Definitely give it a try, even if you have before. It's totally worth it.

content: I love using any.do for organizing all my tasks! I use it as a master task list. While I don't use it as a daily to do, it's a good organizer and reference of all my tasks. This helps me plan tasks as far as 6-12 months. The ability to make lists and tag tasks helps me to run searches and find things easier. Thank you!

As someone who really does a bad job making to do lists, this app really makes making them a breeze. Traditionally I don't make lists, or planners, etc because of the overhead in doing so; I'd rather spend that time doing the things I know I need to do. For a while now I've tried to find an app that would change that, that would make planning a breeze. After trying SEVERAL planning/TODO apps, this one quickly rose to the top. The interface is clean and simple and adding tasks takes no time at all - literally seconds. And above all, the Any Do moments make re-organanizing those tasks VERY simple and constantly keeps you on top of everything but in a non-intrusive way. Keep up the great work!
replyContent: Wow! We're ecstatic to hear how much Any.do helps you! üòÑ Thanks for the support!

content: App is user friendly and does what is needed, and more, without being complicated. I've never had any issues with this app, and I've used it for several years via different Samsung phones. Being able to arrange items and list catagories is great. Being able to easily share a list is nice. I love that I can easily add and view notes on any chosen item. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed with Any.do. The app backs up data, as well, so I've never lost existing info when changing phones.
replyContent: We love our veteran users and are thrilled that you can rely on us to help you be organized, productive, and keep your information safe! Thank you so much for your support üòÅ

content: Fantastic UI with near perfect integration with calendar. I would love the ability to make tasks with no due dates that do not show up in the "someday section." Things like my grocery list and books/movies to read I don't need a date for and don't want them in the way when I'm looking at date-specific tasks. Edit: thanks for the reply! Not sure if I am missing this somewhere, but I would love to see the ability to comment on tasks. Would really help with communication with my team. Thanks!
replyContent: Wow! Thanks for the support! Also the "Someday" category is intended for tasks with no due dates. Anything with a due date will automatically fall into the Today, Tomorrow, or Upcoming section. The Someday section contains the remaining tasks which will have no due date. You can write comments in the "Notes" section of your task.

content: Love this app. I like to utilize lists to keep myself organized as well as to feel the small accomplishments. (Even on days when you can't get through everything it's nice to see the progress you're making) I use it for groceries, to do lists, tasks that will help reach a short/longterm goal, work to do lists, and more. It's great that you can have more than one list, set reminders, attach a file, add notes or a tag with priority. It's the best app I've found.
replyContent: Thanks for the awesome review! Glad seeing you're enjoying using the features! ü§ìüíô

content: After trying several different task app's, I came across Any.do for a few years ago. Since then I've have had no reason to switch. This app is easy, intuitive and customizable to fit my needs. From a development and maintenance POV, I have also found Any.do to be thoughtful in their updates for both mobile and desktop versions.
replyContent: Thank you for your support! :)

content: Truly the best planning app! I was looking for a planning app with widgets that can change their size. Was harder than I thought! I love that you can see everythubg even in the smallest widget. That was very important to me. What I also like is that you can see all your tasks in a time line sorted by time. This way I don't miss anything. Subtasks and notes are helpful. I like the separate feature for the shopping list! This app is super flexible and intuitive!
replyContent: Glad to hear that you're enjoying the features and that Any.do is helping you stay organized! We hope you will share the app with your friends and family so they can try it out too ;)

content: Amazing and very simple to use which is good for anyone with a busy schedule. Easy to Quickly put all plans for that day or as far ahead as you want. Jot down any reminder at anytime during the day in a few seconds or change anything already put in. Easy to share with anyone else if wanted. Easy to set up with any other calendar or app so it automatically saves in your to-do list. And quick, easy tips to help you with anything you need to know about the app. Love it!üíûüíØüíû

Anydo keeps priorities in front of you, allows you to continually add, prioritize, delegate, move, and adjust tasks, thoughts, reminders, events, etc. in whatever way makes sense to you. It's motivating to check tasks off as you go through the day. It can be as precise or as relaxed as you set it to be. It works best for me by giving me a place to capture and instantly prioritize and plan things as they pop up. I love that it keeps me accountable and motivated without forcing a rigid schedule.

By far the best planning app out! I just have one issue. I happily outdid the premium yearly fee, but upgraded my phone the following month. When I uninstalled and installed on my new phone, it recognized me, email, even old tasks, but did not transfer plan. Can someone please help me with this. Thank you. Keep up the good work!
replyContent: We're so glad you like Any.do so much! üòÑ For any issues with subscriptions/Premium, contact us at Premium@any.do. We'd love to help resolve your trouble.

content: I love this app. It has so much functionality. Moreso than I even know! I really like that it is a hybrid task/to-do list with a working calendar so you can have your daily tasks but also put your appointments and meetings on the calendar in advance. So many others seem to be one or the other. Plus it prompts you each day with a "Plan Your Day" sequence which is a nice reminder what is needed that day. I wish adding new stuff was included in the prompt, but i can let that slide. Thanks creators!

I reinstalled this program and now it works great. I think there's a bug when importing from Google calendar. (I submitted logs). Update- I decided against using this, the calendar integration is not as good as I had hoped. I can use Google calendar with better functionality for my purposes. I don't need separate lists, what I need is the ability to easily color code calendar entries and to add reminders. YMMV.
replyContent: I'm so glad that your app is working the way it should now! Thank you for your support!

content: I've tried nearly every other "to do" app available, and none of them compare to Any.do: even the paid ones. The feature that holds Any.do above the rest, in my opinion, is the unfailable reminder system. This app literally hijacks your screen to remind you to plan out your day or to complete a task. I'm sure not all would find this a necessity, but personally, a simple alarm just won't do. I benefit greatly from the forceful nature of this app. It's pretty amazing, actually. Good job!

Love this app! This is the only app that lets me move items around on my lists, like moving unavailable grocery items to the bottom. I also like that my completed items stay with me if I want, like my packing list, so after a trip I can make all items active again for the next trip without having to think of everything again. And the completed items on the grocery list jog my memory for the next shopping trip. I just use the basic app and am very happy with it.

I've only had this app for a short period of time and it's already made a HUGE difference in my day to day life. No more paper lists to obsess over, lose, or struggle to read because of my sloppy handwriting! I have a super hard time staying on track and getting things done, so this app is super helpful. It's user-friendly, it has a ton of helpful reminders and task/listing options, and it connects to my Google Assistant to do (and sync!) everything. Highly recommend!!

I never write reviews or endorse products, but this one, I have to hand it to any.do -great job. It's always seemed like a no-brainer to me that some one build a planner, calendar, and to do list all in one with the added features of being able to pin in attachments to tasks (and hopefully calendar events in the future....?) with a killer widget (hope to see the "my lists" section end up as a widget option someday too!), and sleek interface, I don't know if I've ever nerded out so hard on an app.

Love it! After the last 1 1/2 months of trying both Any.do and Microsoft To Do, I have finally settled on my Wunderlist replacement. Any.do is the winner by a landslide. I love the clean look, the ease of use, and the interface with my calendar. But once the search feature was added, that secured Any.do as the clear choice.
replyContent: Glad to hear that you're enjoying the features and that Any.do is helping you stay organized! We hope you will share the app with your friends and family so they can try it out too ;)

content: great app! unfortunately does not allow for notes about (or long descriptions of) sub-tasks, but everything else: tasks, topics, google calendar integration, etc. it's got everything to serve my needs in a very clean and visible UI. thank you for such an amazing app, definitely considering going pro once it becomes more integrated into my routine and I decide I need the extra features.

I've tried several different list/to do apps and none are quite as versatile as Any.do. I love that I can integrate it with my Alexa and add things to my shopping list. I also love that I can share and collaborate lists with my husband. The only sightly buggy thing I've encountered is trying to move a new list, made at the bottom of my numerous lists, to the top. It'll often get stuck and pre-order however it likes. If I go back and try a second or third time, I can get it to move

Started using this a long time ago, recently redownloaded after going through a period of not using any productivity apps and, returning to this app I love what they've done with it. The integrations to the calendar, the sub-task feature, the various categorization options, and the customizable any.do moment are all very useful and exactly what I was wanting from this type of an app. Basically it's good at what is does, and they update! It also had my old tasks, which was a good little chuckle.

It's not just a callendar! It's an excellent electronic version of a planner! In the callendar section, type events for every day of the week or month! Type in the location of the event and it will synch with your GPS! In the task section make separate list such a grocery list or regular list of items or tasks you need! Pretty cool and usefully for success in school, work, and personal life!

by far the BEST note app I have ever used the user interface is aesthetically pleasing and easy to grasp, the quick add to ur list button is reliable and unobtrusive, it allows you to integrate with calender and any other note taking app you may have been using before, u can separate the tasks and it automatically....nevermind just try it. it's fantastic! and that's just the free version. I haven't even tried the free trial yet. cool.

This app is really cool. one feature I would really appreciate is if you could allow events to be completed, or allow tasks to have durations/end times. A common problem I have is a task has a specific time and duration, but sometimes I don't get around to it at the exact time so I would like it to only be completed when I actually manually mark it off.

Honestly, I struggle with most reminder apps because they make too easy to get rid of notifications. This app forces me to choose between checking something as done, snoozing the reminder for a duration of my choice, or a "focus" mode that goes into that tree planting focus app thing. I like that it forces me to make an active decision about whether I'm going to put something off or not.

new user, so far so great! just started using and am on the premium trial period. already I think it will be worth the annual fee! I'm in love with the sorted grocery list that i can print or share with my husband. i also appreciate the "plan your day" that allows me to select which items in my to do list i want to accomplish today and which i want to postpone. integrating with my calendar is also very useful so that i can see my appointments, events, and to do list all in one place! AWESOME

content: The UI is clean and I love the widget, shows my calendar and tasks, I can toggle what it shows and add tasks or events on the spot through it. Then it also creates a notification that doesn't go away (you can turn it off) to remind you of tasks that is due, really handy for me as I usually forget to check these things.

The app is really excellent for organisation. It has a 'todo list' format, but you can set reminders for tasks, make them recurring, and add them to 'my day' which is a system which clears at a time you set each day. Peter Drucker says the best thing you can do is write six things you want to do tomorrow, today. You don't need to pay for premium, it's ¬£2 a month and only gives you colours, some flexibility in reminder timings, and location based reminders.

Any.do is a wonderful app! ü§© One of my favorite apps I have ever had! Most useful Todo app ever with fresh ideas. Only complain is that task addition list in "my day" might be a little bit better (loading time, placeholders, and padding). Also I would appreciate some repeated task list feature (like for gathering same vacation stuff several times a year).

content: It has widgets to quickly access all the task and can be used in the web too. I like to be able to add the tasks when i remember them, using my phone. I've been looking for a feature like My Day for 6 years now, where you can add tasks but you don't become overwhelmed with tasks you didn't finish in the same day, but still want to do later and don't want to delete, and having support for the smartwatch is just the cherry on top here, it's the perfect to do app, however, it would be nice if we had a bit more tags in the free version.
This to do list app is for serious people who want to manage their lives.Its got a learning curve.But after that it becomes the greatest time manager you've ever used.

content: Very useful features, very user friendly. Lots of flexibility, personalisation options. 'Quick add' tasks (without opening the App) from the home screen is a great way to create task when in hurry or something needs to be noted immediately... and many other useful features.

This app was great while I was working, and is great since I've retired! I have always kept my grocery lists on it; each list is for a specific store. I am able to share these with my husband so that we are always in sync with which items we need to buy and from where. I especially appreciate that I can focus on items that are urgent versus tasks that are important.
love the new design with the weekly view! so easy to see what's coming up and to keep myself on track :)
Very easy and flexible ordering. I've used this for 10 years and it starts and guides my day.

content: This makes my life so much easier! I have every store I shop at on it, & the minute I think of something I need, it's so easy to grab my phone & find the store in my Any.do app & put my item in it before I forget it! Have used it for years! I even have one place where I save my favorite quotes & sayings as I find new ones! Highly recommend!

I've used this app for years now to stay mentally organized and keep the chaos of my day to day a little easier to manage bit by bit. To-dos, shopping lists, a calendar widget for quick home screen reference. So many stellar positives.

content: I like that this app pops up in the morning to remind me of what needs to be done that day. I always need a reminder in my face or I will forget.

content: I'd like the tasks widget to order items by the reminder time. But, globally it's a very useful App

content: The calendar widget makes it so easy to set up tasks and schedule stuff. I can get most things done just from the widget, which makes your app much better than others.
Quality app easy to use. I use multiple apps but this is very simple to use.

content: Have been using this app for more than 2 years now. Was searching for an app which would seamlessly sync between mobile and laptop and found this online. Awesome experience so far. Just go for it.

Very useful App, easy to use and helps keep my to do list, grocery list, notes, calendars etc. all nice and neatly together. Push notifications are actually useful, with four different options when a task pops up. No ads that I have seen yet, and I only have the free version. Highly recommend!

I tried over 15 apps and this one is so far the best one I tried, even without the subscription. The design is good, it's super intuitive, not confusing. The options "All tasks" and "Next 7 days" are the "highlight" for me. I'd however improve few things, such as adding a second option for the calendar, which would be a timetable, an overview of the week. My biggest problem with the app is that there is no perpetual sub option, which I'd definitely choose and I'd stick with any. do for good.

I have tried numerous task apps. This one works the best for me. It's intuitive, and it has task and calendar widgets, that are adjustable to your phone's color schemes for your screen to remind you of your schedule and still be pretty. Only thing that could make it even better is if finished tasks would be moved to the bottom of tasks. Now they stay in their old spot, scattered all over the list.

A to do list where you can schedule each task in time with a reminder - or just keep it as a 'someday' - and easily switch in-between. Which is awesome! It has a super-low threshold to create a task, which makes you actually use it. Plus if you don't want to flip through menus to schedule you can just write date & time in plain language! Or speak it, using your Assistant. I know Any.do can do much more than this, but that's what I use it for. Oh, plus, also its intelligent grocery list!

content: Throughout my busy life, I've used a lot of task management apps. content: The best! I have downloaded tons of to-do-list apps and this is hands down the best in its class. Simple and intuitive UI, easy to use, flexible, powerful and highly customizable while staying simple to use and understand. I tried other apps and I keep going back to Any.do everytime. So far, really f'ing good. I've tried a whole bunch of different todo apps, I've usually ended up parting ways with them for one reason or another --- but Any.Do is seeming to work with me really well. I love its simplicity, the fact that there's an accompanying web-app, and that you get a fully usable app for free and that you can unlock bonus (really cool) features as the premium. Give it a shot. See if it's worth you. If not, don't settle. Find something that works for you.

content: I've been using the free version of this app for a few weeks now and really like it. The design is beautiful and intuitive. My favourite and most useful feature is the anydo moment. Once a day the app lists your to dos and allows you to decide when you will do them. This is great because it allows you to prioritize on the go. Also love how easy it is to see both the to do lists and the calendar. I like this app so much I'm considering using the paid version for extra features.

Eye candy to do list without bells and whistles. Workflow based on reminders, as for me, I wish to have a "my day" feature as in Microsoft to do. Best of all I love sync - it really takes seconds to syncronise 'done' tasks even with aliases. Also planning a day is a great feature, but it would be brilliant if it cover some tasks with no due date, or tasks that have been aded for a long time ago and not executed. And after all pricing is the most democratic among same apps.

content: i've tried a lot of to-do list apps and this one is by far my favourite. The best part is that you can schedule a time for it to prompt you to plan your day and then it goes through all your tasks and allows you to triage and prioritize. Easy to use, and has a great free version. I only upgraded to the paid version because I wanted more flexibility with scheduling recurring tasks. All in all, an excellent app to get your life, business and brain organized.
